loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, coffee, candy, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 38 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children now at their adult age. 

Eugenia has been earning income from her monthly pension as a surviving spouse for more than 5 years now. She is also earning income from her parcel of cocoaland. Eugenia earns approximately PHP 3,700 each month from this type of business. She has requested a loan to be use for the medication of her brother-in-law’s eyes, who is presently suffering from blindness. 

Eugenia has been a member of PMPC for more than 9 years. In the future, she hopes that her brother in-law will recover from his illness.

loans.use: to pay for medication.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 62 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijos independiente, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas, asaditos y refrescos.
Ella es generosa, amable, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘el retoño’ un área residencial, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Delia es de tez morena, cabello gris, estatura mediana, usa lentes de aumento para leer, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas, asaditos y refrescos, labor que realiza durante 2 veces al día; durante la mañana de forma ambulante reparte empanadas en diferentes comercios, oficinas y mercados en su automóvil, durante la noche atiende su local con los misma comida en su domicilio. “comencé mi negocio de comida en mi casa solamente por las noches porque en el día todos comen en sus casas, luego vi la oportunidad de entregar empanadas por las mañanas a pedido en diferentes lugares alejados en mi auto…” comenta. Su automóvil es un modelo antiguo y se encuentra averiado, esto le causa problemas en sus entregas porque debe contratar taxi y otros medios de transporte, ocasionado retrasos y que la comida se enfríe. Su sueño es tener un restaurante reconocido. Ella desea recuperar a sus clientes y entregar sus pedidos a tiempo, mediante la reparación de su automóvil. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Delia solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su auto con el que realiza las entregas de su comida para recuperar clientes y hacer sus entregas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Delia is a 62 year old woman, single, with 1 grown son. She has a business selling empanadas, steak tips, and soda pop. She is generous, friendly, independent, active, responsible and hard working. Her business is located in "el retoño", a residential area that enjoys a warm tropical and humid climate with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Delia has a dark complexion, grey hair, medium height, wears glasses to read, and her first language is Guarani and her second language is Spoanish, which she uses daily and for business. Her business is selling empanadas, steak tips, and soda pop, work that she does two times per day, during the morning as a street vendor delivering empanadas to different businesses, offices and markets in her car. She sells during the night at her locale, selling the same food in her home. She states, "I started my food business in my home only in the evenings because during the day everyone eats in their own homes. Then I saw the opportunity to deliver empanadas in the morning and per orders to different places at a distance with my car..." Her car is an older model and is in need of repairs, which causes problems for her deliveries because she needs to take taxis and other modes of transportation, occasionally delaying her and then her food gets cold.

Her dream is to have a well-known restaurant. She wishes to recover her customers and deliver her orders on time by repairing her car. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 7 years that she has had her own business. For these reasons Delia seeks a loan to repair her car with which she makes her meal deliveries in order to regain customers and make her deliveries on time.

loans.use: to repair her car with which she makes her meal deliveries in order to regain customers and make her deliveries on time.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 10 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de artesanía en yeso.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, emprendedora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en diferentes ferias de la ciudad como la feria de ‘Alasitas’ que es una feria artesanal, cuya característica principal es la venta de miniaturas con la finalidad ritual de que las mismas se conviertan en realidad. La deidad Aymará ‘Ekeko’ es el objeto principal de la feria. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-15 grados centígrados, durante todo el año. 
Teresa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la 1 de la derecha, chaqueta celeste). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos ambos estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Debido a la proximidad de la feria de Alasitas, opto por liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado, elaboración de empanadas, venta de carne de cordero y taller mecánico, para solicitar un préstamo y generar mejores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de sus familias. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de artesanía en yeso, como; alcancías, adornos, joyeros, ceniceros, platos, marcos de cuadros y otros. Negocio que realiza en puesto fijo de venta en diferentes ferias de la ciudad. “la feria de alasitas se aproxima y debemos producir con anticipación y en bastante cantidad, debido a la demanda…” comenta. Su negocio es parte de la tradición, los niños son muy afectos a las alcancías de cerdito, muchas son pintadas y otras son color natural la variedad es diversa. Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de estuco. Ella desea realizar la compra de moldes para realizar el vaciado de yeso y contar con gran cantidad de artesanía para ofertar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de moldes de yeso para realizar artesanía y ofertarla en la feria de Alasitas.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 33, is single and has two boys, ages 6 and 10 years. She makes and sells plaster crafts. She is patient, a good listener and a good mother, enterprising and hard-working. She runs her business in various markets around the city, including the Alasitas market, which has an annual artisan fair. Its known for the sale of miniatures that represent a person's dreams or goals. The Aymara deity Ekeko is the primary focus of the fair. The area has a cold, dry climate with a daytime temperature of 3-15 degrees Celsius year round.

Teresa has brown skin and long black hair that she wears tied back. Her first language is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish for business, among other things. In the photo, she is the first on the right in the light blue jacket. Her two boys are both in school, and they live in a home they rent. It is made from bricks and has water, electrical, and sewer services. Thanks to her close proximity to the Alasitas fair, she chose to join a bank comprised of people with businesses selling things like perfumes, soft drinks, chickens, empanadas, ice cream, goat meat and one person with a mechanics shop. They are requesting this loan so that they can earn more money to support their families.

Her business is making and selling crafts made from plaster such as piggy banks, decorations, jewelry, ashtrays, plates, picture frames, and more. She runs the business in set sales locations in different markets around the city. "The Alasitas festival is coming up and we need to have plenty of product to be ready for it, due to the demand," she said. Her business is part of the tradition. The children are very fond of the piggy banks. Many are painted while others have a more natural color. Her dream is to run a stucco plaster sales business. She wants to buy molds so that she can do plaster casting and count on a wide variety of crafts to sell. This is her first loan with the institution in the twenty years she's been running this business.


All of this is why Teresa is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy plaster molds so that she can sell her crafts at the Alasitas fair.

loans.use: buy plaster molds to make and sell handicrafts in the Alasitas fair

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jennifer is 37 years old and both of her children are in school.

Jennifer has a buy and sell of used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell to her customers and earn additional income from sewing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Berta Jazmina

texts.es: BERTA JAZMINA: Es una joven emprendedora y alegre, originaria de Waspam, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene un bebé de   un mes de nacido. Al no contar con un empleo formal decidió emprender su pequeño negocio hace 2 años. Con apoyo de su esposo construyó un anexo de madera en su casa de habitación donde estableció su pequeña pulpería en la que vende productos básicos, caramelos, galletas, generando ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar.  Está solicitando por primera vez un crédito para comprar más mercadería, para incrementar su oferta y mejorar sus ingresos también. Su sueño es llegar a ser una exitosa comerciante con un negocio próspero
texts.en: Berta Jazmina is a young, happy entrepreneur originating from Waspam.  She is 25 years old and married, with a 1-month-old baby.  Since she wasn't formally employed, she decided to start her own small business 2 years ago.  With the support of her husband, she built a wooden annex on the house that she lives in where she started her small grocery store.  She sells basic staples, candy, and cookies, bringing in her own income that she uses to support her household economically.  She is asking for a loan for the first time to buy more merchandise to increase what she offers for sale and also improve her income.  Her dream is to become a successful merchant with a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, candy, and cookies, among other things

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 45 years old and married with nine children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liza has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Liza has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and married with five children. With three of her children currently in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Wilber Saul

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 39 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
El se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sembrar maiz y lo necesario para sembrar, gracias a este podra mejorar los sembrios y sacar una buena produccion para vender y obtener ganancias para sustentar a su esposa. las compras realiza en la feria de San Miguel cada 8 días, en su tiempo libre le gusta visitar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 39-years old.  He is married and has no children.  He lives in Bolivar's San Miguel Province in the Salado Chico community.  He belongs to the San Francisco communal bank.
Wilmer makes his living in agriculture.  He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural supplies and necessities for planting corn.  Thanks to these items, he will be able to improve his crop and get good production from it to sell.  This will provide a profit to support his wife.  Wilmer makes his purchases in the San Miguel market every week.  In his free time, he likes to visit his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for planting corn.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 21 Señoras que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, madre de 1 hijo, ella es macatera, es decir vendedora ambulante, y a la vez trabaja de empleada en una pizzería, cabe resaltar que la es una persona muy activa que se esfuerza para poder ir creciendo y mejorando. 
Solicitó este préstamo para la compra de sus  productos  para la venta de  forma ambulante como ser prendas, calzados y demás, lo que le ayudará a mejorar su nivel de vida generando mayores ingresos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de ir mejorando sus vidas.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 21 women who indicated that they want a better quality of life, not only for themselves, but also for their families.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. She is a “macatera”, which is a traveling salesperson. She was previously employed at a pizzeria. It should be pointed out that Maria is a person who is very active because she is striving to grow and improve.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products that she can sell as a traveling vendor such as clothes, shoes, and other items. This will help to improve her standard of living since she will be able to generate more income. All of the group members appreciate the opportunity they have received to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other products that she can sell as a traveling vendor.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Feliciana continues working in the business of raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She is using this work as a way to establish a grocery store, since her dream is to have her own business.  She also wants to have a larger place that she can sell her animals from.  She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for the animals.  

She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for the animals.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Jenny is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenny has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bread vending business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell to her customers.

Juanita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lourdes has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, coffee, soft drinks, candies, etc.

Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Los Carambolos Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Los Carambolos" se ubica en una comunidad en la cual la mayoría de los habitantes se ha dedicado por generaciones a trabajar en el campo en la siembra, cuidado y corte de caña. 

El nombre del grupo se debe a que las reuniones se llevan a cabo debajo de un árbol de carambolos, una fruta exótica que tiene forma de estrella. Las integrantes y sus actividades económicas son:

Agustina -Venta De Pan
Laura -Venta De Pan
María -Cría  De Cerdos
Rosalía -Venta De Perfumes Por Catalogo
Alicia -Venta De Verduras
Blanca -Venta De Topereware Y Plata
Susana - Venta De Comida
Gerardo -Venta De Piñatas
Ana -Venta De Antojitos
Oscar –Servicio De Lavado De Autos Y Venta De Pan 
Hugo -Servicio De Alzadora
Karina -Venta De Perfumes
Isabel -Venta De Antojitos

Oscar está casado con Teresa con quien tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, anteriormente él se dedicaba a vender tortillas, actividad que abandonó hace dos años para abrir en casa su propio auto lavado aprovechando el espacio de su garaje, la idea la recibió de su padre quien siempre lo ha apoyado en todo momento. Entonces, invirtió un poco de dinero en una compresora, shampoo para auto y lubricantes. Además, de lunes a domingo a partir de las 7:00 pm sale a vender pan en su moto donde coloca un canasto al cual le carga 300 piezas de pan las cuales vende en aproximadamente en dos horas. Con las ganancias de ambas actividades ha podido cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Oscar está muy satisfecho con lo que hace “Si el cliente no puede llevar el auto a lavar con tan solo una llamada o mensaje yo voy por el”. Para él, el trabajo se recomienda solo y su esfuerzo le ha dado estabilidad a su negocio. Ahora, solicita un préstamo para comprar shampoo, cera, franelas, escobetas, cepillos, esponjas y equipo, entre otras cosas. 

El grupo agradece la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo el cual invertirán en cada una de sus actividades ya que las ganancias les ayudarán a ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

*La fotografía fue tomada fuera de la casa de la señora Isabel, Oscar viste chamarra de piel negra con amarillo.
texts.en:
The "Los Carambolos" communal bank is located in a community in which the majority of the residents have, for generations, made their livings in the fields planting, growing and cutting cane. 

The name of the communal bank comes from the meetings they have, which take place under a "carambolos" tree.  The fruit is an exotic fruit shaped like a star.  The communal bank members and their businesses are: 

Agustina -Selling Bread
Laura -Selling Bread
María -Raising Pigs
Rosalía -Selling Perfume from Catalogs
Alicia -Selling Vegetables
Blanca -Selling Tupperware and Silver
Susana - Selling Food
Gerardo -Selling Piñatas
Ana -Selling Snacks
Oscar –Car Washing Service and Selling Bread 
Hugo -Cane Harvester Services 
Karina -Selling Perfume
Isabel -Selling Snacks

Oscar is married to Teresa, with whom he has an 8-year old son.  He formerly made his living selling tortillas, a business he gave up two years ago to open his own car wash.  He operates it out of a space he has available in his garage.  Oscar got the idea from his father, who has always supported him in everything.  He invested a little money in a compressor, car wash and lubricants.  In addition, from Monday to Sunday, starting at 7:00 pm, he goes out to sell bread on his motorcycle.  He puts a basket of 300 pieces of bread on the motorcycle and sells them in about two hours.  With the earnings from both businesses, Oscar has been able to cover the needs of his household. 

Oscar is very satisfied with what he does.  He says, "If the customers can't bring the car to be washed, with just a call or a message, I go get it myself."  For him, the business sells itself, and the effort Oscar has put into it has brought stability to the business.  The loan he is now requesting is so he can purchase shampoo, wax, flannels, corn husk brushes, brushes, sponges and equipment, among other items. 

The communal bank is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan, which will be invested in each of the members' businesses.  The profits will help them to offer a better quality of life to their families. 

*The above photograph was taken outside of señora Isabel's house.  Oscar is wearing a black and yellow leather jacket.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, wax, flannels, corn husk brushes, brushes, sponges and equipment.

loans.name: Nelly Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una señora que tiene unión libre con un señor que se dedica a la agricultura, Guadalupe tiene 2 hijos, una de 6 años y el niño de 12 años de edad, mismos que asisten  a la escuela, Guadalupe es  una madre muy amorosa con sus hijos y a la vez que se dedica a cuidarlos también se dedica a  la crianza de animales menores que los tiene cerca  de la casa de donde ella vive, con el dinero del crédito ella va a comprar chanchos para mejorar su negocio y tener esa fuente de ingresos para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a woman who has a common-law relationship with a man who works in agriculture.  Guadalupe has two children, a 6-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy.  They are both attending school.  

Guadalupe is a very loving mother to her children and at the same time that she works taking care of them she also works at raising small animals that she has near the house where she lives.  

With the money from the loan she is going to buy pigs to improve her business and to have this source of income to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 33 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Claudine works very hard to provide for them.

Claudine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Claudine has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Claudine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Gustavo Andres

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Gustavo se dedica a la crianza de animales y al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, el vive en el campo y trabaja dando mantenimiento de el canal de agua potable de su comunidad, Gustavo vive con su esposa y con sus 2 hijos, en esta ocasión el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para que su esposa le apoye en el ordeño y venta de leche, la aspiración de Gustavo es de seguir trabajando, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para comprarse un  terrenito y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: At 47 years old Gustavo raises animals and works as a farm day laborer. He lives in the countryside and works providing maintenance to the potable water canal in his community. Gustavo lives with his wife and two children. Today he seeks a loan to buy a cow so that his wife can support him with the milking and selling of milk. Gustavo's goal is to continue working, improve his business, and save money to buy a small piece of land and help his children be successful.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hernaldo

texts.es: HERNALDO: Es un hombre indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originario de la comunidad de Saklin, que localiza a 30 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam Río Coco, tiene 45 años, casado con tres hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Trabaja como maestro en una escuela de educación primaria. Está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo para poder reparar las paredes de madera de su casa donde habita con sus hijos y esposa. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Hernaldo is an indigenous man, part of the Miskita ethnic group. He is originally from Saklin, which is located 30km away from the city of Waspam Río Coco. He is 45 years old and married with three teenage children who are in primary and secondary school. He works as an elementary school teacher.

He is requesting his first loan which he will use to repair the wooden walls of the home where he and his wife and children live. With this loan, he will buy planed boards and nails and pay for labor. His goal is to provide his family with a home that is both more secure and in better condition.

loans.use: repair the wooden walls of his family's home

loans.name: Mudia

texts.es: MUDIA: Es una joven  miskita, originaria de la comunidad de Saupuka; que pertenece al municipio de Waspam,  tiene 28 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos menores de edad. Es una pequeña microempresaria que tiene una pequeña pulpería en un anexo de madera que construyó pegado a su vivienda. Está solicitando financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de los productos de granos básicos, gaseosas entre otros, que vende en su pequeño negocio. Su sueño es llegar a tener una distribuidora de productos que le genere más ganancia y poder  crear las condiciones que le permitan a ella y a su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mudia is a young Miskita woman from the Saupuka community in Waspam municipality. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She is a small businesswoman who has a small convenience store in a wooden annex that she built attached to her home. She is seeking a loan to increase product inventory by buying basic grains, soda pop and other items to sell in her small business. Her dream is to be able to become a product distributor which would generate more income and be able to create the conditions that permit her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to increase product inventory by buying basic grains, soda pop and other items to sell in her small business.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, born in 1987, is a Thai ethic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is derived from running a small business. She also raises chickens in order to earn enough to obtain food for her family. Although she is running a small business, the income is just enough to cover her family’s living expenses and save the little amount that is left. That amount is not enough to build the basic standard toilet, so she wants to take out a loan for this purpose.

She hopes this loan will partly help her family have better living conditions and she will work hard to earn the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to build the basic standard toilet.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALFA Y OMEGA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mochilas, venta de edredones, venta de busos, venta de artículos de ferretería, venta de ropa, venta de llantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de colchas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió posteriormente haber apoyado en el negocio familiar de su tía donde aprendió la venta de estos productos, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de colchas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Association "ALFA Y OMEGA" will commence its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Pamela is President. The businesses run by the members of the community association are numerous, but among them are: selling backpacks, quilts, sportswear, hardware, clothing, tires and vegetables. 

The loan which the group will take out will benefit the group of small microentrepreneurs of which Pamela is a member. She notes that this is the first year that the she has joined Pro Mujer, after witnessing the work Pro Mujer did with some of her neighbors and deciding to seek out the institution. Currently she has a quilt-selling business; she states that she established this business after having helped with the family business where she learned about the sale of these products from her aunt, and later decided to start her own independent business.

The credit that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wholesale quilts) that will be obtained from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell these quilts in her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and life insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quilts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, plantains, potatoes, carrots, and other produce to sell

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро 42-летняя жительница района Спитамен. Она работает по своей специальности - учителем и уже 10 лет как преподает в местной сельской школе. Муж Зухро является фермером. У них двое детей в возрасте 9 и 7 лет, они посещают школу. Зухро одновременно занимается и другой деятельностью. Последние 8 лет она у себя при дворе дома выращивает бычков и телят для продажи. Зухро нравится оба ее деятельности, и успешно совмещает их. 
В данный момент она собирается увеличить поголовье своего скота, так как в ее скотном дворе осталось всего два бычка. Она полагается на финансовую поддержку, чтобы приобрести еще пару скотов. Зухро очень хочет продвинуть свой животноводческий бизнес и увеличить его доходность.
texts.en:
Zuhro is a 42-year-old residing in Spitamen. She works in her profession: teaching. She has been teaching at a local village school for ten years. Zuhro's husband is a farmer. They have two children, aged 9 and 7, who attend school. Zuhro also does other work. For the last eight years she raised bulls and calves in her yard. Zuhro like both of her jobs, and she successfully does both simultaneously.

Currently, she is increasing her cattle since she only has two bulls in her barnyard. She needs financial help to purchase a couple heads of cattle. Zuhro really wants to promote her livestock business and increase its profitability.

loans.use: buy a couple heads of cattle.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos se dedica al negocio de venta de choclos, el socio vende en diferentes mercados, el socio por medio de este negocio le gustaría abrir una tienda de abarrotes, el es una personas muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar choclos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Carlos, works selling sweetcorn.  He sells it in various markets.  Through this business, he would like to open a grocery store.  He is a very enterprising person and he wants to get ahead.  He is requesting a loan to buy sweetcorn.

The borrower is happy for the loan and he is committed to fulfilling his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweetcorn.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a 33-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines and the mother of two children. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than eight years now. This is the source of their income.

Mabel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With a loan, Mabel and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Mabel hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El socio Bernardino se dedica al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende mantas y telares, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y ser un empresario prospero, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artsania.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar mantas y telares.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Bernardino has a business selling artisan products. He sells blankets and weavings. Bernardino wants to get ahead through this business and be a prosperous businessman.  He dreams of expanding his business. He seeks a loan to buy blankets and weavings. He is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy blankets and weavings.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is grateful that she was granted a loan of 30,000 PHP, which she used to purchase various grocery items needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and to meet her family’s daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods to sell in her general store. She will use a portion of this loan to buy ingredients for her small eatery in the front of her store. She expects a higher demand for groceries as Christmas is fast approaching. This will surely help her cover for her family’s everyday needs and pay for her children’s schooling. She is thanking both God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that she will be given. 

Elisa dreams of having a big grocery store someday. She wants her children to earn a college degree and become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.*

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en: Oeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Oeurn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: ANA: Es una mujer miskita originaria de Waspam Río Coco; es alegre y emprendedora; tiene 40 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que están estudiando su secundaria. Es comerciante, tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa y calzado en el mercado municipal. Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio aporta económicamente en el hogar y contribuye para la educación de sus dos hijos que estudian. Está solicitando un préstamo para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam y a incrementar sus ingresos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en: Ana is a member of the Miskita ethnic group and is originally from Waspam Río Coco. She is cheerful and enterprising. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Two are grown up and two are teenagers who are currently in secondary school. She runs a small business selling clothes and shoes in the city market. With  her income, she is able to economically support her household and contribute to her younger children's education. She will use this loan to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes. She will buy the stock in Managua and Masaya, which will help her sell her goods at a favorable price to her customers in Waspam, thus earning more income. Her goal is to run a big, prospering business.

loans.use: expand her inventory of clothing for sale

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: FLORENCIA: Es originaria de Waspam, madre soltera de dos hijos mayores de edad que estudian su carrera universitaria. Trabaja como enfermera, desde  hace 29 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar madera rústica, madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa de cemento que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Florencia is originally from Waspam. She is the single mother of two grown children who are now at university. She works as a nurse and for 29 years she has lived in a wooden stilt home. It is now in need of repair. With this loan, she will purchase rough wooden planks, planed boards, wooden posts, and nails and she will pay for labor. Her goals is to have a cement home which will provide better conditions for her children and, above all, greater security.

loans.use: buy supplies and labor to repair her home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años de edad tiene 4 hijos viven en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar, ella es empleada doméstica y tambien se dedica a la cria de animales por lo que solicita el cerdito para la compra de gallinas para engordarlas y venderlas. Realiza las compras en Guaranda en el Mercado 24 de Mayo cada semana. 
Su sueño es tener un galpon grande de gallinas y llegar a producir huevos. En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en: Rosa is 50 years old and has 4 children. They live in the Guaranda province of Bolivar. Rosa works as a domestic servant as well as raising animals. She is requesting this loan to buy chickens to fatten and sell. She buys chickens in Guaranda in the market on 24 de Mayo street each week. Rosa's dream is to have a big hen house and produce eggs. In her free time, she likes to weave.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia Lucy se dedica al negocio de venta de gelatinas y también la socia vende huevo sancochado,ella vende en las diferentes calles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los huevos y gelatinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gelatinas y huevos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucy has a business selling gelatins and she also sells parboiled eggs. She sells on different streets, working from 8 AM until 5 PM. Through this business Lucy wants to get ahead, and she dreams of having a local where she can sell eggs and gelatins. Lucy seeks a loan to buy gelatins and eggs. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy gelatins and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petronila es soltera, y se desempña como maestra de educacion primaria desde hace 14 años de laborar
esta señora tiene la urgencia de construir un cuarto de habitacion por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina ceprodel para  solocitar el tercer financiamiento el que lo invertiria en la compra de laminas de  5 zinc , 20 ladrillos, 15 bolsas de cemento, 4 metros de arena medio quintal de hierro y pago de mano de obra. los que vendria a mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en: Petronila is single. She has worked as a primary school teacher for 14 years. She urgently needs to build a bedroom, which was her motive for approaching the Ceprodel office to request a third loan. She will invest it in the purchase of 5 sheets of zinc metal, 20 bricks,15 bags of cement, 4 meters of sand, 46 pounds of iron, and to pay for labor. These items will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheets of zinc metal, 20 bricks,15 bags of cement, 4 meters of sand, 46 pounds of iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her previous11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Cristy is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to by additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cristy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to by additional fishing net

loans.name: Flor Del Valle Group

texts.es: Con la necesidad de recibir un financiamiento acorde a la situación económica actual, surge un grupo solidario llamado “Flor del Valle” integrado por tres mujeres que demuestran que estando solteras son capaces de poder mantener a sus familias mediante sus negocios, y que con esfuerzo, dedicación, disciplina y mucha responsabilidad han podido mantener por muchos años. Este grupo es coordinado por Florentina una mujer, luchadora y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ella hace y vende nacatamales (un plato típico del país), en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años, esta mujer a sus 50 años de edad demuestra que el trabajo dignifica. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos cerdos en pies y así aumentar la producción. Las otras dos integrantes son, Rosa quien fue criada y formada en un ambiente laboral del mercado, aprendió que la vida está llena de responsabilidades y a sus 61 años aun persevera en su negocio que es la venta de comida desde hace veinte años, y Josefa una señora de 53 años que ha dedicado treinta años de su vida a la comercialización de diversos productos como frijol, cuajadas y frutas de forma ambulante en el mercado de Masaya. Estas tres mujeres con negocios, edades y hogares diferentes, se complementan con un solo pensamiento, el formar un grupo con el objetivo de seguir trabajando, luchando y honrando su trabajo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Flor del Valle" (Flower of the valley) arose because of the group members´ need to receive financing due to their current financial situation. The group is made up of three women who demonstrate that, as single women, they are able to support their families through their businesses, and with effort, dedication, discipline, and much responsibility, they have been able to support them for many years. 

This group is coordinated by Florentina, a woman who is a fighter and is very eager to work. For ten years, she has made and sold nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish) in the market of the municipality. This woman, at 50 years of age, demonstrates that work dignifies. She is requesting the loan to buy two live pigs and thus increase production. 

One of the other two group members is Rosa, who was taught in a labor market environment, learning that life is full of responsibilities. At 61, she still perseveres in her business selling food after 20 years. The other is Josefa, a 53-year-old woman who has dedicated 30 years of her life to the sale of different products such as beans, milk curd and fruit, on foot in the market of Masaya. 

These three women, with different businesses, ages, and homes, complement each other in only one way: the idea of forming a group with the objective of continuing to work, fight and honor their jobs.

loans.use: to buy two live pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and married with four children. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, etc.

Corazon has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Nora Amelia

texts.es: Nora tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 años vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar,ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, solicita el credito para la compra de un carrito de helados para salir a vender en las escuelas y por las calle los helados. Su sueño es arreglar su casa y tener un local grande para poder  vender el producto que realiza, En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en: Nora is 34 years old, married, and has lived in Guaranda province in Bolivar for 4 years. She makes and sells ice creams. She seeks a loan to buy an ice cream cart to go out and sell her ice cream at schools and on the street. Her dream is to fix her home and have a large locale to be able to sell the products she makes. In her free time Nora enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream cart.

loans.name: Nancy Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una señora tranquila y trabajadora, tiene 28 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 7 años y una niña de 9 años, mismos que asisten a la escuela, Yolanda se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores y este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, lo que Yolanda aspira es seguir en la crianza de sus chanchos para comercializarlos y de ahí que le quede ganancia para cubrir los gastos de educación y demás gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a quiet and hardworking woman, who is 28 years old and has a 7-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter who both attend school. Yolanda makes a living working for a daily wage raising young animals and this loan will be invested to purchase pigs. Yolanda aspires to continue raising her pigs in order to sell them and in this way use the profits to cover educational and other expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
As a parent of eight children, Araceli works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from culturing seaweed. Araceli is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Marbini

texts.en:
Marbini is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marbini has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Marbini has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Narciza Concepcion

texts.es:
Narciza tiene 48 años de edad es divorciada tiene tres hijos vive en San Miguel Povincia de Bolivar en la Comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco,
Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo tambien se dedica a la cria de ganado, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y para pagar el arriendo del terreno, gracias a este credito podra sembrar mas y obtener una buena produccion, el realiza las compras en San Miguel cada semana, su sueño es mejorar cada dia mas y en su  tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Narciza is 48 years old. She is divorced, and she has three children. She lives in the Salado Chico community in San Miguel, which is located in the Bolivar province. She is a member of the San Francisco communal bank.

She makes a living in agriculture, cultivating corn and wheat. In addition, she raises cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the rent of the land. With this loan, she will be able to plant more and to obtain a good yield. She makes her purchases in San Miguel every week. Her dream is to improve more every day. In her spare time, she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HIPERBANCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Violeta, la socia tiene 33 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia se dedica a ejercer su carrera de docente del nivel primario, la socia trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de viveres para su hogar como arroz,azucar entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the “Hiberbanco” Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The featured member is Violeta.  She is 33 years old, has two children, and is married.  She works as a primary level teacher.  She works in one of the schools in the city of Cusco.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

The featured member is requesting a loan to buy some provisions for her home, such as rice and sugar, among others.

The group members that appear in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting, due to work reasons.

The featured member thanks those who are taking part in her dream through these means, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her home, such as rice and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running general store.  Clarita is taking out a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to stock and to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her previous four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock and to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 blocks and 3 bags of cement.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Editha has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Editha has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Editha has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Deyvis

texts.es:
El socio Deyvis se dedica al negocio de artesania, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio vende diferentes tejidos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Deyvis works in a crafts business. He sells cloth, sweaters, looms and traditional fabrics. He sells different kinds of cloth. He works from 8am to 7pm. He has been in this business for 8 years and it's going well. He dreams of expanding his business selling cloth and traditional fabrics. He is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics, sweaters and looms.

He is happy with the loan and commits to making the agreed repayments.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
Simona is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living by making and selling pots made of recycled tires. She is married with four dependents.  Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 7. 

Simona has requested a loan to buy materials like recycled tires and wire. These will help her produce more pots to sell. With these, her income will slowly increase and she will be able to pay for household expenses. She will be able to provide a healthy diet and better living conditions for her family.

She is hoping that in the long run, she will handle her business properly for a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like recycled tires and wire.

loans.name: Ruth Morelia

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive con su cónyuge y sus 02 hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como pavos, patos y gallinas para su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esta inversión Ruth espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes lo que tendrá una gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth, 19, is in a common-law relationship. Her family is united. She lives with her spouse and their two children in the rural area of the Oyotún district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The primary economic activities carried out in the district are agriculture, livestock and trade. 

She makes a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens, pigs, and more. Her business is located in her own house. She has more than two years of experience in this business and very good personal and work-related references in the area.

This loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals - such as turkeys, ducks and hens - for her business. It will also be used to buy balanced feed for their fattening. With this investment, Ruth hopes to increase her stock of animals in order to be able to meet the needs and likes of her clients, which will have a great influence on her level of income and therefore raise her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals for her business, and balanced feed for their fattening

loans.name: Riveros Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RIVEROS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pacesa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de fajas, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de chinelas, venta de helado, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pacesa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chinelas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años, al observar que este producto era ampliamente vendido en el mercado decide adquirirlo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chinelas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Association "RIVEROS" will commence its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. It consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Pacesa is President. The businesses run by members of the community association are numerous, but among them are: selling candy, selling food, selling belts, a neighborhood store, selling slippers, selling ice cream, and selling fruit. 

The loan to be taken out will benefit the group of small microentrepreneurs of which Pacesa is a member. She notes that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, on the invitation of a developer of the institution that visited her home. Currently she has a business selling slippers; she started this business five years ago. After observing that this product was widely sold in the market, she decided to purchase it. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy wholesale slippers) that will be obtained from the wholesale vendors in La Paz and sell the slippers at fairs in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she lives with her partner and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale slippers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell young coconut business and a general store. Norma is taking out a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 49 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Marcela works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like cereals, detergent soap, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beers, etc. 

Marcela has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, Marcela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like cereals, detergent soap, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beers, etc.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Cherlie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from cultured seaweeds. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Bunleang's Group

texts.en: Bunleang’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Bunleang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Taramaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAMAYA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cebolla,  venta de frutas, venta de flores, venta de carne, tienda de barrio, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres a quienes desde niña apoyaba,  con un pequeño capital, el cual fue incrementando poco a poco con los créditos obtenidos en Pro Mujer.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Association "TARAMAYA" will commence its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Lidia is President. The businesses run by the members of the community association are numerous, but among them are: selling onions, selling fruit, selling flowers, selling meat, a neighborhood store, and growing potatoes. 

The loan applied for will benefit the group of small microentrepreneurs of which Lidia is a member. She notes that this is the second year she has joined Pro Mujer; after witnessing the work Pro Mujer did with some of her neighbors, she decided to seek out the institution. Currently she has a business growing potatoes; she set forth to establish this business many years ago, having learned the business from her parents whom she helped from a young age. She started the business with a small amount of capital, which increased little by little with loans obtained through Pro Mujer. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy wholesale seed) obtained from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later after cultivating the seed she will sell the potatoes in her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale seed

loans.name: Santusa Valentina

texts.es:
Santusa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos 2 varones de 15, 17 años, y una hija mujer de 21 años, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos artesanales hechos a mano como también a máquina.
Ella es independiente, buena madre, constante, responsable, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria de la zona ‘16 de julio’, caracterizada por el comercio informal donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor esta feria es la más grande de Sudamérica. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre los 2-18 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Santusa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de forma artesanal (a mano) como cuando empezó como también realiza sus tejidos a máquina, para luego comercializarlas los días jueves y domingos en la feria ’16 de julio’ Su prendas más solicitadas son; chompas, chalecos, bufandas, guantes, gorros y otros. “Aquí hace mucho frío y mis prendas se venden todo el año, por eso tengo un negocio rentable y constante…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de confección de tejidos para ampliar su mercado y desea realizar la compra de una máquina de tejer para producir en mayor cantidad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Santusa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial para producir en cantidad.
texts.en:
Santusa is a 41 year old woman, married, she has three children, two boys of 15 and 17 years old and a daughter of 21 years old. Her business is making knitted crafts both by hand and machine.

She is independent, a good mother, steadfast, responsible, active and hardworking. Her business is located in the fair in the '16th of July' area, which is known for its informal market where you can find anything from a sewing needle to a tractor. This is the biggest fair in South America. It has a cold, dry climate with a variable temperature from 2-18 degrees centigrade during the day throughout the whole year.

Santusa has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, short stature, she wears traditional clothing (a hat, manta shawl and skirt), her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for work. Her business is making textiles using traditional methods (by hand). When she started, she also made her textiles with a machine, which she then sells on Thursdays and Sundays at the July 16th Fair. Her most sought-after items are; sweaters, vests, scarves, gloves and hats, amongst others.

"Here it is very cold and my garments are sold year round, so I have a profitable and steady business..." she says. 

Her dream is to have a textiles workshop to increase her market, and she wants to purchase a knitting machine to produce a greater quality. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has been in this business.

For these reasons, Santusa is requesting a loan to buy an industrial knitting machine to produce a greater quantity.

loans.use: to buy an industrial knitting machine.

loans.name: Windy

texts.en:
Windy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells basic household merchandise like coffee, noodles, sugar, powdered milk, toothpaste, eggs and soap. She has been operating a store for five years now. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs to improve her income. She is a married woman with three dependents who are 17, 15 and 4 years of age respectively.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries and pig feed. With these, she could fill her store with a variety of items and, in a few months, she could raise and sell healthy pigs.  In this way, she could earn enough to set aside some savings for the education of her children.

Windy dreams to expand her business and to make it productive for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and pig feed.

loans.name: Segunda Lucero

texts.es:
Segunda Lucero tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su cónyuge y sus 02 menores hijos de edades 11 y 03 años, en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de aves menores como gallinas y patos, las compras las realiza en los caseríos aledaños y las ventas las realiza a restaurantes así como en el mercado de abastos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de comida, bebidas y golosinas en los colegios del distrito donde obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permitirán solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de aves como gallinas, pavos, patos, entre otros, para su negocio, con esto Segunda Lucero espera obtener mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segunda Lucero is 34-years old. She is married and lives in her own home, which is constructed with rustic materials. She lives with her husband and two dependent children, who are 11- and 3-years old respectively. They live in a rural part of Pucará District, which is located in Jaén Province and Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Perú. The people who live in the district make their livings primarily in agriculture, livestock and running shops.

Segunda Lucero makes her living raising and selling small birds, like hens and ducks. She makes her purchases in the surrounding villages and sells to restaurants and in the wholesale market. Additionally, Segunda Lucero earns her living selling food, drinks and sweets in the district high schools. It earns her an additional income, which will allow her to pay off loan without any problems. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of birds, such as hens, ducks and others, for her business. With that purchase, Segunda Lucero hopes to earn a better income and thereby improve her own quality of life as well as her family's.

loans.use: to purhcase a greater quantity of birds, like hens, turkeys, ducks and others, for her business.

loans.name: Everilda

texts.en:
Everilda is 45 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Everilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Everilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат 54 года. Она работает в детском саду своего района Спитамен и получает маленькую зарплату, что едва хватает на семейные расходы. Она решила улучшить финансовое положение семьи и для этого намерена параллельно начать новый бизнес. Малохат будет заниматься откормом и продажей скотов. При дворе дома у них имеется хороший сарай для содержания скотов. Чтобы начать свой бизнес, Малохат не хаватает начального капитала. Она просит в кредит недостающую сумму, чтобы приобрести двух голов крупнорогатого скота и корма для них. Поддержите Малохат в ее начинаниях.
texts.en: Malohat  is 54. She works in a kindergarten in Spitamen and earns a small salary that is barely enough to cover the family's expenses. She decided to improve the family's financial situation, so she is going to start a new business. Malohat will fatten and sell cattle. In her yard, she has a good barn for cattle. Malohat does not have the money to start a business. She is asking for a loan to purchase two heads of cattle and feed for them. Support Malohat in her endeavors.

loans.use: buy two cows and feed for them.

loans.name: Géminis Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes de “Géminis” se conocen desde hace varios años, entre ellos hay un lazo de amistad muy grande lo que ha resultado en un grupo de préstamo sólido. 
Amalia es una mujer amable y trabajadora de 50 años de edad, está casada con el señor Agustín quien trabaja como empleado en una gasolinera y tienen tres hijos aunque ya solamente uno depende de ellos.
Desde hace 8 años Amalia tiene un pequeño negocio de trastes desechables y plásticos que inició porque ella y Agustín tenían un pequeño ahorro y sabían que debían invertirlo en alguna actividad económica; se decidieron por este tipo de mercancía porque se trata de artículos no perecederos que pueden conservar por más tiempo.
Al principio, Amalia ofrecía los productos de casa en casa con sus vecinos y con sus ganancias pudo rentar un local y más tarde acondicionó una parte de su casa para acomodar su mercancía. Cada mes, ella viaja a otras ciudades donde encuentra precios muy accesibles para poder comprar en cantidades grandes. Actualmente, doña sólo le dedica tiempo al negocio por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se encarga de las tareas domésticas, pero no le gustaría dejar su actividad ya que es una manera de apoyar a su esposo y poder pagar los gastos de la escuela de su hijo a Doña Amalia le gustaría tener más capital para invertir. 
Las demás integrantes también se muestran muy contentas y agradecidas con el apoyo de Kiva y VisionFund porque los créditos les han ayudado a sacar adelante a sus familias e invertir en sus respectivos negocios: Erica y Saturnina invertirán en venta de ropa; Jessica, en su herreria; Ofelia, en cerdos y pollos; Ma Felisa, en becerros; Carmen, en su taquería; Lidia, en cerdos y Don José, en colchas. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Erica y Don José, se pueden apreciar algunas colchas de las que vende Don José y la bicicleta que usa para hacer sus recorridos en las tardes.
texts.en:
The members of the “Géminis” (Gemini) communal bank have known each other for a number of years. They have a very strong bond of friendship, which has resulted in a solid communal bank.

Amalia is a friendly and hard-working woman. She is 50-years old and married to señor Agustín, who works as an employee at a gas station. They have three children, only one of whom is still dependent on them.

For eight years, Amalia has had a small disposable plates and plastics business. She started the business because she and Agustín had a little savings that knew they should invest in a financial activity. They decided on this type of merchandise because it deals with non-perishable items that can keep for a longer period of time.

At first, Amalia sold her products door to door to her neighbors. With her profit, she was able to rent a store front. Later, she set up a part of her house to accommodate her merchandise. Every month Amalia travels to other cities, where she finds affordable prices that allow her to make larger quantity purchases. Currently, she only dedicates the afternoons to her business, as she spends her mornings taking care of her household chores. However, she doesn't want to give up her business, as it is a way to help her husband and to pay for her son's educational expenses. Doña Amalia would like to have more capital to invest.

The other communal bank members are also very happy about and grateful for Kiva's and VisionFund's support.
