The loans have helped them to get their families ahead and to invest in their respective businesses. Erica y Saturnina will invest in clothing sales; Jessica in her blacksmith's; Ofelia in pigs and chickens; Ma Felisa in bull calves; Carmen in her taco stand; Lidia in pigs and don José in bedspreads.

*The above photograph was taken at Erica and Don José's house. You can see some of the bedspreads that don José sells and the bicycle he uses to make his rounds in the afternoons.

loans.use: to purchase plastics and disposable items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 33 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Christy is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Christy has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Emily is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and gasoline.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una niña, no estudió debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para pagarle el estudio. Es comerciante y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, hoy en día es dueña de un pequeño negocio en el que vende verduras y tiene dos trabajando de esta manera gracias a que una de sus tías le enseño acerca de este negocio y su manejo, esta es su única fuente de  ingresos para mantenerse ella y su hija.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, debido a la época navideña ella quiere abastecerse con más verduras, pues la demanda en este mes es bastante grande y deja buen margen de ganancias.
Blanca, sueña con tener un negocio que le dé más ingresos para tener una vida tranquila y por supuesto  apoyar a su hija en el estudio y que pueda ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Blanca is 34 years old, a single mother with a daughter, she didn't go to school because her parents did not have the financial resources to pay for her studies. She is a merchant and with a lot of effort and sacrifice she has been able to pull through. Currently she is the owner of a small business where she sells fruit and has two employees working there.Thanks to one of her aunts who taught her about this business and how to run it, it is her only source of income to support her and her daughter.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, due to the Christmas period she wants to stock up with more fruit as the demand in this month is high and she can get good profit margins.

Blanca dreams of having a business that gives her a higher income to live a peaceful life and of course to support her daughter in her studies and so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit.

loans.name: Flora Aurora

texts.en:
Flora Aurora is 46 years old with seven children.

Flora Aurora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Flora Aurora has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from processed food.

Flora Aurora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery es una mujer de 40 años de edad casada, madre de tres hijos y y sigue con la actividad de empleada asalariada, anteriormente saco crédito con la institución para la instalación de agua potable ya que sus hijos tengan que caminar varios kilómetros en busca de este preciado elemento, por este motivo solicita un nuevo crédito ya que si es bien que tiene agua potable en su domicilio con este crédito desea instalar a sus distintas de pendencias cono baño, ducha y cocina y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para terminar la instalación de agua en su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three children. She continues to work as a salaried employee.

Rosmery previously received a loan from Emprender for the installation of clean water since her children have to walk several kilometers to obtain this precious resource. For this reason, she is requesting another loan. Since having clean water in her home is beneficial, she will use this loan to install other water connections for the bathroom, shower, and kitchen. This will provide greater convenience for her family.

It is for these reasons that Rosmery requests a loan in order to finish the water connection for her home.

loans.use: to complete the water connection installation in her home.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a single 20-year-old woman and she lives with her beloved grandparents who help her with many of her needs. For the last year, Pamela has a little grocery store and it is located at her grandparents house.

Pamela needs a loan in order to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil and food cans for her business in order to improve the quality of life of their family Her grandparents hope that Kiva helps Pamela to become an independent woman.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil and food cans for her business

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Давлатой проживает в городке Турсунзаде. Ей 58 лет. Давлатой замужем. В браке у нее имеется трое детей. Муж является пенсионером. Давлатой занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она на участке земли выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. На данный момент многие жители заканчивают посев. Давлатой уже закончила посев урожая и ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый урожай. Но на приобретения достаточного количества минеральных удобрений у нее недостаточно средств. И по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Davlatoy lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 58 years old. Davlatoy is married. She has three children from the marriage. Her husband is on a pension. Davlatoy works in agriculture. She grows crops on a plot of land. Currently, many people are sowing crops. Davlatoy has already finished planting her crop and she needs to cultivate the land with fertilizer to get a rich harvest. But she does not have money to buy fertilizer. Therefore, she has asked for a loan.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase sales and buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Cyrenne

texts.en:
Cyrenne is 30 years old and married with three children.

Cyrenne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like milk, coffee, canned goods, and other groceries.

Cyrenne has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from fishing.

Cyrenne aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like milk, coffee, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María es soltera vive con sus padres en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco 1 . Se dedica a la agricultura hace algunos años, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y semillas para sembrar maiz y frejol.
Realiza las compras en San Miguel cada semana, su sueño es mejorar la siembra y comprarme un lote de terreno, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her parents in San Miguel, which is in Bolivar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco 1”. María has been farming for a few years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies and seeds for planting corn and beans.

María makes her purchases in San Miguel each week. Her dream is to improve her crops and buy a plot of land. In her free time, she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 62-year-old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elisa has a business selling root-crops and bananas in the Philippines. Elisa requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more root-crops and bananas to sell in her food stall.

Elisa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more root-crops and bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ginnalyn

texts.en:
Ginnalyn is 37-years-old and widowed with three children. Ginnalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ginnalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as condiments, candies, canned goods, beverages, etc..

Ginnalyn has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Ginnalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, candies, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru:
Наргис заботливая жена и мать. Она очень рада, что ее сын смог продолжить учебу в ВУЗе благодаря поддержке кредиторов Kiva и выражает им свою огромную благодарность. 
Сейчас Наргис снова нуждается в кредите для оплаты за новый учебный год сына в ВУЗе. Так как она и ее муж не имеют сбережений на руках, они решили получить повторный кредит. Дело в том, что все их трое детей учатся и соответственно семейные расходы тоже большие, поэтому они никак не могут накопить сбережение. 
Наргис уже оплатила свой предыдущий кредит и сейчас просит новый кредит в размере 1000 долларов США. В канун Рождества семья Наргиса верит и надеется, что и в этот раз они получат поддержку и их сын-студент будет успешно продолжать учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Nargis is a caring wife and mother. She is very happy that her son has been able to continue his studies at the university with the support of Kiva lenders, and and she expresses her gratitude to them.

Now Nargis once again needs a loan to pay for the new school year at the university. Since she and her husband do not have savings on hand, they decided to get a second loan. Because all three of their children study and their expenses as a family are large, they have been unable to save money.

Nargis has already paid off her previous loan and now is asking for a new loan of $1,000. On this Christmas Eve, Nargis' family believes and hopes that they will be supported and their son, a student, will successfully continue his studies at the university.

loans.use: pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction material to change the roof

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes de 45  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende: arroz, azúcar, huevos, frescos, churros, frijoles, lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc.
Doña María Mercedes vive en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de pespire  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María Mercedes está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como frescos, jugos, arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, café, aceite, etc. Con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio  bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del  2014.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own home. For 20 years, she has worked at the business of selling groceries. In her business she sells rice, sugar, eggs, beverages, churros, beans, dairy products, soap, chicken, etc.

María Mercedes lives in a community that is in the town of Pespire in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and who fights day to day to improve her quality of life.  

María Mercedes is asking for a loan to buy products to stock her store, such as beverages, juices, rice, sugar, flour, eggs, coffee, oil, etc. with this investment, she intends on improving her income and also her quality of life. She is an existing client who wants to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a well stocked business and at the same time improve her future with her family.   

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December, 2014.

loans.use: to buy beverages, juices, rice, sugar, flour, eggs, coffee, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anibal Javier

texts.es: Don Aníbal nació en un lugar llamado el sardinal en el año 1974. El solo estudió hasta primer grado de primaria por motivo de la guerra. Así fue que don Aníbal se dedico a trabajar en agricultura con su padre y hermanos, sembrando granos básicos. Actualmente Anibal está casado con Francisca y tienen dos hijos. Su hijo mayor le ayuda a trabajar en una tierras que tiene don Aníbal. El siembra café el cual lo trabaja con su hijo y su esposa; además don Aníbal trabaja en las fincas cercanas para obtener un ingreso mas para la familia y le da gracias a Dios que le da el pan diario de cada día. El con mucho esfuerzo ha podido realizar su casa en la que vive con su señora y su hijo, también compró un pequeño panel solar ya que en esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica, y el quiere obtener un sistema mas grande, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de otro panel solar, una batería y un controlador. De esta manera seguirá alumbrándose,  el  agradecería mucho si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo.
texts.en: Don Aníbal was born in a place called El Sardinal in 1974.  Because of the war, he was only able to go to school until first grade.  That was when he started working in agriculture with his father and his siblings growing staple grains.  Don Aníbal is currently married to Francisca, and they have two children.  Don Aníbal has some land, and his eldest son helps him work the land.  Don Aníbal plants coffee with his wife and son.  In addition, he works at nearby farms to earn an extra income for his family.  He thanks god for providing for him each day.  Through a lot of hard work, he has a house to live in with his wife and children.  He also bought a small solar panel, as the community he lives in doesn't have electricity for lights.  Don Aníbal wants a larger system, which is why is he requesting a loan.  He wants to buy another solar panel, a battery and a controller.  That way he will be able to keep illuminated.  Don Aníbal would be very grateful if he were given the opportunity for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, bananas, potatoes, vegetables, and other supplies for selling traditional street food.

loans.name: Jumilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jumilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Jumilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional items to sell for her buy and sell accessories business.

Jumilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and married with six children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 50 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Edita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks, and coconut wine. 

In the future, Edita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rosalva Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosalva tiene 28 años de edad es soltera vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar tiene un hijo es empleada privada y se dedica ala venta de joyas ya que tiene que mantener a su hijos por que es madre soltera. Solicita el credito para la compra de joyas para vender y mejorar la mercaderia. 
el sueño de ella es sacarse la loteria y darle una buena educacioón a su hijo. En su tiempo libre le gusta estudiar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rosalva is 28 years old and single. She lives in Guaranda in Bolivar Province. Rosalva has one child and works as a private employee. She also sells jewelry in order to support her child since she is a single mother. Rosalva is requesting a loan in order to buy jewelry to sell, which will improve her inventory of merchandise.

Her dream is to win the lottery and to provide a good education for her child. In her free time, she enjoys studying and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 59 years old and widowed, with six children. Leonida works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonida runs a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional assorted fish to sell.

Leonida has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 26-years-old and married with three children. With two children in school, Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Joan has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Soeurn works as farmer and she also does extra work as a construction worker and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: Somaly’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Somaly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller buy selling groceries at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families,save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира замужняя девушка из городка Душанбе. Ей 23 года. Она с мужем живет у родителей. Муж Нодиры занимается животноводством. Нодира сама в течение 3,5 года занимается растениеводством. Она на часть земли выращивает капусту на другую часть размещено парники, где тоже посадила овощи. Нодира закончила посев и самое пора обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить здоровый и богатый урожай. Нодира не смогла собрать достаточную сумму денег для купли минеральный удобрений, и она решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы не потерять урожай.
texts.en: Nodira is a married woman from the town of Dushanbe. She is 23 years old. She and her husband live with their parents. Nodira's husband works in animal husbandry. For the last three-and-a-half years, Nodira has been working in agriculture. On one part of her land she grows cabbage, and on the other she has greenhouses where she plants vegetables. Nodira has finished sowing, so now is the time to fertilize in order to get a healthy and rich harvest. Nodira was unable to raise enough money to buy fertilizer. Hence she decided to apply for a loan so as not to lose the harvest.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma  operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of goods such as noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, bread, biscuits, seasonings and soft drinks. She has been engaged in this kind of business just five months now. She is a 45-year-old married woman with two children who are one and nine years old.  Together with her family, she lives in Ormoc City.

Welma  has requested a loan to buy additional stock for the store, and pigs. These will be of great help for Welma's family; she can now raise and sell more pigs.

Welma hopes that she can handle her business well so that she may continue to finance her children's schooling  and improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store, and pigs

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 32 years old, married and has two children, two of whom are in school.

Arlyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional materials for fishing such as fish netting, bamboo and a fishing boat.

Arlyn has been fishing for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing such as fish netting, bamboo and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52-years-old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49-years-old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marilou has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Marilou requested a loan of PHP 25,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stock of ready-to-wear items.

Marilou has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Lhealyn

texts.en:
Lhealyn is 23 years old with two children. Lhealyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lhealyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Lhealyn has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Lhealyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 31 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Liza has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Harmogina

texts.en:
Harmogina is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Harmogina has a peanut butter business in the Philippines. Harmogina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business, like peanuts, sugar, oil, etc.

Harmogina has been in this business for five years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, like peanuts, sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida is 48 years old and married, with one child in school. Ma. Loida works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Loida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Ma. Loida has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Ma. Loida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of candies, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks and load wallet to resell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from videoke rentals.  Imelda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa works hard to support her family. Nilfa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nilfa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nilfa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Nilfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 38 years old, married and has one child in school. 

Rosalyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalyn has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Eleuteria works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Eleuteria is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Eleuteria has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El joven Miguel tiene 25 años y es Soltero, continua con sus estudios de  mecánica en una universidad muy reconocida de la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Miguel trabaja confeccionando prendas de vestir como ropa deportiva el tiene su taller que se encuentra en  la Zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, lleva ya tiempo con esta actividad,  este es su segundo crédito con la institución,  Miguel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una computadora laptop para  terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 3 años. Miguel enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse al 100% a su estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante. su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y seguir con la actividad de confección ya que con esta actividad está pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Young Miguel is 25 years old and single.  He is continuing with his studies in mechanics at a well-known university in the city of La Paz.  He works to pay for his education.  Miguel works making garments such as sports clothes.  He has a workshop in the "16 de Julio" neighborhood in the city of El Alto.  He's had this business for some time, and this is his second loan from the institution.  Miguel will use this loan to buy a laptop computer so that he can finish his studies, which will continue for 3 years.  

Miguel faces challenges, in that his work prevents him from devoting himself 100% to his studies.  However, this youth has the desire to continue forward.  When he finishes his education, he wants to work in his profession, so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.  He also plans to continue with his tailoring work, because this activity is paying for his education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Rocila

texts.en:
Rocila lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 42-year-old woman with three children aged 18, 16 and 13 years old. She engages in a food vending business. She makes homemade meals like pansit, which is very thin rice noodles fried with soy sauce, some citrus, possibly with patis (fish sauce), and some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables, and other vegetable menus.

Rocila is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like meat, eggs, seasonings, and vegetables, and to purchase a pig for a hog raising start-up. These ingredients will be used in making meals which she will sell in her local community.  In a few months, she will be raising pigs, and hopefully this will help improve her income. Because of these activities, Rocila will be able to pay her loans and other obligations. She will be able to continue sending her children to school.

In the future, Rocila dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, eggs, seasonings, vegetables and to purchase a pig for a hog raising start-up

loans.name: Diocena

texts.en:
Forty-eight year old Diocena engages in the raising and selling of hogs. She is a 48-year-old married woman with two children aged 16 and 19 years old. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Aside from that, she also engages in catering services. She provides food service to people in her community.
 
She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed and additional capital for catering services. These will help Diocena improve her daily income and continue to support the needs of her children. In this way, her earnings will become sufficient and she could invest in any possible business venture.

Diocena hopes that she could manage both of her sources of income successfully to improve the family's living status.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional capital for catering services

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre ecuatoriano de 65 años de edad de nacionalidad ecuatoriana  que ha culminado sus estudios primarios, se encuentra casado con María, juntos viven en casa propia, la misma que fue adquirida con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, vive ahí junto con su esposa, su hija y su pequeña nieta, desde hace muchos años en un sector llamado Pujili, lugar muy reconocido por ser folklorico en la ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi. Es propietario de una peluquería que está ubicado cerca del lugar en donde vive, esta profesión  la aprendio de su padre, la misma que ha heredado de su padre que lo enseño a temprana edad para así poder sustentar sus necesidades.
Llego a Fundación por recomendación de un vecino beneficiado, solicita un crédito para comprar un mueble para su local, los cuales le darán mayor facilidad para realizar su forzoso trabajo y obtener mejores resultados.
Agradece a Kiva y a Fundacion por la ayuda que se le ha brindado para asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto is a 65-year-old Ecuadorian man who has finished elementary school. He is married to María, and they live together in their own house, which they acquired through much effort and sacrifice. He has lived together with his wife, daughter, and small granddaughter for many years in an area called Pujili. This area, which is famous for its' folklore, is located in the city of Latacunga in the Cotopaxi province.

Alberto is the owner of a hair salon, which is located near the place he lives. He learned this profession from his father, and inherited it from him. Alberto's father taught him from a young age so that Alberto would be able to support himself.

Alberto came to Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation] after his neighbor, who had benefited from Fundación, recommended it to him. He is requesting a loan to buy furniture for his hair salon, which will better enable him to do his obligatory work and achieve better results.

Alberto thanks Kiva and Fundación Alternativa for the help they have given him to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his hair salon and as a result, give his family a good life.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old and has five children. For the past two years she has worked hard running a sari-sari, or general store, to earn an income. She also sells rice.

Marina has borrowed and successfully paid off four prior loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari, or small general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market to earn a greater revenue.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia  is a 46-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Rafia’s husband. He is a rickshaw driver. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Rafia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to replace tires and auto auto body of the vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Rafia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace tires and auto auto body of the vehicle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old and married with three children. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Marites has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, and groceries etc.

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Marly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marly has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and married with one child. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marilyn is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Marilyn has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Marilyn is committed to rebuild her business, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mardi

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mardi, a micro-entrepreneur from North Bogot, a suburban area in Bogor regency located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Mardi is married, and he and his wife have been blessed with a one-year-old son.

As the head of the family, Mardi's source of income is from his small shop, where he sells mobile phones and accessories, mobile phone airtime credits and a utility bill payments service. He met a Ruma field staffer who introduced him to Ruma about three months ago. He was very excited and decided to become a Ruma agent because he wanted to improve his shop.

For the last three months Mardi has been running his business very well, and now the demand for mobile phone airtime is increasing. Therefore, he has applied for a 7,000,000 IDR loan through Ruma that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. As the business progresses, Mardi plans to provide more mobile services to his community such as e-commerce for low-income communities.

Mardi is pictured above in his shop with his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services to his community

loans.name: Hafiz  Mai

texts.en: Hafiz Mai is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is highly skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years. She makes beautiful patterns with her hands. Her designs are much in demand and she is known throughout the town. To continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins, stones, embroidery scissors, frames, tracing paper, etc. In this way, she can cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins, stones, embroidery scissors, frames, tracing paper, etc.

loans.name: Sagheer

texts.en: Sagheer is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children. Some years ago she started her business buying and selling animals. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities, and needs to expand her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market, to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 44 years old and widowed with four children. With three children currently in school, Ines works very hard to provide for them.

Ines runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ines has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Ines would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and has four children.  Teresita is married and has two children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is a 35-year-old mother with four children. For the past four years she has farmed her small plantation in her village.

Menime became a member of SPBD in 2011. She has requested a 10,000 WST loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a water tank, shovel, rake, wheelbarrow, safety boots, hand gloves, chemicals and a pickup, all which she will use on her plantation.

Menime will use her profits to expand her plantation and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a water tank, shovel, rake, wheelbarrow, safety boots, hand gloves, chemicals and a pickup

loans.name: Cilsa

texts.en:
Cilsa is a hardworking mother who engages in raising and selling  hogs.  She is a 54-year-old married woman with three children from Talibon, Bohol.  Two of her children are still attending school. To augment her income, she also does farming. She toils the land and grows rice. Her husband works in a private company so he could help to meet the family's daily needs.

Cilsa is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy farm supplies like fertilizer.  Her farm will improve its yield, and it will produce a bountiful harvest. In this way, she could sell a higher volume of rice. She will have to set aside some savings for emergency purposes, and settle other obligations. 

She dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable, and also to improve their status of living as well.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Siiae

texts.en: Siiae is a 29-year-old mother with five children. She operates a small business, selling banana and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Siiae has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags to assist her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy undergarments, beauty products, and phone cards for her business.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food like fried peanuts and shakoy, which is a native delicacy and an all-time favorite afternoon snack or merienda here in the Philippines. Shakoy is a kind of twisted fried donut coated with caramelized sugar. 

Anselma is a 37-year-old married woman with four dependents. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like peanuts, and additional ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast. These ingredients will be used in producing more shakoy to sell. Her income will be augmented, and hopefully she could now start to settle household expenses. She could provide good food and better living conditions.
 
In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it successful. Hopefully it will help her family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like peanuts and additional ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast

loans.name: Richienita

texts.en:
Richienita is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Richienita works very hard to provide for them.

Richienita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, beers, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Richienita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, beers, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Richienita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, beers, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 45 years old, and has one child who is currently in school.

Thelma has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods like shoes, slippers, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers.

Thelma has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods like shoes, slippers, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 58 years old and widow with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years, and also earns an income from a lodging house.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed-farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings, plastice rope, bamboo, etc. for her business. Emelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, plastice rope, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and buys and sells dry goods in the Philippines. 

She has requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods like slippers, sandals, and shoes to sell. Thelma has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods like slippers, sandals, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Las Gaviotas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En una zona productora de caña, la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar para obtener azúcar, algunos pasan su tiempo en el campo, sembrando, cuidando y cortando la caña, mientras que otros transportan la caña en camiones o carretas hasta los ingenios donde es sometida a varios procesos para obtener el endulzante.

Otra gran parte de los habitantes se auto emplea iniciando sus propios negocios tal es el caso de los integrantes del grupo Las Gaviotas quienes día con día trabajan arduamente con el fin de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias con sus actividades económicas: 

German - Lavenderia
Enedina - Venta De Comida, Refrescos Y Perfumes.
Manuel - Instructor De Zumba
Margarita - Venta De Abarrotes
María y Esperanza - Venta De Comida

Enedina tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de dos jóvenes, uno de 15 años y el otro de 10 y vive en unión libre con Martín. Enedina sólo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta la secundaria, es por ello que tiene en mente seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que superen lo que ella logró, el futuro favorece a los que se preparan y sus hijos son su prioridad. 

Hace 15 años Enedina comenzó a ayudar a asu madre en la venta de comida corrida y refrescos debajo de un techo de palma construido frente a su casa. Con el pasar de los años y las ganancias obtenidas pudieron remodelar su vivienda, adecuando la parte frontal que es donde hoy en día continúan vendiendo comida. Al abrir el portón de metal en la mañana, dan la señal a los clientes de que la comida está lista. “Lo que más me gusta de vender comida es que estoy en casa y no descuido a mi familia además de haber aprendido a trabajar gracias a mi madre” comenta Enedina a quien siempre se le ve activa en el establecimiento atendiendo a los clientes. 

Con la intención de mejorar el negocio Enedina ha solicitado un préstamo para invertitr en más insumos para preparar los alimentos: jitomate, chiles, cebolla, ajos, cilantro, papas, aceite, frijol, carne y refrescos. Sus planes son hacer más remodelaciones al lugar para tener más espacio y poder recibir a más clientes. 

“Haciendo un buen uso del préstamo podemos hacer posible nuestros sueños trabajando hasta cumplir nuestras metas"son las palabras de la señora María madre de Enedina quien también forma parte del grupo.

*La fotografía fue capturada en la pequeña cocina económica donde prestan su servicio doña María y Enedina quien viste blusa blanca con puntos negros.
texts.en:
In this sugar cane producing region, the majority of the residents work in the sugar industry. Some of them spend their time in the fields planting, tending, and harvesting the sugar cane. Meanwhile, there are others who transport the sugar cane by trucks or carts to the mills where the cane undergoes various processes before it is turned into refined sugar.

There are other residents who are self-employed as a result of starting their own businesses. Such is the case with the members of the group named “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls). They work hard each day so that they can provide a better quality of life for their families. The members and their businesses are as follows:
• German owns a laundromat.
• Enedina sells food, soft drinks, and perfumes.
• Manuel is a Zumba instructor.
• Margarita sells groceries
• María and Esperanza sell food.

Enedina is 32 years old and the mother of two teenagers, a 15-year-old and a 10-year-old. She and her husband Martin are in a common-law relationship. Enedina only had the opportunity to study through high school. For this reason, she wants to continue supporting her children so that they can do better than her. She believes that the future favors those who are prepared, so her children are her priority.

Fifteen years ago, Enedina began helping her mother sell fast food and soft drinks underneath a thatched roof that was built in the front of their house. As the years passed, the profit they earned was used to remodel their home. They renovated the front part and it is still the location where she continues to sell food. When she opens the metal gate in the mornings, it signals to her customers that the food is ready. “What I enjoy most about selling food is that I can be at home without having to neglect my family. In addition, I have learned how to work thanks to my mother,” says Enedina. She always remains active on site as she attends to her customers.

With the intention of improving her business, Enedina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in more supplies for preparing meals such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, garlic, cilantro, potatoes, oil, beans, meat, and soft drinks. Her plans include making renovations to her place so that she can have more space and be able to attend to more customers.

“Putting the loan to good use will make our dreams possible, so we will work until our goals are met,” says Sra. Maria, who is Enedina’s mother. She is also a member of the group.

*The photo was taken in the small kitchen where Doña Maria and Enedina prepare food. Enedina is seen in the photo wearing a white blouse with black dots.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, garlic, cilantro, potatoes, oil, beans, meat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en:
Nikki Rose is 30 years old with two children.

Nikki Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, bread, etc.

Nikki Rose has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Nikki Rose aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and bread

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan is divorced, 27 years old, and lives with her two sons. For the past ten years, Loan has been running a general store and working in a local factory to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a four-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the third from left, wearing a blue blouse and green pants. 

Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Loan is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as rice, cakes and candies to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy food such as rice, cakes and candies to stock her general store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 25 years old and married with one child.  With one child in school, Mary Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, sugar, oil, etc.

Mary Joy has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Mary Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Herminia, una de las integrantes, se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de remedios naturales, es una mujer muy sacrificada que a través de este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que por medio de este humilde trabajo mantiene a sus seres queridos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios yuyos y volver a venderlos, lo que le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le señora de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Lucia” is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to succeed. They are female heads of household who are doing their best to grow and move forward.

Sra. Herminia is one of the members. Her modest work involves selling natural remedies. She is a self-sacrificing woman who helps her family through her work. Herminia says that she is very proud of what she has accomplished. Through her modest work, she has been able to sustain her loved ones.

Herminia is requesting this loan in order to buy herbal remedies that she can sell, which will be of great help. She appreciates the opportunity she has received since it will be extremely helpful.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies that she can sell.

loans.name: Iren

texts.en:
Iren is a 32-year-old married woman, with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Iren has a sewing business in the Philippines. Iren requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cloth, needle, etc.

Iren has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cloth, needle, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her stall to restart her business activities.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is 54 years old and has two children. She is a married woman.

Anacleta is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Anacleta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anacleta has been farming rice for 33 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anacleta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en: Thary’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Vatt's Group

texts.en: Vatt’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Vatt makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as farmer to support his family.  In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en: Thanh is 44 years old and lives with three children and her husband. Thanh and her husband run a business of buying and selling old motorbikes. Thanh also makes clothing to earn additional income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a four-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second from left, wearing a black and grey blouse. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Thanh is requesting a loan to repair her house and purchase old scooters for selling. She hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To repair her house and purchase old scooters for selling.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en: Sophorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sophorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling grocery items at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.en:
Tolgonai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of European Studies. Here is her story:

“I miss my childhood, when I had a full family and we could rest, chat and laugh together. People say that man is given so many tests as one can sustain. In our case, my mother should be so smart and strong person to have a thin time. I had my father, my mother, sister and brother. When I was 4 years old my father died in accident. After 10 years from that tragedy, we learnt out that my brother had a brain cancer and we lost him. There are no words to explain our feelings and grief that time. Still I don’t understand how we could undergo of those events, but three of us: my mother, my sister and I continue to live and hope for the happy future.  

At the present my sister is married and lives separately from us. My mother started to be sick often and underwent a surgery in 2012. Now she gets a small pension due to her health and volunteers in Public Ergene Foundation (National Centre of Oncology). She helps morally and physically for all people who have such a disease as hers. She fights against her illness and devotes herself to me. I feel that I am to be a good daughter and take care of my mother too.

I love to study. I finished one of the best schools in Bishkek and now I am a freshman at AUCA. I took European Studies because I want to learn the languages. The department requires French or German as a second language, and many of the students are also able to spend some time in Europe during their studies. 

I require Kiva loan in order to be able to get a degree, eventually hoping to have professional job and take care of my mother. “

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 59 years old, is widowed and has six grown-up children. She sells snacks to the people in her village and to business establishments too. She sells different rice cakes (puto, bibingka) and cheese breads. She gains minimal income from it but she is happy selling these items to her customers. 

Adoracion is now asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy rice cakes, bananas, ube (purple yam), and peanuts to sell. She hopes to keep selling good and delicious snacks and gain better profits to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice cakes, bananas, ube, and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more candies, biscuits, momma, soft drinks, coconut juice and burgers to sell

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is married to Jose, a tricycle rickshaw driver. The couple lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite in the Philippines, where they work to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Ignacia operates a junk concern. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclables like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories and others of the like.

Ignacia earns a minimum of 2,500 PHP every day selling to her neighbors and the local community. To help her continue operations, she is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy materials from recyclables collectors. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business and aims to see it grow in the coming years.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients such as Ignacia are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials from recyclables collectors.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Adelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Adelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Adelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, coffee, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Adelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: Sambath’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sambath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ruon's Group

texts.en: Ruon’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ruon makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en: Nga is 61 years old and lives with two sons and her husband. Nga is a teacher, and for seven years she has been running some classes at her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a four-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second from left, wearing an orange blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Nga is requesting a loan to purchase a scooter as a means of transportation for her son, so that he will be able to begin an apprenticeship, which will require him to travel extensively between his place of work and place of vocational training. She hopes that through the apprenticeship, her son will attain the skills that he needs to attain meaningful employment.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for her son to enable him to begin an apprenticeship

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Laura works hard to support her family.

She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Laura is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dried-fish business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming rice. Evelyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 34, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  She started the business selling food to cover her expenses and to generate income to care for her parents.  

Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy sugar, beans, and ingredients to make additional kinds of sweet bean soups.  This will allow her to attract more customers and increase turnover in her business.  She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, and other ingredients to make sweet soup to sell.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 24 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Imee has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from seaweed culture.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 26 years old and married with one child. Jeralyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jeralyn runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy material to make charcoal.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy material for making charcoal

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like plastic rope, bamboo, empty plastic bottles, etc. for her seaweed culture business.

Justa has been in this business for 15 years. Justa earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business like plastic rope, bamboo, empty plastic bottles, etc

loans.name: Ma.villa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma.Villa works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Ma.Villa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope for her seaweed culture business.

Ma.Villa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 46-year-old married woman.  She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.   For 8 years, she and her husband have operated a business selling many kinds of food such as cakes, confections, and beverages for people in their community.

Hong would like a loan to purchase better quality products to stock her store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy confections, cakes, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sangoeun's Group

texts.en: Sangoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sangoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as farmer and seller, by selling cake to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en: Chanry’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanry makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs, and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Africana is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Africana has a direct selling Personal Collection products business in the Philippines. Africana requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell.

Africana has been in this business for six years. In the future, Africana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Aida has been in this business for five years now.

Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like canned goods, vegetables, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

Maribel has been in this business for three years. Maribel earns more income from a general store.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and married, with three children in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 33 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Aireen works very hard to provide for them.

Aireen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, bath soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Aireen has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, bath soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Aireen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, bath soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pofitu

texts.en: Pofitu is 19 years old. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Pofitu has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a water tank and hand gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mascaras, eye shadow kits, nail polishes, hair dyes, pressed powders, make-up, hand creams, hair creams, and other products.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 71 years old and married with seven children.
