Mercedita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Mercedita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42 years old and has six children. Teresita is married, and three of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mach would like to take a further loan to buy more green tea, soft drinks, and phone cards to sell at his store. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy green tea, soft drinks, and phone cards to sell at his store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a  44-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom attend school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has operated a laminate making business in the Philippines for 15 years, and has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy marine, medicine, premix, styrene, and plastic cellophane.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy marine, medicine, premix, styrene, and plastic cellophane.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her seaweed culture business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has a live-in partner woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Angelina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 58 years old and widowed with three children.

Ana Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana Maria has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ana Maria aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Kontheo's Group

texts.en:
Kontheo and her group partner live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice and selling groceries from her home to support her family.

In Kontheo’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home would help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. With this in mind, Kontheo is requesting a loan of 288,000 KHR through iDE-Cambodia to purchase water filters for her and her group partner.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Jane, who is 28 years old, works hard to support her family. She buys vegetables from local farmers and sells them in the city market. Jane is taking a loan to purchase more stock of vegetables. She has gained consistent customers in her enterprise and hopes the additional stock will help her maintain a steady supply thus increasing her income. This will go a long way in helping her support her family by providing basic needs such as food and clothing. 

Jane is happy for Kiva and the support of their lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables that will help meet her customers' rising demands.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a tricycle driver while she is a vendor selling different products such as lotions and perfumes. Leonora wanted to gain more customers by selling additional items to them. So, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy lotion, perfumes, cologne and soap to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and acquire more profits in return. She will save her profits for education and emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfumes, cologne and soap to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. She is wishing everyone a Blessed New Year!

Agnes dreams of expanding her mini store into a big grocery store. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is a handicapped person who has owned and managed a small art sign business within the local community for almost nineteen years. He is 44 years old, married and has two children attending school. Despite his physical disabilities, he has the determination to uplift their standard of living and give his family a better life. He aspires to strengthen his business and generate a higher income to sustain the needs of his family and finance the education of his children. 

Due to capital insufficiency, he would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy paint, cutter platter, brush and other materials he needs in his art sign business. He is hoping that his requested amount will be granted so he will be able to improve his business and satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy paint, cutter platter, brush and other materials needed

loans.name: Feagiai

texts.en:
Feagiai is 26 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Feagiai has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, and chemicals

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is from ManingcoL, Ozamis City. She is 37 years old and married. Nelly owns and operates an RTW (clothing) business, operating a specialized retail store selling RTW in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2013, Nelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional clothing inventories for retail.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing inventories for retail

loans.name: La Oportunidad De Crecer Group

texts.es: La oportunidad de crecer es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas que solicitan por primera vez el financiamiento en ADIM con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder brindarles mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Lo coordina Eveling una joven de 21 años de edad, casada, comercializa derivados del maíz como es pinolillo, pinol, tiste, pozol, etc., además comercializa frutas en la ciudad de Granada, este negocio lo impulsó hace más de dos años con un préstamo que le realizó su suegra. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de leña, maíz, papaya, banano, sandías, cacao, canelas, etc. El resto de las integrantes son la señora Ligia de 35 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de piña desde hace veinte años en el mercado municipal, y Sayda una joven de 23 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
“La Oportunidad de Crecer” (The Opportunity to Grow) is a solidarity group that consists of three working women who are requesting their first loan from ADIM. Their goal is to increase their working capital so that they can provide a better quality of life for their families. Eveling, the group coordinator, is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is married and sells products made from corn such as “pinolillo”, “pinol”, “tiste”, “pozol”, and other items (the products previously listed are all traditional beverages made from cornmeal and cocoa). In addition, Eveling sells fruits in the city of Granada. She started that business more than two years ago with a loan that she obtained from her mother-in-law. Eveling is requesting a loan in order to buy firewood, corn, papayas, bananas, watermelons, cacao, cinnamon, and other products.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Ligia is 35 years old and has been selling pineapples at the municipal market for 20 years.
• Sayda is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She has been selling new clothes in her community for two years.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, papayas, bananas, watermelons, cacao, cinnamon, and other products.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Josie works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs as a business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rental and clothing retail businesses. Virginia is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 51 years old and a widowed woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angeline has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Angeline requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ana Merrh

texts.en:
Ana Merrh is 26 years old and married with one child.

Ana Merrh is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Ana Merrh has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es:
La señora Marlen  de 32 años  de edad es casada,  vive con esposo y tiene un  hijo que depende de ellos,  vive en su propia casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en una comunidad al sur de Honduras.
Doña Marlen es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de puertas y ventanas para su casa  ya que desea mejorar su casa y está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Marlen is 32 years old and married. She resides in her own home along with her husband and one dependent child. Marlen has been selling groceries for two years. Her business is located in her house, which is situated in a community in southern Honduras.

Doña Marlen is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy doors and windows for her house. Marlen wants to improve her house and is pleased that she can continue to work with Prisma. This is the third loan she has requested.

Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house.

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 45 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeanna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jeanna has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from trucking.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Doña Mirian gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados en sus cultivos de café los cuales desarrollaron muy bien su función protegiendo la planta, el grano y manteniendo la tierra bien cuidada. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad y los insumos comprados. Gracias a ello su producción de café fue un éxito logrando vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el compromiso con la institución entre otros compromisos que anteriormente no podía salir. Actualmente solicita nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para nuevamente invertir en sus cultivos de café, comprar nuevos insumos y aplicar a los mismos para esta nueva temporada estando muy agradecida con la cooperativa COMIXMUL por haberla tomado en cuenta nuevamente y esperando el mismo apoyo de los inversionistas para salir adelante con sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Doña Mirian was able to purchase needed fertilizers that she could apply to her coffee crops in order for them to become well-developed. Her job is to protect her plants and coffee beans, as well as to maintain the land so that it is well-kept. She also managed to pay for skilled labor to clear weeds from her property and to buy supplies. Thanks to her successful coffee production, she was able to sell the beans at the market for a very good price. With the income she earned from the local brokers, Mirian was able to submit her payments to COMIXMUL and also fulfill other commitments that she was not able to get out of previously.

She is currently requesting another loan from the Kiva lenders so that she can make a new investment in her coffee crops. Mirian will buy more supplies and use them during the new season. She is extremely grateful to the COMIXMUL cooperative for taking her into consideration again. Mirian expects the same type of support from Kiva lenders so that she can proceed with her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies so that she can maintain her coffee crops during the new season.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena de 51 años de edad, vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 14 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona.
Doña María Elena  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, leña, cuajada, aceite, etc. Espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Doña María Elena  uno de sus su sueños es hacer crecer su negocio tener más clientes y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del  2014.
texts.en:
Maria Elena, 51, lives with her children in her own home.  She has been selling 'rosquillas' (donuts) for the past 14 years.  Her customers are the people of San Lorenzo, the place where she lives, which is in the south of Honduras.  

She is an enterprising woman who has a strong desire to succeed and works hard every day to improve her standard of living.  

She is asking for a loan to buy products such as corn, firewood, curd, oil, etc.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to generate the income necessary to look after her family.  

She dreams of seeing her business grow, attracting more customers and improving the quality of life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, curd and oil for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña María Antonia nació en un lugar llamado Matagalpa en el año de 1954. Actualmente María es viuda y tienen 3 hijos, que ya son mayores de edad, sus hijos trabajan en agricultura en el terreno que María tiene, de esta manera ellos le ayudan a su familia. Doña María Antonia también tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa en la que trabaja, ella comenta que para los meses de corte de café las ventas son bastante buenas. En esta comunidad de las nubes numero dos no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que ella se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y candelas en su casa y esto le incomoda un poco al atender los clientes también es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así ubicarlo en la casa de habitación. Este sistema será de gran beneficio para los miembros que viven en la casa y a ella le será de gran beneficio para atender a los clientes que llegan a la casa a comprar productos, comenta que estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar
texts.en: María Antonia was born in a place called Matagalpa in the year 1954. Currently, Maria is a widow and has 3 children, who are adults. Her children work in agriculture in María’s plot of land, in this way they help their family.  María Antonia also has a small grocery store in her home. She says that in the months of the coffee harvest, sales are very good. In this community of clouds number two, there are no electric lights, which is why she has to use torches and candles in her house, and this is uncomfortable when helping clients. This is why she is asking for a loan, to buy a solar home system, and place it in the room. This system will be very beneficial for the people who live in the house, and for her it will be very beneficial when looking after clients who come to the house to buy products. She says she would be very grateful if given the opportunity of this loan to buy a solar home system.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system.

loans.name: Benefrida

texts.es:
La señora Benefrida tiene 52 años, vive con su hijo que ya es mayor, y que siempre la ayuda.
Comenta que cuando era soltera viajó, y trabajaba como empleada doméstica, luego volvió por su ciudad natal de Ybycuí y se casó, y con el ahorro que tenían abrieron una pequeña despensa, en la actualidad es una de las despensas más importantes de la ciudad, que ya tiene mucha clientela y que le permite mantener a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, ya que se acerca fin de año y quiere poder tener de todo en su negocio para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Benefrida is 52 years old. She lives with her adult son who is always helping her.

Benefrida says that she traveled when she was single. At the time, she worked as a domestic employee. When she returned to her hometown of Ybycuí, she got married. She used her savings to open a small food pantry. It is now one of the largest stores in the city. Benefrida has many customers, which helps her to sustain her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy various products for her food pantry. With the end of the year approaching, she wants her business to have everything that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various products so that she can restock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a canoe, fishing net, containers, an ice bag, and a torch

loans.name: Marìa Isabel

texts.es:
Marìa , es madre  soltera con dos hijos a su cargo alos que le proporciona su ayuda par su formacion y desarrollo.
Actualmente esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda , como el de embaldosar y ponerle ceramica a su vivienda y dicho financiamiento lo utilizaria en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como Para Embaldosar su vivienda, compra de materiales como : ladrillos, cemento, azulejo, tubos ,arena y piedrin.
Los que le vendria a dar mejores condiciones y nivel de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother of two children, who she looks after and provides for their education and development.  

At this moment in time, she needs to make some improvements to her home; for example, laying tiles.  She will use this loan to buy the building materials she needs such as bricks, cement, tiles, pipes, sand and gravel.  

This will help her to improve the standard of living for herself and her children.

loans.use: to tile her home, buying material such as bricks, cement, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Mayra de 33  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de tortillas, cuajada y también vende lociones, perfumes, cremas, etc.  Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y demás personas de las comunidades vecinas.
Doña Mayra sus clientes le prefieren por  su buena atención y sus  buenos  productos, vive al sur de Honduras y es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Mayra está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal ya que son la materia prima para elaborar sus tortillas, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es aumentar  su clientela para mejorar sus ingresos y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre 2014.
texts.en:
Mayra, 33, lives with her husband and two daughters in their own home.  She has been ten years in the business of making tortillas and curd, and also of selling lotions, perfumes and creams.  Her customers are made up of her neighbors and other people who live in the surrounding areas.  

Her customers are attracted to her because of her good service and high-quality products.  

She lives in the south of Honduras and she is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed.  She works hard every day to improve her standard of living.  

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder, which are the raw materials she needs to make the tortillas.  With this loan, she hopes to improve her income and her quality of life.  

She is a new client who is looking forward to working with Prisma.  She dreams of making more profits which will lead to a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her food business.

loans.name: Claudia  Paola

texts.es:
La joven Claudia Paola de 20  años de edad, vive con su mama y sus hermanos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 4  años al negocio de venta de cosméticos como lociones, cremas, brillos, bloqueadores, sandalias, etc.
Claudia Paola vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como lociones, cremas, cremas, sandalias y también quiere comprar blusas, y vestidos porque quiere aprovechar la época navideña para la venta.
Claudia Paola con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014
texts.en:
Claudia Paola, 20, lives with her mother and brothers and sisters in their own home.  She has been selling cosmetics and clothes for four years.  She lives in a village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  

She is an enterprising woman who has a desire to succeed.  She works hard every day to improve her quality of life.  

She is asking for a loan to buy products such as lotions, creams, sandals, blouses and dresses, so that she can make the most of the Christmas period to sell her products.  

With this loan she hopes to generate more income which will improve her standard of living.  She is a new client who is looking forward to working with Prisma.  She dreams of having a successful business and attracting more customers.  She also wants to make a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes for her businesses.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 03 menores hijos en casa de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Es una comunidad tranquila que cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua, su población se dedica a la agricultura (maíz amarillo, café y frutales), comercio de ganado vacuno y animales menores como cerdos, pavos, patos, cuyes y gallinas y al comercio de los mismos.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore, cuenta con 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y cosecha para ofrecer a sus clientes, con esto Carlos espera mejorar su nivel de ingresos lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three young children in a home of rustic materials in the Santo Tomás district, located in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. It is a quiet community with basic electric and water services. Its population works in agriculture (yellow corn, coffee, and fruit trees), and selling cattle and small animals like pigs, turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs, and chickens.

He works in agriculture, especially the farming of the Catimore variety of coffee. He has three years of experience in this business and with very good personal and work references in his district. He has requested a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop and in this way have a better production and harvest to offer his customers. With this, Carlos hopes to improve his level of income, which will have a great impact on his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María de 48  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de golosinas  como enchiladas, tacos, baleadas, tajaditas, pastelitos, pollo, y frescos de vidrio y naturales,  vive en un de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras.
Doña María es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como pollo, carnes, verduras, platos desechables, frescos, agua, café, harina, arroz, huevos, etc. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a salir adelante en su negocio.
Uno de sus su sueños es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del  2014.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, she lives with her husband and her children in her own home. For 5 years, her occupation has been the sale of snacks, such as enchiladas, tacos, baleadas (flour tortilla folded in half with refried beans, cheese, cream, and other ingredients inside), tajaditas (fried plantains), small cakes, chicken, and natural soft drinks, or packaged in glass containers. She lives in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. Maria is an entrepreneurial woman with dreams of succeeding, and she works hard every day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan for the purchase of products such as chicken, meats, vegetables, disposable plates, soft drinks, water, coffee, flour, rice, eggs, etc. She hopes this investment with help her succeed in her business.
One of her dreams is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time, improve her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2014

loans.use: to purchase chicken, meats, vegetables, disposable plates, soft drinks, water, coffee, flour, rice, eggs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL NACIENTE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith ella es soltera y tiene 22 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia junto con su mama prepara diferentes platos como pollos fritos,sopas y pescados, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes la socia estudia y tambien por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia paga las mensualidades de su universidad , el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Sol Naciente" communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Member Edith is single and 22 years old. She works in her restaurant business. Along with her mother, she prepares different plates such as fried chicken, soups, and fish. she works from 10:00am until 1:00pm. In the afternoons, she studies. It is through this small business that she pays her tuition at her university. Her dream is to expand the restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members work in a crafts business, a restaurant, a small grocery store, and clothing sales. 

Edith thanks those who are a part of this dream through this program, and she pledges to make her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su cónyuge en casa de material rústico de piedra y barro en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la siembra de café, maíz, papa y yucas, a la crianza de animales menores como pavos, patos, gallinas y cuyes asi como al comercio de los mismos.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno (vacas) desde hace 15 años, lo comercializa en la plaza de ganado de su distrito. Cuenta con clientela fija y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno (vacas) para su negocio y para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos, con esto espera aumentar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rufino is 53 years old, he is married, he lives with his spouse in a house made of rustic material, of stone and clay, in the district of St. Tomas, located in the province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.  The occupation of the population is sowing coffee, maize, potato, and yucca, and breeding small animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs, and selling them. 
His occupation has been the breeding and sale of cattle (cows) for 15 years. He sells it at the livestock square of his district. He has a loyal clientele, and very good personal and work references in the area. He has asked for a loan to buy a greater amount of cattle (cows) for his business, and for the purchase of balanced feed for them. With this, he hopes to increase his income and therefore improve his quality of life, and of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of cattle (cows) for his business, and purchase balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita makes a good earning on her  corn farming activities in Sindangan. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she has a high cost of living when her children entered college. She approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. 

She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. 

At the age of 56 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers. In the future, Lucia wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers for good growth of the plants

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia  Hilda  se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda works as a primary school teacher. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. Through her work, she is able to get ahead. Her dream is to open a clothing store.

Hilda is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Arminda Sebastiana

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita Arminda, tiene 34 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella sale adelante.
Doña Arminda es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para conseguir sus propios recursos y salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y bisuterías). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus momentos libres a recorrer por donde están sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida y ayuda a sus padres que son de escasos recursos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y productos de belleza. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. This place is famous for its straw hats.

Srta. Arminda lives in this place. She is 34 years old, single, and lives at her parents’ house. Arminda has participated in four loan cycles with her Communal Bank. She enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her to get ahead.

Doña Arminda is a woman who likes to succeed by supporting herself and earning her own income. She sells clothing of all types, as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, crèmes, perfumes, and costume jewelry). Arminda conducts her sales by going door-to-door, traveling in her free time so that she can visit her customers. She extends credit and collects payments every 8 or 15 days. Arminda has been in this business for eight years. She has been able to earn a living and help her parents who have limited resources.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, crèmes, and beauty products. Her dreams include continuing to forge ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, crèmes, and beauty products.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk chips, canned goods, etc.

Erma has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from boarding house rental.

Erma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk chips, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia Elsa Gregoriase sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y joyas y tambien sigue como profesora del nivel primario, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elsa Gregoriase continues with her business selling clothing and jewelry. She also continues working as a primary school teacher. She sells pants, blouses, and t-shirts. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store. She is requesting the loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, coats, and blouses.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, coats, and blouses.

loans.name: Suvania

texts.en:
Suvania is a 20-year-old lady who has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her run the business. Suvania hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has mastered her hog raising business in Sindangan. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. 

She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 4,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: To build a concrete pig pen for her hog raising business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

NWTF is re-listing Liza's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Danilo Javier

texts.es:
Danilo tiene 40 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frejol tambien cria chanchos y vacas, solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes agricolas para sembrar, ya que con la ayuda del credito podarn comprar suficiente para toda la siembra, realiza las compras en San Miguel cada semana, sus sueño es tener una familia estable y darles lo mejor para que sean felices. en tu tiempo libre le gusta jugar cartas.
texts.en:
Danilo is 40 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the community of Saldado Chico, which is in San Miguel in Bolivar Province. Danilo is a member of the San Francisco Communal Bank.

He is a farmer who grows corn and beans. In addition, he raises pigs and cows. Danilo is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for planting. With the help of this loan, he will have sufficient funds to buy everything he needs for planting.

Danilo makes his purchases in San Miguel each week. His dream is to have a stable family and to provide the best for them so that they are happy. In his free time, he enjoys playing cards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es: Leticia de 37 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos de engorde actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Leticia desea incrementar su negocio porque en época navideña y de fin de año es cuando las ventas aumentan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para tener la mayor cantidad posible de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así cumplir con la demanda de productos que estos solicitan.
texts.en:
Leticia, age 37, is an enterprising woman who earns her living through her business of raising and selling fattened chickens. She has been in business for three years and it has allowed her to maintain financial stability for her household. Leticia lives in her own home along with her life companion and their two children, ages 14 and 6.

She wants to increase her business because of the Christmas and year-end season when her sales are higher. For this reason, Leticia is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in chickens, vitamins, and concentrated feed in order to have the highest number of birds possible that she can offer to her customers. As a result, she can meet the demand for her requested products.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins, and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma  is 58 years old with four children.  Thelma personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  

She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: To purchase new nets for fishing

loans.name: Ginabel

texts.en:
Ginabel is managing her barbecue business in Sindangan.This has been doing well and supporting the needs of the family.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat, ketchup, and oil for her barbecue business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small eatery in the town.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat, ketchup, and oil for her barbecue business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with three school age children. 

She has had a store that sells basic commodities for ten years. She requesting a loan to buy materials for a fence and to pay her worker for their safety. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to support the financial education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fence repair and to pay her worker

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer con una mente muy positiva y con una clara visión, ella vive en la comunidad de Guineales, con una linda familia de 7 hijos, pero ella tiene bajo la responsabilidad aun cuatro de ellos.

Manuela es una madre que busca el bienestar para su familia, hace tres años ella empezó con una pequeña granja que es la crianza de pollos de engorde, esta granja lo tiene en su casa, para no descuidar a su familia, pues con los años de experiencia que lleva, le está yendo bien, pues ella necesita ampliar su granja, pero no es suficiente con el pequeño ahorro que ella tiene pues para ajustar y comprar los insumos para la granja necesita de un préstamo, Manuela espera conseguir el préstamo para entrar de llega a la ampliación de la granja. 

Manuela le encanta la crianza de animales, pues ella también tiene una pequeña granja de crianza de cerdos,  la idea de Manuela con estos proyecto, es apoyar a su familia a progresar, Manuela es una mujer que le encanta trabajar, ella dedicando todo el tiempo necesario para sobresalir con sus pequeñas granjas, uno de los sueños de Manuela es que algún dia ella pueda tener su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Manuela is a woman with a very positive mindset and a clear vision. She lives in the community of Guineales, with a nice family of 7 children, and she is still responsible for 4 of them.
Manuela is a mother who seeks well-being for her family. Three years ago, she started a small farm for the breeding of broiler chickens. She has this farm in her home, in order to look after her family. In the years she has been working, she has had success. She needs to expand her farm, but her small savings are not enough. To purchase the necessary supplies for the farm, she needs a loan. Manuela hopes to get this loan to get started with the expansion of the farm.
Manuela loves breeding animals, she also has a small farm for breeding pigs. Manuela’s idea with these projects is to support her family so they can succeed. Manuela is a woman who loves to work, she dedicates all necessary time to get ahead with her small farms. One of Manuela’s dreams is that one day she can have her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a chicken farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift Valley. Irene and her husband are blessed with three children. Irene has been a farmer for more than six years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Irene is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. Irene is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Irene seeks to continue growing a variety of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

Help. This woman still needs a boost to improve her farming business and to have the opportunity to be sufficient to raise her family.

loans.use: To expand her farm business by purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and bottles for her seaweed culture business.

Mercy has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and bottles for her business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, two tables, a stove, and zinc sheets for home improvements.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago se junto con sus esposa desde muy joven, el ahora tiene 2 hijos vive en una comunidad llamada Ixtahuacan, tiene 25 años. 

Santiago está muy dedicado a su familia, y cada día trabaja fuertemente para generar ingresos económicos, el trabajo que realiza Santiago es  la albañilería, él desde pequeño salió con su cuñado a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, con la experiencia adquirida el ejerce  ahora el puesto de albañil, él trabaja en su comunidad y  algunos lugares circunvecinos. Es una persona muy amable y reconocido por la comunidad. 

La meta de Santiago es comprar un terreno, ya que ahora los hijos por están pequeños y no se invierte mucho en ellos, él necesita un préstamo, porque le están ofreciendo un terreno, y es ahí mismo en su comunidad, Santiago hablo con su esposa y están interesados en conseguir el préstamo, para  invertir en la compra que están anhelando.  La mentalidad de Santiago es que más adelante puede construir una casa más para darles una mejor comodidad para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santiago began going out with his wife at a very young age and they now have two children. He lives in a community called Ixtahuacan and is 25 years old. 

Santiago is very devoted to his family and works hard every day to generate an income. Santiago works in construction. When he was young he went out to work with his brother-in-law as an assistant builder and with the experience he acquired he now works as a builder in his community and the surrounding areas. He is a very friendly person who is known throughout the community.

Santiago's goal is to buy a plot of land since his children are little and he doesn't have to spend a lot of money on them. Santiago needs this loan because he has been offered a plot of land in his own community. He has talked about it with his wife and they are interested in obtaining a loan so they can make this much desired purchase. In the future Santiago imagines building another house there to provide his children with greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. 

PMPC came to Lorna as a rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  

Lorna perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: To pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Marsee

texts.en:
Marsee is 37 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marsee has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marsee aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like bamboo, paints, nails, etc., for her furniture making business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, paints, nails, etc.

loans.name: Sahara Leonor

texts.es: Nuevamente Sahara solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de venta de variedad de medicamentos y lociones para caballero y para dama. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará variedad de medicamentos como: jarabes para la tos, pastillas para dolor, algodón, pomadas; y también desea comprar lociones para dama y para caballero. Espera poder contar con este apoyo nuevamente y seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Once again, Sahara is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in her business of selling various medicines and lotions for men and women. This business is her main source of income, so she wants to keep it active for as long as possible.

The amount she requested will be used to buy a variety of medicines such as cough syrup, pain pills, cotton, and ointments. She will also buy lotions for women and men. Sahara hopes to have this support once again so that she can continue to sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup, pain pills, cotton, ointments, and lotions for men and women.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her locality. Perla earns an income through this business. As of now, she wants to expand her store. With this, she is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, rice, bread and snack foods, condiments and others. With a loan, Perla will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, rice, bread and snack foods, condiments and others.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Danaya  est constitué de six (6) femmes  tous mariées majoritairement et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente des habits, du bois de chauffe, des produits cosmétiques et des bazins.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  il y a de cela un mois et sont à leur 3ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna   (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits pagnes wax. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Lafiabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maïmouna   compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of six women mostly married and living in monogamous households. They are on average 50 years old with four children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through local tontines (savings groups) and their income-generating activities.

Group members are merchants selling clothes, firewood, cosmetics and basin (damask) fabric. To increase their working capital, group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso about a month ago and are on their third group loan.

Mrs. Maïmouna (the woman standing in the third position from right to left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling pagne wax clothing (colorful West-African fabric). She intends to use this loan to buy 35 lengths of pagne wax fabric. She resupplies in Bamako, and retail sales are conducted for cash in Lafiabougou to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Maïmouna expects to achieve average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs, which will be used to meet her children's small needs. The remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

She relies greatly on the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her objective, which is to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es:
Walter tiene una relacion estable donde han procreado dos hijos a su cargo a los que le proporciona su apoyo para su desarrollo, este señor labora en una empresa en el departamento  donde pertenece el municipio donde habita desde hace 7 años donde vive con su familia y tiene  cinco años de laborar en dicha empresas desempeñandose como soldador.
Actualmente este señor tiene la necesidad de mejora su vivienda construyendo un cuarto por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar su primer financiamineto el que lo utilizaria en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como: ladrillos cemento,  hierro, perlines los que vendria a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida en hogar.
texts.en:
Walter has a stable relationship from which two children have been born that he cares for and supports. Walter works for a company in a department of the municipality where he has lived for seven years with his family. He has worked for five years in the aforementioned company as a solderer.

At the moment Walter needs to make home improvements by building another room, which is why he approached the Ceprodel office to apply for his first loan. He will use it to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, steel and purlins which will improve the conditions and standard of living in his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, steel and purlins

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Yeredon  ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffe, des bazins et pagnes wax. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame N’diore  (femme arrêtée au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   1 chargement du bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame N’diore  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the five members of the Yeredon group are on average 40 years old with five children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of Bamako's districts. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Lafiabougou.

Group members are small retail merchants of firewood, bazin (damask) fabric and pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric). To increase their working capital, group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. N'diore (the woman standing in the middle of the photo) is a great saleswoman of firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy one load of firewood in villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Lafiabougou to a clientele made up mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs N'diore hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 60,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business and used to meet the household's small needs.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the fruit business

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, ambos estudian. Él estudió hasta 3er grado, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es agricultor desde que tenía 15 años, su padre se encargó de enseñarle muy bien a trabajar en el campo para que en el futuro pudiera mantenerse solo y mantener a su familia. También trabaja en una finca, lo contrataron para cuidarla; para llegar a ella camina un kilómetro desde su casa y trabaja de 6:00am a 12:00m.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una pareja de bueyes para facilitar la cosecha de sus cultivos, ya que siempre tiene que alquilarlos para realizar dicha labor. José espera seguir trabajando duro para su familia, además espera que le tengan siempre la confianza en la finca para que los sigan contratando y con esos ingresos sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
José, 26, lives with his common-law wife and two children, ages 12 and 9, who attend school.  José has as third grade education and his wife is a homemaker.

Ever since he was 15 years old, José has been a farmer.  His father was the one who taught him how to work well in the field so that he could support himself and a family.  He also works on another farm where he was hired as a caretaker.  To get there he must walk a kilometer from home and his work schedule is 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a pair of oxen to help with the crop harvest.  He always rents them for this work.  José hopes to continue working hard for his family and also hopes he maintains the trust of those who hire him.  His income will go toward his children's education.

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro de 48 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene una hija de 17 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que sus padres no podían pagar el estudio y tampoco le daban la importancia necesaria a este. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y su hija viven con él.

Pedro es comerciante y vende verduras en un puesto que tiene en el mercado municipal de su comunidad, tiene tres años de experiencia dedicándose a este negocio y ya se hizo de sus cliente que le comprar día con día. Esta es su única fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su familia y da el estudio a su hija. 

Solicita el préstamo para abastecerse de verduras para su negocio, en este tiempo es cuando más le demandan producto y no quiere quedar mal con sus clientes.  Sueña con crecer en el negocio y como comerciante, que Dios le preste fuerzas y vida para ver a su hija graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Pedro, 48, lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter.  He was unable to get an education because his parents could not pay for it and did not believe it was necessary.  His wife is a homemaker.

Pedro is a merchant and sells vegetables at a stall he has at the municipal market of his community.  He has been in business for three years and has a steady flow of clients who buy from him every day.  This is his only source of income to support the family and give his daughter an education.

The loan he is requesting is to buy vegetables for his business.  This is the time of year when product demand is high and he does not want to disappoint his customers.  His goal is to grow in his business and as a merchant,  and to be blessed with strength and a long life to see his daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 58 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de plantas ornamentales y árboles frutales actividad que realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 2 años, además vende lácteos y productos básicos en una tienda que ha instalado en su vivienda. Ella vive con su hija de 30 años de edad y sus 3 nietos de 4, 6 y 1 años de edad en vivienda propia. Marta desea invertir en su negocio ya que en esta época de navidad vende mucho las pascuas y otros tipos de plantas ornamentales y actualmente cuenta con pocas de ellas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plantas ornamentales, árboles frutales, etc.
texts.en:
Marta, 58, is an entrepreneur who, thanks to her effort and tenacity, has been able to provide for her family through her business selling ornamental plants and fruit trees.  She works as a street vendor and has been in business for two years.  She also sells dairy products and basic goods at a store set up in her home.  She lives with her 30-year-old daughter and three grandchildren, ages 4, 6 and 1 in her own home.

Maria wants to invest in her business since it is the Christmas season and she sells many poinsettias and other kinds of ornamental plants.  Since she does not have many of these on hand, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy ornamental plants, fruit trees, etc.

loans.use: To buy ornamental plants, fruit trees, etc.

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es:
Maura  es casada con tres hijos, con solo uno de ellos  a su cargo al que le proporciona su apoyo para su desarrollo . esta señora se desempeña como maestra de educacion primaria.
Doña Maura atraviesa una dificultad y es que  requiere de una cantidad de dinero para apoyar a su hijo con los gastos de la compra de un  torno ya que su hijo se especializo en el area de mecanica automotriz, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para poder cumplir sus sueños que como todo buena madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos,  que mejor siendo beneficiado por ceprodel.
texts.en:
Maura is married and has three children, but only one is in her care and receives her support.  Maura is a primary school teacher.

She is going through a difficult time and is in need of money to help her son, who is an auto mechanic, to purchase a drill.  She decided to approach Ceprodel to request the loan in order to meet her goal, like every good mother would to help their children.

loans.use: To buy a drill.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.es:
Luiza es una mujer de 32 años de edad, separada, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘el retoño’ un área residencial, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Luiza es de tez morena, cabello corto negro,  baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y se dedican a la música, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la sastrería, tipo ‘clínica de jeans’; este tipo de negocio se ocupa de realizar todo tipo de arreglos a prendas como; subida de bota pie, cambio de cuello, arreglo de pantalones rotos, ancho de camisas y pantalones y otros. Negocio que realiza en su domicilio y atiende de lunes a sábado durante el día, los domingos se dedica a la limpieza de su hogar y atención de sus hijos. “comencé mi negocio porque tenía la idea de confeccionar ropa, pero la ropa de moda generalmente lleva marcas conocidas y es lo que a los jóvenes les gusta, y por la fuerza de mis clientes me dedique a arreglar su ropa…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande con varias máquinas. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser para contratar un ayudante y atender a mayor cantidad de  clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luiza solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de costura para contratar un ayudante y atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Luiza is 32 years old, separated and has two children, ages 17 and 11 years. She has a dressmaking business.

Luiza is happy, optimistic, and has a good attitude. She is dedicated to her work and is responsible. Luiza's business is located in the "El Retoño" residential area where there is a warm, tropical and humid climate; the temperature here oscillates between 21 and 35º Celsius during the day.

Luiza is dark skinned, short and has short black hair. Her native language is Guaraní though she also speaks Spanish for some things, including for her business.

Luiza shares her life with her children, who are in school and work with music. The family lives in a rented house that has electricity, running water, and is connected to the sewer system.

Luiz has a tailoring business, a sort of “clinic for jeans”. At the business, Luiza does all sort of repairs, including raising hems, replacing leather, fixing torn trousers, letting out shirts and trousers, and more. Luiza’s business is in her home; she works there during the day from Monday to Saturday. On Sundays, Luiza cleans her home and tends to her children.

“I started my business because I had the idea to make clothes. But fashionable clothes are normally made by well-known brands and that’s what young people like. With the help of my customers, I started repairing clothes, Luiza says.

Luiza’s dream is to have a larger workshop with more sewing machines. She wants to expand her business by buying a sewing machine in order to employ an assistant and serve more customers.

This is Luiza’s second loan with the organisation in 20 years of owning the business.

For these reasons above, Luiza is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine in order to employ an assistant and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to employ an assistant and serve more customers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una señorita que se dedica y se esmera con su trabajo, ya que la visión de ella es cada día generar ingresos, aprovechando su juventud, ella tiene 25 años es soltera, la visión de ella es lograr hacer muchas cosas en la vida, ella desde pequeña aprendió a tejer, aprendió con su mama, pues con esa iniciativa cada día fue innovando su tejido. 

Francisca por la calidad de su trabajo tiene mucha clientela, ella no tiene otro ingreso si no que sobrevive con sus tejidos, ella es una persona que no le gusta malgastar su dinero, tiene su capital de trabajo pero es solo para la inversión de sus tejidos, ella está solicitando un préstamo ahora ya que quiere comprar un lote de terreno, para que mas a futuro pueda construir su propia casa, con las ganancias que genera su tejido ella estaría pagando poco a poco su préstamo.  Son muchos los sueños de Francisca si Dios le permite la vida, otro sueño de ella es poner una  tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad. Francisca tiene esperanzas de conseguir su préstamo y hacer realidad su meta.
texts.en:
Francisca is a young woman who is dedicated to her job and puts in a lot of effort. Her vision is to generate an income each day and take advantage of her youth. 

Francisca is 25 years old and single. She dreams of achieving many things in her life. She learnt to weave from her mother when she was young and from these beginnings she has made innovations as she weaves each day. 

Francisca has a lot of customers due to the quality of her work. She has no other form of income so she lives off her weaving. Francisca is a person who does not like to waste money. She has some working capital but it is only to invest in her weaving. 

Francisca is applying for a loan as she would now like to buy a plot of land so that in the future she can build her own house. With the earnings she makes from her weaving she will pay off her loan bit by bit. Francisca has many dreams, God willing; another one of her dreams is to start up a grocery store in her community. 

Francisca hopes to obtain this loan and make her dreams reality.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio agrícola, trabaja en diversos campos de cultivo de su distrito en épocas de siembra y cosecha. Cuenta con experiencia brindando este servicio por lo que tiene clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan referencias muy buenas de ella. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de animales menores como cuyes, carneros, pollos, para que pueda iniciar un negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Con esto Armandina busca incrementar su nivel de ingresos iniciando su propio negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Armandina, 36, lives in her own house with her children in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.  She lives in a community where the local people work in commerce, agriculture and livestock farming, which are the main activities.

She provides agricultural services and works on different crop farms in the district during the sowing and harvesting seasons.
