She has much experience and, therefore, many steady customers in the area who have provided very good references for her.  The present loan will be used to buy small animals like guinea pigs, sheep and chickens so she can start a business raising and selling animals.  Armandina hopes to increase her income by starting her own business so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy small animals like guinea pigs, sheep and chickens so she can start an animal sales business.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edades una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos con el apoyo de su negocio de venta de plantas ornamentales actividad que realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 20 años, además cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 18, 13 y 11 años de edad. Ana desea vender cilindros de gas propano en su pequeña tienda y así obtener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cilindros de gas propano y productos básicos para incrementar sus ventas y sus ganancias y mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en: Ana, 48, is an entrepreneur who works hard to support her children.  She has a business selling ornamental plants and has been working as a street vendor for 20 years.  She also has a small store of basic goods in her home.  She lives with her common-law husband and three children, ages 18, 13 and 11.  Ana wants to sell propane gas tanks in her small store to improve her income.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy propane gas tanks and basic products to increase sales and earnings so she can maintain a stable economy for the family.

loans.use: To buy propane gas tanks and basic products.

loans.name: Djemaguelin Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Djémaguelin sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente d’ustensiles plastiques de plusieurs sortes, du jus, des pagnes wax et de la restauration. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Korotoum (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente des ustensiles plastiques de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 pièces d’ustensiles plastiques. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  La revente se fait à Minkoungo au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Korotoum compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Made up of five women, the members of the Djémaguelin group are mostly married in polygamous households. They are on average 28 years old with three children. They all live in Minkoungo, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They met through family connections, neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities.

Group members sell various kinds of plastic utensils, juices, pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric) and catering services. To build up their stock supplies, the group decided to call upon Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs Korotoum (the woman sitting in the second position from right to left in the photo) has a good reputation selling plastic utensils of various kinds. She plans to use her loan to buy 18 plastic utensils.

She resupplies in Bamako, and retail sales are conducted in Minkoungo, for cash or on credit, as an itinerant vendor and sometimes on order, to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan Mrs Korotoum expects to achieve average monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be used to ensure the children's schooling and health care.

loans.use: buy different kinds of plastic utensils

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a sus 03 hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida tradicional de la región), comida y adicionalmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, gallinas, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientela fija de la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de materiales como artículos de cocina (ollas, platos, utensilios, etc.), mesas, sillas, entre otros para implementar su negocio. Con esto Norma espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes satisfaciendo así sus gustos y necesidades, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma, 47, lives in her own house with her common-law husband and three children.  They live in the district of La Matanza in the province of Morropón, in the Piura Region on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in the district is quiet and the local people work in agriculture, livestock farming and animal sales which are the main business activities.

She sells "chicha de jora" (a traditional beverage in the region) and food, and also raises and sells small animals like ducks, turkeys, hens, etc.  She says she has eight years' experience in the business and has steady customers in the area.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as cooking items (pots, dishes, utensils, etc.), tables, chairs and other goods for her business.  Norma hopes the purchase will allow her to provide better customer service and meet everyone's satisfaction.  This will increase her income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pots, dishes, tables, chairs and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Vicu¥Itas - 27 Group

texts.es:
Griselda es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones de 16, 13 y 3 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre,  emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘cruce villa Adela’ un sitio céntrico, caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas del Alto, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura constante entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Griselda es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello castaño largo hasta los hombros, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte, y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela, los 2 menores aún no están en edad escolar. La familia vive en una casa alquilada, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su actividad económica la obligó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado, elaboración de empanadas, venta de carne de cordero y taller mecánico, parea solicita un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, refrescos, etc., Que atiende durante todos los días de la semana desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta muy altas horas de la noche. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa por esa razón puede atender la tienda continuamente. “me gustaría ampliar mi negocio y volverlo minimarket, contar con muchas heladeras y conservadoras para ofertar mayor variedad de productos…” comenta. La tienda de barrio se encuentra ubicada estratégicamente en un lugar céntrico, donde la gente transita constantemente, esto hace que su negocio sea próspero y muy comercial. Su sueño es tener un minimarket para mejorar sus ventas. Ella desea abastecer su tienda de barrio mediante la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Griselda solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para abastecer su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Griselda, 34, is married and has three sons, ages 16, 13 and 3, and a daughter, age 5.  She runs a neighborhood store and is a good mother and entrepreneur.  She is cheerful, optimistic, happy, good-natured, responsible and hard-working.  Her business is set up in an area of the "Cruce Villa Adela" which is a central location known for its connections to different parts of the city through public transport.  From here one can get transporation to remote areas of El Alto.  The climate is cold and dry and the average temperature is 4-12 degrees Celsius all year round.  The altitude is 3,800 meters above sea level.

Griselda has a dark complexion, is short and has long, chestnut hair to her shoulders.  Her native tongue is Aymará which is spoken here.  She speaks Spanish for her general culture and for the business she has.  She lives with her husband who works in transportation and her children.  The two eldest attend school and the little ones are too young for school.  The family lives in a rented house which has running water, electricity, gas and a sewage system.  The need to improve her business activity is what obliged her to form a communal bank with people in business such as perfume sales, soft drink sales, typical clothing sales, ice cream sales, meat pie making, lamb meat sales and an auto mechanic shop, to request a loan and meet her goals.

Her business is a neighborhood store where she sells basic staple goods such as bread, sugar, rice, pasta, soft drinks, etc.  She works every day of the week from the early morning hours until late at night.  Her store is set up in her home so she can attend to it continuously.  "I would like to expand the business and turn it into a minimarket with refrigeration units and coolers to offer a wider variety of products..." she says.

The store is strategically located in a busy place which makes it a prosperous, commercial business.  Her dream is to have a minimarket to improve sales.  She wants to stock the store with basic staple goods purchased wholesale.  This is her first loan through the institution in the three years she has been in business.  Griselda is requesting a loan to buy goods wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy basic staple goods, wholesale, for her store.

loans.name: Judy Betty

texts.es:
Judy Betty tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. En este distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pavos, patos, cuyes, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuenta con 11 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, patos, pavos, gallinas y con esto aumentar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera Judy Betty espera incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Judy Betty is 42 years old, in a de facto relationship and lives with her two children in her own home in the rural area of the Oyotun district. This district is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people of this district mainly work in agriculture, commerce and farming.  

Judy Betty raises and sells farmyard animals such as turkeys, ducks and guinea pigs, amongst others. Her store is located at the back of her home. She has spent 11 years working in this field and has good personal and professional references from her district.

Judy Betty is applying for a loan to buy a larger amount of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys and chickens to expand her business's livestock. In this way she hopes to increase her sales and generate higher earnings which will have a big impact on her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys and chickens to increase her business's livestock

loans.name: Ds Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe DS ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers  de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Minkoungo. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits pagnes wax,  des friperies, des produits cosmétiques, des jouets et du bois de chauffe. En vue  d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 16 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Minkoungo  et à en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the five members of the DS group are on average 34 years old with three children. They all live in Minkoungo, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and met through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Minkoungo.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in pagnes wax clothing (colorful West-African fabric), used clothing, cosmetics, toys and firewood. To increase their working capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman sitting at the far right of the photo) is a great seller of better quality pagne wax clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy wholesale 16 lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako.

Retail sales are conducted in Minkoungo and as an itinerant vendor, to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan Mrs Fatoumata expects to achieve average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business activity and used to meet the household's small needs.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel Angel se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesor del nivel primario y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos lacteos como yogurt y quesos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es tener un colegio. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar  yogurt y quesos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Miguel Angel still works as a Primary School teacher and he also continues to sell dairy products such as yogurt and cheese.  

He works from 8:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon.  He wants to make a living for himself in this line of work, with the dream of having his own school one day in the future.  

He is asking for a loan to buy yogurt and cheese.  He is very pleased with the loan system and promises to meet the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy yogurts and cheese.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 53 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age. For her source of living, Delia is earning income from agricultural activity particularly from a parcel of cocoland and earns approximately 1,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Delia hopes to engage in a direct selling business.

loans.use: to redeem a parcel of coconut land.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Leah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Las Chipas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Chispas está integrado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras, coordinado por Magdaliz una mujer de 36 años, acompañada y se dedica a la venta de tortillas y frijoles en las calles de su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, sacos de frijoles, carbón, leña, etc con el crédito anterior compro una cocina por lo cual logró aumentar los productos ofrecidos mejorando así sus ingresos. El resto de las integrantes del grupo son Monica de 33 años de edad propietaria de tortillería y frijoles en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años y Xiomara de 43 años de edad quien comercializa nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace once años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group 'Las Chispas' is made up of three enterprising small-business people.  They are lead by Maddaliz, 36, who is married and sells tortillas and frijoles beans in the streets where she lives.  

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, bags of frijoles beans, coal and firewood.  With her previous loan she bought a kitchen which allowed her to increase the amount of products she offers and generate more income.  

The rest of the group are Monica, 33, who also makes tortillas and frijoles, a business she has been running from home for the past four years; and Xiomara, 43, who has been selling 'nactamales' from home for eleven years.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags of frijoles beans, coal, and firewood, to increase sales.

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos, vive con su familia en la parte rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, pollos, gallinas, etc; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con clientela fija en su distrito quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de más animales como patos, cuyes, gallinas, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 23 years old and has a partner and three children. She lives with her family in the rural district of Oyotún, in the Chiclayo province of Peru's northern coast. The people here work mainly in trade, farming and cattle-raising.

Rosa makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens, cockerels, hens and more; she has more than five years experience with this business, which she runs out of her home. Rosa has regular customers in her local area who give her very good personal and professional references. Rosa is applying for this loan in order to buy more animals such as ducks, hens and more to increase stock at her business. This investment will give Rosa a great variety of animals and higher productivity. This will increase her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as ducks, hens and more to increase stock at her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú, una comunidad de pobladores amables que se dedican principalmente al comercio y agricultura.

Francisco se dedica a brindar servicios como maestro de obra (constructor) en la construcción de viviendas en su distrito y pueblos aledaños, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo como carretillas, palanas, baldes, entre otros así como para la contratación de mano de obra para que trabajen con el en su labor de construcción. Con esto Francisco espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le generará una mayor cantidad de ingresos y tendrá un gran impacto en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 32 years old and lives in a house that he owns in the Santo Tomás district of Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands. The locals here are friendly and work mainly in trade and farming.

Francisco works as a builder; he has 15 years' experience with his business building homes in the district and neighbouring areas. He has very good personal and professional references in the area. Francisco is applying for this loan in order to buy work tools, such as buckets, wheelbarrows, shovels and more as well as to pay labourers to work with him. Francisco hopes that, with this loan, he can offer his customers better service, allowing him to earn a higher income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools, such as buckets, wheelbarrows, shovels and more as well as to pay labourers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio César de 24 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa familiar con su madre y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican principalmente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores como chanchos, patos y gallinas, desde hace más de 03 años. Cuenta con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del préstamo será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, de esta manera Julio César espera poder obtener mayores ingresos los cuales le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio César is 24 years old, married and lives in the family home with his mother and wife in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province. Located in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast, the people here work mainly in trade, farming and cattle-raising.

Julio himself has been making a living raising and selling young animals, such as pigs, ducks and hens, for more than three years. He has regular customers who give him very good personal and professional references. This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals and feed to fatten up the animals. With this loan, Julio hopes to earn a higher income that will allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and feed to fatten up the animals.

loans.name: Diwani

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Diwani works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Diwani is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like bamboo, nails, rope, etc. for her furniture making business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Diwani has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like bamboo, nails, rope, etc.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Melinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, buttons, thread, etc. so she can continue to provide an excellent service.

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Sol works hard to support her family.

She has a poultry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Sol is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

Sol has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her poultry

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 43-year-old mother with eight children who has a business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. Eseta has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast to assist her in operating the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Eseta hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast.

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita engages in farming. She grows and sells vegetables like okra, eggplant and bitter gourd. She has been engaged in vegetable farming for three years now. She is a 35-year-old married woman with six kids.

Violita is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers. These tools will be of great help to Violita and her famiy, so she can now grow and sell more vegetables. In the coming few months, her income will increase and eventually pay for the family's living expenses. Violita now can start setting aside savings for the welfare of her children.

Violita dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es cliente de la institución de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene cinco hijos de las edades de 12 y 13 los varones y las niñas de 7,6 y 9 años, su negocio es el comercio de venta de material de construcción.
Él es un buen hombre,  padre, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chuquiaguillo’ donde se encuentra un rio de donde se provee de material de construcción, la zona es de clima frio.
Adolfo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura su lengua es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio que realiza, su vida la realiza con su pareja que le ayuda en el comercio, El señor Adolfo empezó a trabajar como ayudante cargando arena y áridos a las volquetas en el rio de zona mencionada, Recientemente realizó la compra de un camión que desea refaccionar con el que transporta su producto por las diferentes calles hasta llegar a sus clientes . “Gracias al trabajo duro con mi pareja logramos tener mucho clientes a los cuales realizamos la entrega de materiales de construcción para todo tipo de construcciones…” comenta. Su sueño es comprar otra volqueta y así  llegar a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adolfo solicita un préstamo para la reparación de  su vehículo y compra de seis llantas para viajar a localidades alejadas y comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a client of the institution, 46 years old, who lives with his partner and has five children. The boys are 12 and 13 years old and the girls are 7, 6, and 9 years old. His business is selling construction material. 

He is a good man and father, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in the "Chuquiaguillo" zone, where there is a river and where construction material is provided. The area has a cold climate.

Adolfo has olive skin, short black hair, is short-statured, his language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish for the business that he does. He has his life with his partner who helps him in the business. Adolfo began to work as an assistant carrying sand and gravel for mortar to the dump trucks located at the river mentioned.  Recently, he purchased a truck that he wants to repair, with which he transports his products down the different roads to get to his customers. "Thanks to the hard work with my partner, we manage to have many customers to whom we are delivering construction materials for all sorts of construction..." he says. His dream is to purchase another dump truck and in this way have more customers. This is his second loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Adolfo asks for a loan to repair his vehicle and purchase 6 tires to travel to distant places and sell his product.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase 6 tires.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is married and she a businesswoman. She is very highly interested in doing business, but her working capital is not enough, so she is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a secondhand clothes shop and she also sells in the market. Nelia has been involved in business activities for two years when she started with her own working capital of $250. She is earning a good income from selling her secondhand clothes because many people like to buy them. They are cheap and unique if compared to new clothes. So she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy  blankets, jackets, t-shirts, long sleeves, short sleeves and other things to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Ovidia

texts.es: Gladis de 47 años de edad es una mujer que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida con su trabajo por lo que hace 16 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de verduras en su vivienda, además vende plantas ornamentales de forma ambulante en las diferentes colonias de la ciudad. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Gladis desea invertir en la compra de verduras y plantas y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plantas y verduras para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladis is 47 years old. She is a woman who learned to make a living from her work when she was very young. 16 years ago, she decided to start selling vegetables from her home and she also sells ornamental plants in the streets in different parts of the town.

She lives in her own home with her common law partner and their 16-year-old son.

Gladis wants to invest in the purchase of vegetables and plants, and by this to obtain a higher income which would allow her to offer her family better living conditions. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest it in plants and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase plants and vegetables.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to buy fishing material for her fishing business.

Kristine has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing material for her business

loans.name: Famille Mukwege Group

texts.fr: A son mariage, Martin a reçu de son père quelques étendues de champs dans lesquels il a planté des caféiers. Ensemble avec son épouse Martine, Martin cherche à accroitre leur production afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins vitaux de leur modeste famille. Ils ont sollicité ce crédit pour prendre en charge les frais de sarclage de leur étendue afin de résoudre le problème de manque de la main d'oeuvre. Chef du groupe FAMILLE MUKWEGE, il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: When he got married, Martin received several areas of fields from his father, in which he planted coffee trees. Together with his wife, Martine, Martin is trying to increase their production in order to be able to provide for the vital needs of their modest family. They have requested this loan to cover the costs of hoeing of their land so they can resolve the problem of not having any workforce. He is head of the Famille Mukwege group and is standing in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to cover hoeing costs.

loans.name: Reyni Eugenia

texts.es: Reyni es una mujer de 40 años de edad que muestra su tenacidad al salir todos los días a vender sus plantas ornamentales y árboles frutales por los cantones del municipio actividad que lleva 10 años realizando y que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos de 16, 15, 10 y 5 años de edad, y  un bebé de 3 meses de edad a los que siempre esta buscando la manera de dar lo mejor. Reyni desea que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plantas ornamentales y árboles frutales y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyni is a 40-year-old woman. She is very tenacious and goes out every day to sell her ornamental plants and fruit trees in the cantons of the municipality. She has carried out this activity for 10 years, and she realized that it allows her to maintain a stable household economy.

She lives with her common-law partner and their 5 children, who are 16, 15, 10, and 5 years old, and a baby of 3 months. She is always looking for a way to give them the best of everything.

Reyna would like her business to generate a higher income, and for this reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest it in ornamental plants and fruit trees. By this, she wants to generate a higher income to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase: ornamental plants and fruit trees.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Prescila works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising chickens in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Prescila is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feed for her business raising chickens.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Prescila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Iloilo, Philippines. Lea has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than five years now.

Lea is a hardworking woman. She helps her husband in their fishing venture.

Lea would like to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others items. With a loan, Lea and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Lea hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Fredy Domingo

texts.es: Fredy tiene 33 años de edad y toda su vida ha sabido ganarse la vida, pero desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales y es gracias a ello que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 5 años de edad. Fredy siempre se apoya en su negocio para salir adelante por lo que desea que este le brinde mejores ingresos económicos, y para ello ha decidido invertir en él mismo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plantas ornamentales con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas sobre todo en esta época navideña para poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is 33 years old and has earned his living for all of his live. 8 years ago, he started selling ornamental plants. Thanks to this, he can earn enough to provide household. 

He lives with his wife and their 3 children, who are 13, 12, and 5 years old. Fredy relies on his business to get ahead and therefore he wants it to generate a higher income. For this reason, he has decided to invest in his business and is asking fro a loan from FUSAI to invest it in the purchase of ornamental plants. By this, he wants to increase his sales, especially in the Christmas season, in order to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental plants.

loans.name: Maritza Candelaria

texts.es: Maritza de 23 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante junto a su familia y para ello vende frutas, verduras y plantas ornamentales de forma ambulante y en su vivienda cuando le solicitan. Ella vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad, que es su mayor alegría. Maritza desea invertir en su negocio ya que desea tener más productos para ofrecer a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frutas, verduras y plantas ornamentales y de esta manera surtirlo para cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Maritza is 23 years old. She is an enterprising woman who strives every day to get ahead with her family. To achieve this, she sells fruits, vegetables, and ornamental plants in the streets and in her home, when customers want to buy from her.

She lives in her own house with her common law partner and their 4-year-old son, who is their greatest joy.

Maritza wants to invest in her business, because she wants to offer her customers more products. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI invest it in fruits, vegetables, and ornamental plants. By this, she wants to stock up her business and to meet the demands for the products her customers ask for.

loans.use: to purchase: fruits, vegetables, and ornamental plants.

loans.name: Rukara Group

texts.fr: A l'âge de 18 ans, François a reçu 2 champs de son père dans lesquels il y a planté des caféiers. Grâce à l'entretien régulier de ses étendues, il projette accroitre sa production dont les revenus lui permettront de répondre au mieux aux besoins vitaux de sa famille quoique ne disposant pas dans le milieu d'un marché permanent pour l'écoulement de leurs produits. Président du groupe RUKARA, il pose sur la photo avec les deux autres membres levant sa main droite.
texts.en: At 18 years old, François was given two fields by his father, in which he planted coffee plants. By regularly maintaining his land, he is planning to increase his production, the income from which will enable him to provide better for his family's basic needs, even though there is no permanent market in the area to sell his products. He is president of the Rukara group and is standing in the photo with his right hand raised, alongside the other two members of the group.

loans.use: to maintain coffee plant fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase windows, paint, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es cliente de la institución de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene no tiene hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de venta de carne.
Él es un buen hombre trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de Batallas donde se encuentra su carnicería, la localidad  es de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-14 grados centígrados.
Edwin es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura su lengua es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza con su pareja que le ayuda en el comercio casi todo el día. Viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de carne se provee de la región ya que existe una feria los días sábados donde los lugareños sacan sus productos a vender y el aprovecha eso para abastecerse de carne que el va vendiendo en la semana “Gracias al trabajo duro con mi pareja logramos tener mucho clientes que acuden a la carnecería a diario para realizar sus compras…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y llegar a mayor cantidad de clientes. Él desea realizar la compra de carne por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada y realizar viajes a otras localidades para abastecerse de este producto. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de carne por mayor.
texts.en:
Edwin is a borrower at Emprender and is 43 years old. He lives with his partner and has no children. He has a business selling meat.

Edwin is hard-working. His butcher shop is in the town of Batallas, where the climate is cold and dry. During the daytime, the temperature oscillates between 4 and 14º Celsius.

Edwin has dark skin, and short dark hair. He is short and has Aymara as his native language. He also speaks Spanish in daily life and at work. Edwin shares his life with his partner, who helps out at the business throughout most of the day. The couple owns the house where they live. They have running water, electricity and are linked to the sewage system. 

Edwin has a business selling meat. He buys the meat in the local region as there is a market every Saturday where locals sell their products. Edwin takes advantage in order to stock up on the meat that he will sell during the week.

Edwin says, "Thanks to my and my partner's hard work, we have many customers who come to the butcher shop every day to make their purchases."

The couple's dream is to expand the business and have more customers. Edwin wants to buy meat in bulk in order to satisfy seasonal demand and make trips to other towns to stock up on meat.

This is Edwin's first loan cycle in the six years of having this business. Edwin is applying for a loan in order to buy meat in bulk.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Benancio Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Benancio de 53 años de edad,  no tiene hijos  que depende de él, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de productos de la canasta básica y también vende maíz.
Don Benancio tiene varios clientes que le compran el maíz para la cosecha y también para revenderlo, tiene casa propia y desea en este año tener el apoyo de Prisma para cosechar mas maíz y también invertir en su negocio de pulpería en la compra de azúcar, huevos, café, pan, arroz, mantequilla, etc.
Don Benancio el anteriormente no tenía la pulpería pero ahora si él está muy contento porque está saliendo delante uno de sus su sueños es mejorar su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Benancio, 53 years old, doesn't have any children who depend on him. He has worked for a number of years selling basic pantry items and he also sells corn. 

Benancio has a number of customers who purchase his corn for their own harvest and also to resell it. He has his own house and he hopes, this year, with Prisma's support to harvest more corn and also invest in his grocery store business in purchasing sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, rice, margarine, etc.

Benancio didn't have the grocery store when he got the previous loan, but now he does. He is very happy because it is getting ahead. One of his dreams is to improve his house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sugar, eggs, coffee, margarine, etc. for his businesses.

loans.name: Galuega

texts.en: Galuega is 58 years old; she owns and operates a business of selling vegetables (cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplants) in her village. She has requested  a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and a water tank to assist in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and a water tank for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru:
Машхура экономически активная жительница района Спитамен. Ей 33 года. Она занимается бизнесом животноводством. Машхура при дворе совего дома выращивает и мелкорогатый и крупнорогатый скот. Данной деятельностью она занимается уже 3,5 года. Машхура сама по профессии педагог, у нее высшее образование. Муж Машхуры является мастером по ремонту домов. У них трое детей школьного возраста. 
Машхуре сейчас необходимо запастись кормом для скотов, однако для этой цели у нее нет финансовых средств. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Благодаря кредиту ее скот будет обеспечен кормом и она сможет успешно продолжить свою животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Mashkhura is an economically active resident of the Spitamen region. She is 33 years old. She has a livestock breeding business. Mashkhura breeds both cattle, sheep and goats in the yard of her house. She has had this business for more than 3.5 years. 

Mashkhura is a teacher by profession, and she has higher education. Her husband is a master carpenter, renovating houses. They have three children of school age. 

Mashkhura currently needs to stock up with feed for the livestock, however she does not have money for this. For this reason she applied for a loan. Thanks to the loan her livestock will get fed and she will be able to continue her livestock breeding business with success.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de el Torno, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas en especial la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Marlene es de tez morena cabello negro largo, mediana estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y su hijo, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con el servicio de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de temporada, como; bermudas, pantalones cortos, shorts, etc. en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle. “la necesidad por trabajar me inicio en la venta de ropa de temporada, por suerte me va bien, tengo clientes constantes porque no paro de trabajar” comenta. su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo en horarios de 9 de la mañana a 7 de la noche. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa de marca, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor para abaratar costos de transporte y tener variedad de pendas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para surtir su negocio y abastecer a sus clientes constantes.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 20-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. She sells clothes. Marlene is a good mother, and a responsible, energetic and hardworking woman. She works in El Torno, an area known for its thriving commercial sector, especially manufacturing. It has warm and humid tropical weather, with an annual temperature that ranges between 21 and 35 °C [70-95℉].

Marlene is dark-skinned and has long, black hair. She is not very tall. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish at work. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the construction sector, and her son. They live in a rented room with running water, electricity and sewage. She sells seasonal clothing, such as Bermuda shorts, hot pants and other types of shorts, in a street stall. “I started this business out of need. I am doing well, luckily. I have a fixed customer base because I work nonstop,” she says. She works Monday to Sunday, from 9 am until 7 pm. Her dream is to have a store that sells designer clothes.

Marlene wants to invest in her business. She wants to buy seasonal clothes in bulk in order to reduce the transport costs and be able to offer a wider variety. This is her first loan with the institution, but she has been in business for a year. This is why Marlene is requesting a loan to buy clothes in bulk in order to increase her stock levels and be able to supply her loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед верный муж и отец. Он проживает на районе Шахринав вблизи с не большим городком под названием Турсунзаде или иначе Регар. Хуршед не большой предприниматель и он хочет расти и продвигать свой бизнес. Она работает в сфере полиграфии. И данное обращение за кредитом связанно с его деятельностью. Хуршед хочет получить кредит на приобретение оборудование. Он собирается купить принтер. Принтер стоит дорого, но из-за того что ему не хватило не большой суммы он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Khurshed is a faithful husband and a father. He lives in the Shahrinav region, near the small town called Tursunzoda, or sometimes Regar. 

Khurshed has a small business and he would like to grow and improve it. He works in the printing business. His loan request is connected to his business. 

Khurshed would like to get a loan to purchase equipment. He has decided to purchase a printer. It is expensive, and as he is missing a small amount he applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to run his printing business

loans.name: Falematai

texts.en: Falematai is a 24-year-old mother with three children. She operates a small business of selling vegetables in stores to earn a living. Falematai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Falematai will use her income to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en: Jackilou is 31 years old and lives in Sindangan. She is married with two children. Jackilou has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business. She earns approximately 9,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Jackilou has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Liezel works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her buy-and-sell accessories business. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her retail business.

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 47-летняя вдова, проживающая в маленьком районе Дангара. Она мать четверых детей, которые уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Зулайхо, чтобы обеспечивать семью в 1999 году начала торговый бизнес собственным рабочим капиталом. Вот уже 15 лет как она продолжает заниматься торговлей одежды на рынке района. Зулайхо оптом закупает детскую и женскую одежду и продает его по розничной цене в своей торговой точке. Благодаря этому бизнесу она все эти годы обеспечивала свою семью и поставила на ноги детей. В настоящий момент целью запрашиваемого кредита является расширение деятельности. Зулайхо хочет привезти коллекцию сезонной детской и женской одежды, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Zulayho is a 47 year old widow who lives in the small region of Dangara. She is the mother of four children who are already adults and independent. 

Zulayho started a retail business with her own working capital in 1999, in order to support her family. She has continued this business for 15 years, selling clothing at the regional market. Zulayho purchases children's and women's clothing wholesale and sells them at retail prices at her sales point. Thanks to this business she has supported her family for all this years and put her children on their feet.

Currently, she is applying for a loan with the goal of expanding her business. Zulayho would like to bring in a collection of seasonal children's and women's clothing, in order to increase the sales volume. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's and women's clothing to develop her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Letecia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoos, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 48 year old male Ugandan; he is married to Midias with whom they have eight children aged between 28 and three years. Denis is a hard working businessman who deals in the sale of cereals since 1998, but he also does agriculture though on a small scale. This helps to feed his rather large family.
He has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy dry cereals for sale during the Christmas season because they are currently buying cheaply in anticipation to sell during the hiked season in January. He is also assured of market from schools as they open the term in January and Feb. He is described as an honest, resilient, and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy corn and millet to sell.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a female Ugandan married to Charles with three children. Agatha is a business lady and she operates a retail shop in Kagadi town but she also has additional income from agriculture. 

She has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE to  restock her shop in order to make more profits. Her previous loan having helped her to grow the business. Her dream for the future is to see all her children finish school. She faces challenges of competition and limited capital. She will soon overcome these with continuous financial boost.  She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy  sugar, soap, corn flour, rice and other retail  shop items

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos de 28, 26, 22 y 20 años de edad, solo dos viven con él, uno trabaja como agricultora y su hija estudia bachillerato. Él estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus dos hijos viven con él.

José es agricultor y comerciante de ganado, tiene 40 años de experiencia en estos oficios, aprendió de su padre a cultivar maíz, frijol y maicillo y a comerciar con animales. Son las únicas actividades económicas que realiza y le apoya su hijo. Ambos trabajan alrededor de 6 horas diarias.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas que espera alimentar con los residuos del cultivo y en un futuro espera que produzcan leche para vender y elaborar queso con lo que contribuirá a la economía familiar. José espera Dios le presta vida para seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y ha sido su única fuente de ingresos con la que sacó adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 62, is in a relationship and has four children, ages 28, 26, 22, and 20. Only two of them live with him; one works in agriculture and her daughter is in high school. José studied up to the third grade of primary school. His partner works as a housewife and only her and his two children live with him.

José works in agriculture and sells cattle. He has a 40-year experience in these activities. He learned to grow corn, beans and sorghum and to buy and sell animals. This is what he does for a living, and his son helps him. They both work around six hours every day.

José is requesting a loan to buy two cows. He is planning to feed them with what’s left from the harvests. In the future, he plans to sell their milk and make cheese, which will help him to contribute to the economy of the family. José hopes that God gives him a long life in order to continue doing what he likes to do. His work has been his only source of income, and has helped him to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: Hamidu is a 21-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He repairs and sells second hand fridges. He started the businesses with a hope of employing himself. He faces challenges of defaulters who delay paying him. However, he hopes of going back to school and expanding his business to new areas. Hamidu needs a loan to buy a gas cylinder for the fridge.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder for the fridge for his home products sales business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 51 years old. She is married and has five children. She is a business woman. Veronica is applying for a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second-hand clothes and she sells in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more second-hand clothes such as jackets, shirts, trousers, shorts, shirts, and other things to sell. Veronica started to opened her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $ 500.00. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market so many people are interested in her second-hand clothes. She is very happy to do her business, and with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to achieve good management for her business.

loans.use: to buy jackets, shirts, trousers, shorts, shirts, and other things to sell for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро 47-летняя портниха, проживающая в районе Дангара вместе с сыном, двумя дочерьми и невесткой. Мужа уже давно нет в живых. Старшая дочь Зухро помогает матери в деятельности, а младшая еще учится в школе. Сын работает мастером строителем, а невестка домохозяйка.
Зухро деятельный трудолюбивый человек. Она зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги швеи. Зухро занимается шитьем у себя на дому на протяжении двух лет. Она шьет женские национальные платья и ее услуга востребованная. Зухро хочет сейчас обновить старую швейную машинку на новую. Для этой цели она просит кредит. Благодаря новой швейной машинки Зухро сможет брать больше заказов и увеличить доходность своего швейного дела. Она ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
Zuhro is a 47 year old seamstress, living in the Dangara region together with her son, two daughters and daughter-in-law. Her husband has been dead for a long time. Zuhro's eldest daughter helps her mother with her business, and the youngest one still goes to school. Her son works as a master carpenter, and her daughter-in-law is a housewife. 

Zuhro is an energetic and hardworking woman. She earns a living by providing a sewing service. Zuhro has been sewing at her home for a period of two years. She sews women's national dresses and her services are in demand. 

Zuhro would currently like to change her old sewing machine and get a new one. With this aim she requests a loan. With a new sewing machine, Zuhro will be able to take more orders and increase the income of her sewing business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, and elei design.

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru:
Гулхумор обычная сельская женщина в возрасте 44 лет. Она уроженка района Дангара, где живет там вместе с мужем и шестерьмя детьми. Гулхумор занимается овцеводством, а муж работает в селе учителем. Гулхумор начала разводить овец и баранов 5 лет назад. Семья помогает ей в этой деятельности. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита является закуп пару овец и баранов. Гулхумор хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов и этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en:
Gulkhumor is a regular village woman of the age of 44 years. She is a native of the Dangara region, where she lives together with her husband and six children. Gulkhumor works with sheep farming and her husband works as a teacher in the village. 

Gulkhumor started breeding sheep and rams five years ago. Her family helps her with the business. The aim of the loan is to purchase some sheep and rams. Gulkhumor would like to increase the number of livestock and this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep and rams

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and operating a general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 47-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time sells hides and skin. He operates his business 12 hours a day, and has been running it for a period of 20 years. He started doing these businesses with a hope of employing himself. John needs a loan to buy hides and skin to sell.

loans.use: to buy hides and skins to sell.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen has requested a loan to buy second hand clothes for resale. She used the previous loan to buy more fresh food products to sell. She has also started selling second hand clothes using the proceeds from farming and selling fresh foods. In future she hopes to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Babara

texts.en: Babara is a 53-year-old widowed woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods and at the same time has a restaurant that she has been running for 30 years. Babara has great hopes of expanding her business to new areas although she is affected by the high rate of perish-ability of her products. She has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenda

texts.en: Bienvenda is 50 years old, married, and she has two children. She is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Bienvenda, together with her husband, catches fish to sell to earn income for their family. Monthly, she earns an amount of 10,000 PHP. The nets they use for fishing have deteriorated over the years. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and has applied for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP to buy new fish nets. Bienvenda is very thankful for the help provided to her.

loans.use: To buy new fish nets for fishing

loans.name: Maykell

texts.es: Maykell: Es un joven de 24 años, amable y emprendedor, originario de la ciudad de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, es casado, estudia su tercer año de Contabilidad; su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace un año estableció un pequeño negocio en el corredor de la casa de su mamá, donde vende granos básicos, embutidos, carne de pollo y gaseosas. Solicita financiamiento para poder comprar más productos para su pequeño negocio para generar más ingresos e incrementar el inventario de mercadería. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio de juegos de nintendo en Bilwi.
texts.en: Maykell: A 24 year old youth, kind and entrepreneurial, originally from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. He is married and in his third year of studying accounting. His wife maintains the home. One year ago, he established a small business in the hallway of his mother’s home where he sells basic grains, snack foods, sausages, chicken and soft drinks. He is requesting funding in order to buy more products for his small business to generate more income and to increase the inventory of merchandise. He dreams of ending up with a Nintendo games business in Bilwi.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snack food, sausage, chicken and soft drinks.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson has farm in Sindangan. This is his primary source of income for his family. Robinson makes it a point to have good land preparation in order to have maximum yield and to ensure that he will have good income. Recently, he needed an amount of money to pay for irrigation costs of which he loaned from Paglaum MPC. Robinson wishes to sustain his business and to be able to supply crops in the neigboring towns.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for irrigation to soften tillage pans

loans.name: Domestica

texts.en: Domestica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy trays of egg to sell for her buy-and-sell eggs business. Domestica has been in this business for 17 years now. Domestica earns additional income from selling vegetables. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Domestica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trays of egg to sell for her business

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.ru:
Hayrapet lives with his nice wife and small son in the village Nor Astghaberd of Syuink region. He has higher education and a specialty of electric-engineer. Hayrapet’s wife also has a higher education of pedagogue, but she does not work since she takes care of their child. He and his wife are thankful to Kiva lenders, who during several years helped them to pay for their tuition fees. Hayrapet several years till now works of his specialty, but he thinks of establishing a business which he hopes to be profitable for his young family. He decided to make boxes for bees and also all the needed attributes and sell it to bee keepers. 
This loan in an amount of 3000 US dollars Hayrapet will use for the purchase of planks for making boxes for the bees, also wax papers and wires, all these for sale and with great hope that his business will have success and be profitable for him.
texts.en: Hayrapet lives with his nice wife and small son in the village Nor Astghaberd of Syuink region. He has higher education and specializes as an electric engineer. Hayrapet’s wife also has a higher education of pedagogue, but she does not work since she takes care of their child. He and his wife are thankful to Kiva lenders, who during several years, helped them to pay for their tuition fees. Hayrapet has worked in his specialty for several years till now, but he is thinking of establishing a business which he hopes to be profitable for his young family. He has decided to make boxes for bees and also all the other needed attributes, for sale to bee keepers. Hayrapet will use this loan of 3000 US dollars for the purchase of planks for making boxes for the bees as well as wax papers and wires  - all these will be for sale and with the great hope that his business will have success and be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase plans for making boxes for bees as well as wax papers and wires

loans.name: Jefferson Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo es un joven muy amoroso con sus padres, tiene 22 años de edad y se dedica a atender una tienda que es de su madre, el crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería en  productos de tienda ya que cuenta Marcelo que lo que desea es mejorar este negocio y variar los productos para que su tienda sea más llamativa y mejoren sus  ventas, El sueño de Marcelo es que este negocio sea bueno y estable para que su madre obtenga sus ingresos y luego Marcelo piensa irse a trabajar en lo que encuentre para retomar sus estudios.
texts.en: Marcelo is a youth who is very caring for his parents. He is 22 years old and runs a store that is his mother’s. He needs the loan to buy store merchandise since what Marcelo says that he wants is to improve this business and vary the products so that his store becomes more appealing and so that his sales improve. Marcelo’s dream is for this business to be good and stable so that his mother earns an income and then Marcelo is planning on going to work wherever he can so that he can return to his education.

loans.use: to buy grocery store products.

loans.name: Nurhassanuddin

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Nurhassanuddin, a micro-entrepreneur from North Bogor, a suburban city located about 2 hours’ drive from Jakarta. Nurhassanuddin is married, and he and his wife have been blessed with a son. Nurhassanuddin works as a staff in a small company; he also sells mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment service as his side job. Nurhassanuddin met a Ruma field staff who introduced him to mobile airtime business with Ruma. He decided to become a Ruma agent and now he is selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments to his community. The extra money from serving such transactions will be allocated for his son’s education. For the last three months, Nurhassanuddin has been running the business really well, and now the demand for mobile phone airtime is increasing. Therefore, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. As the business runs, Nurhassanuddin plans to add more mobile services to his community, such as e-commerce for low income communities. In the photo, Nurhassanuddin is pictured sitting in his office. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Hermie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Hermie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Hermie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stephania

texts.es: Stephania,  inició su negocio motivada por ayudarle a su mamá quien le enseño el  arte de mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de las personas;  comenzó cortando cabello, y poco a poco aprendió a cepillarlo, posteriormente, cuando ya era casi una experta, compró sus herramientas de trabajo y empezó a laborar desde su casa y a hacer domicilios. Esta joven emprendedora con apenas 19 años de edad, ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio y tiene tres años en él,  ofrece los servicios de tinturación de cabello, blower, cortes de cabello, masajes capilares y todo lo relacionado con el cuidado del cabello. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio, en el que reside en el municipio de Soledad, pero también tiene otros clientes fuera de esta localidad, que solicitan de sus servicios por su buena atención y calidad en su mano de obra.  Sus insumos de peluquería las compras a proveedores especializados y sus pagos los realiza en efectivo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos de peluquería, como shampoo, masajes, tintes y otros productos para atender la demanda de clientes la cual incrementa por la temporada que se avecina: Diciembre mes de fiestas.  Stephania ha tenido que enfrentarse a desafíos, como las pocas oportunidades para su superación, así mismo ha logrado contrarrestarlas y por eso se esfuerza trabajando con mucho esmero. Sus metas a futuro son dejar planificado un buen negocio para su mamá y lograr tener un local en un centro comercial, lo cual es su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Stephania was motivated to start her business to help her mother who taught her the art of improving people’s personal and professional images. She started by cutting hair and little by little learned grooming. Later, when she was nearly an expert, she bought work tools and began to make house calls and to work from home. This entrepreneurial youth of barely 19 years of age has managed to maintain her business and has had it for three years. She offers services in hair dying, blow outs, hair cuts, scalp massages and everything related to hair care. 

Her main customers are her neighbors in the village in which she resides in the city of Soledad. She also has other customers outside of this area who request her services because of the quality and care in her workmanship. She buys her hair cutting materials from specialized providers and makes the payments in cash. She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first loan she is getting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this, she will buy hair cutting materials like shampoo, massage products, dye and other products to serve her customers' demands, which increase during the coming season: December, the month of celebrations. Stephania has had to face challenges, like the few opportunities for success. All the same, she has managed to counter these and this is why she strives to work with dedication. Her future goals are to leave a good business planned out for her mother and to have a business in a shopping center, which is her dream for success.

loans.use: to buy materials like shampoo, massage products and dye.

loans.name: Museven

texts.en:
Museven is 28 years old and married with three children aged five,three and one. The older two attend school already.
He is a boda boda (taxi) cyclist, who also brews local gin from sugar cane. He has a large clientele because his services are affordable for locals.  
Museven has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which will help him to buy a motorcycle. He will use it to provide boda boda services as he has been in that business for a long time and understands it well.
Museven's plan for the future is to build a house for his family and also buy more land to grow sugar cane. He is an innovative young man that has big dreams.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Emanuela

texts.en: Maria is 27 years old, and owns and operates a business of selling vegetables (cabbages, cucumbers, eggplants) in her village. Maria has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, a rake, shovel, hand gloves, and water tank, to assist in running the business. She will use her profits to expand her business. Maria became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, a rake, shovel, hand gloves, and water tank.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a fifty-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to her customers.  Eliza has been in the business for more than three years now. Eliza is a very hardworking woman.  Eliza is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments.  This loan will enable Eliza to increase her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Eliza hopes to make her business a success and more financially sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda,  beverages, rice, bread, biscuits, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc. for her general store business. Novelita has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from buying and selling goods.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
