loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married. She works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seventeen loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is forty-five years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Anita has a vegetable and fruit vending business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Anita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 42-year-old married man with 8 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He rides a motorcycle and at the same time sells fresh foods to supplement his income. He has been in this business for the last 13 years, and is hoping to educate all his children to higher levels of learning despite the challenges of bad roads and the high rate of perishability for fresh foods. Charles needs a loan to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena is twenty-eight years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, he sells apples, bananas and grapes. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Rozeena's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling, so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn more profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Rozeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use this amount to help her husband to purchase the above items.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos de 27, 25, 23, 20, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad, tres viven aparte y son independientes, cuatro viven con ella y estudian educación básica. Estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica, su esposo es agricultor y solo él y sus cuatro hijos viven con ella.

Juana es comerciante de lácteos, vende leche y queso desde hace 16 años y aprendió por iniciativa porque tenía que encontrar una manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y sacar adelante a su numerosa familia. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad, y le apoya na hija siempre que no está estudiando.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas para mejorar la producción de leche y queso para su negocio, aprovechando que le quedaran residuos de los cultivos para alimentarlas. Juana espera tener un lugar estable de venta actual mente vende por rutas, quiere hacerse de más animales y trabajar duro para su hijos que todavía están pequeños.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 45 years old, is married and has seven children of 27, 25, 23, 20, 17, 14 and 12 years old. Three live separately and are independent and four live with her and are enrolled in basic education. She herself studied until second grade of basic education, her husband is a farmer and only he and their four children live with her.

Juana is a dairy merchant. She has been selling milk and cheese for 16 years and she learned by initiative, because she needed to find a way to support her husband with the expenses for the house and to get her large family ahead. She carries her work out in the community and one of her daughters always helps her as she is not studying. 

She requests a loan to buy two cows to improve the milk and cheese production for her business, taking advantage of the left-overs of the crops to feed them. Juana hopes to have a stable selling place. Currently, she sells en route. She would like to have more animals and work hard for her children which are still small.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Ruth Nohemi

texts.es: Ruth Nohemi: Es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 31 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos: El mayor de los hijos tiene 13 años de edad, estudia su segundo año de secundaria y el menor de 9 años cursa su cuarto grado de primaria. Ruth es vendedora ambulante de productos Herbalife y otros productos. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar en Managua más productos que le permitirá vender más y a precios favorable a su clientela de Bilwi y poder incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en: Ruth Nohemi: She is an entrepreneurial woman, 31 years old and a single mother of two children. Her eldest child is 13 years old and studying in second grade. The youngest is 9 years old and in fourth grade. Ruth is a roaming saleswoman of Herbalife and other products. The loan that she is requesting is to buy more products in Managua that will allow her to sell more, at prices favorable to her customers in Bilwi, and to be able to increase her income. Her dream is to end up having a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products in Managua.

loans.name: Nancy Victoria

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 bebe de 4 meses de edad, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, joven primeriza y tiene que ser  paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Villa Adela de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Nancy es de tez morena, cabello negro,  baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado viven en la casa de la mama de Nancy construida de ladrillos y que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, leche, fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, etc., en una tienda de barrio que atiende de lunes a domingo, durante todo el día. “hace 2 años que tengo esta tienda, los vecinos me conocen y son clientes constantes ya que eran clientes de mi mama y yo continuo con el negocio de ella …” comenta. En su diario vivir ella siempre está buscando la manera de satisfacer a sus clientes, se acerca fin de año y un regalo común entre los vecinos son los panetones y galletas. Su sueño es tener una tienda tipo minimarket con variedad de productos. Ella desea realizar la compra de panetones por mayor, para ofertar a los vecinos, para que las utilicen como regalos en las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de panetones al por mayor.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 26 year old married woman with a 4 month old baby. Her business is a neighborhood shop for food staples.

She is a good, first-time mother and needs to be patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, entrepreneurial, responsible and hard working. She has her business in the Villa Adela area which has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 2-12 degrees Celsius.

Nancy has dark skin, black hair and is short. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish because of the local culture and the sales she makes.

She shares her life with her husband who works as a laborer. They live in Nancy’s mother’s home which is built from bricks and has potable water and electricity. Her business is selling food staples like: bread, sugar, milk, noodles, rice, drinks, cookies, etc from a neighborhood store that she tends all day from Monday through Sunday. 

“I have had this store for 2 years. The neighbors know me and are regular customers since they were my mother’s customers and I am continuing her business…” she comments.

In her everyday life she is always seeking ways to satisfy her customers. When New Years comes around cake and cookies are gifts shared amongst the neighbors. Her dream is to have a mini-marketplace with a variety of products. She wants to buy cakes wholesale to sell to neighbors for them to use as gifts for New Year’s parties. This is the first sequence of loans for this business with this institution that she is doing in 2 years. It is for these reasons that Nancy is requesting a loan to buy cakes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cakes wholesale.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling a variety of merchandise ranging from canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, soap and feed. She has been operating a store for almost four years now. She is a 46-year-old, married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 2 years old.

Loreta is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock and feed for the store. This stock will fill her store, causing more buyers to shop and purchase. Her daily income will slowly improve and this will enable her to provide her growing children with nutritious diets.

Loreta dreams to expand her livelihood to finance the education of her children, and to improve her status of living as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stock and feed for the store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is sixty years old and married with five children.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for thirteen years now and has borrowed eighteen times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rubielyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rubielyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Rubielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Jinky works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Jinky is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase fish to resell in her fish vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and she has now requested another loan to further build her businesses. Jinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Atika

texts.en:
Atika is thirty-three years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past few weeks, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Atika has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the costs of repairing rickshaw.

This loan will help Atika's husband to continue his business. Atika is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is a responsible, respectful, hardworking, honest and honorable mum. She lives her life to support her five children, unconditionally. The little children are everything to her. Thanks to them, she always has a smile to greet her customers, each of them who buy eggs from her. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. Philis has been relying on agriculture to make all of her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs such as fertilizer and fluctuations in market prices for her products, are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Philis remains positive and passionate about her economic activity.

Philis is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of her business that is least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheap to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Philis will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely, because it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work, since the cost of every input will be covered adequately. As a result, she will realize better-quality produce and higher yields. This loan will support economic activity and will improve her family’s living standards.

Your help will give Philis the opportunity to earn her own sustenance and to dream that she can help her parents cover their family expenses.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Ann Melody

texts.en:
Ann Melody works hard to support her family. Ann Melody is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Ann Melody requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to pay for internet and electric bills.

Ann Melody has been in this business for six years now.

Ann Melody would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet and electric bills

loans.name: Maria  Selina

texts.en: Maria is 28 years old. She owns and operates a small business of selling chips in her community to earn a living. Maria has requested a loan to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan, containers, wooden spoons, and a sack of salt to run the business. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business. Maria became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan, containers, wooden spoons, and a sack of salt.

loans.name: Luamoana

texts.en: Luamoana is a 46-year-old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of bingo in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years now. Luamoana has requested for a loan to buy a bingo machine, boxes of paper bingo as well as boxes of ink bottles to assist her in running this business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, boxes of paper bingo and boxes of ink bottles

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 61 years old, single, and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Letty is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Letty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en: Solialofi is a 43-year-old mother with 3 children and has a small business of selling vegetables such as cabbages, eggplants and cucumbers in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over 2 years now. Solialofi has requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Solialofi hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Nobena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nobena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and buying and selling charcoal. Nobena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nobena has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Salcita

texts.en: Salcita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of  her fishing business. Salcita has been in this business for 2 years now. Salcita earns more income from a buy-and-sell fish business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Salcita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is thirty-three years old and married with two children, who are in school. Lorie works very hard to provide for them.

Lorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lorie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries etc for her general store business. Veronica has been in this business for 3 years now. Veronica earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetic products. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries etc

loans.name: Rusmaria

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Rusmaria, one of Ruma agent who lives in Cibubur. Cibubur is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Rusmaria is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with two children. Rusmaria has been joining Ruma for more than two years and she is one of the Ruma agents who is continuously showing good improvements in running her business. She puts a Ruma banner in front of her house to tell people in her community that she is a certified Ruma agent who sells mobile phone airtime credits and provides utility bill payment services. She feels glad to become a Ruma agent because she can provide mobile services in her community, thus helping people who experience a lack of access to such services. As the business runs, Rusmaria is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Rusmaria is standing in front of her house where she usually serves many transactions from her customers who are mostly her neighbors. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Nicola

texts.en: Nicola is a 40-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a business in her village to earn a living. Nicola has requested for a loan to buy a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a sack of flour and a box of tinned fish to assist her business. She has been doing this business for more than 2 years now. She will expand her business using her profits. Nicola joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, sack of rice, sack of flour and a box of tinned fish

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Grace is 40 years old and has four children who are in school. Mary Grace has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Mary Grace has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Mary Grace has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 42-year-old female Ugandan who is divorced. She has 8 children, whom she takes care of and they are aged between 2 and 22, of which five of them attend school. Aisha is a business woman - since 2002, she has been selling foodstuffs and old clothes at a local market. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy food stuffs especially green plantain for resale during the Christmas season because demand will be high. Her dream is to educate all her children. She is however quick to mention that she is affected by the seasonality of her business and competition from other business people who deal in the same products. She is hard working.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs especially green plantains for resale during the Christmas season

loans.name: Prudence Group

texts.fr: Prudence est un groupe de six femmes battantes qui vient de solder son premier prêt kiva sans difficultés. Avec pour responsable Christine, ses dames ont besoin encore de ce crédit pour renforcer leurs activités.Avec le crédit précédent, Christine a pu diversifier son menu, scolariser ses enfants et payer ses employés. Christine a besoin à nouveau du prêt pour renforcer son restaurant et continuer à satisfaire sa clientèle.Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de ses employés et de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
'Prudence' is a group of six determined women who have just repaid their Kiva loan without any problems.  They would now like another loan in order to further strengthen their businesses.

The group representative is Christine.  With the previous loan, she diversified the menu in her restaurant business, paid for schooling for her children and paid her employees.  She plans to use this new loan to strengthen her business and meet the needs of her customers.

Her profits will allow her to improve the working conditions of her employees and take care of her family.

loans.use: to build up her restaurant business and satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia  Ruth se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario y la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de prosuctos de belleza, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth works as an elementary school teacher from 8:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and also continues selling beauty products. She hopes her work will allow her to get ahead in life, and her dream is to have a clothing store.

Ruth is asking for a loan to buy a television for her house. She is very happy about this opportunity and she promises to pay back her loan installments.

loans.use: buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en: Laina is a 26-year-old mother with 4 children. She had a small business of sewing clothes and sells them in her community to earn a living. Laina has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and tape measures to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years now. She will use her profits to expand her business. Laina became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and tape measures

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a 32-year-old, married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling beer, sodas, biscuits, soap and others. He is a very hardworking man who loves his business. 

He started the business in 2007 and has managed it well. He is affected by clients who do not want to pay their debts. He wants a loan to buy general merchandise to sell such as bread and cakes.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell such as bread and cakes.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a kind person. She was born in 1965. She lives in a small town. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. Sharofat wants to be helpful for her family, and she is trying to be useful. She has decided to open her own business. She plans to buy livestock. 

As a retailer, she wants to feed cattle then sell them in a market. With this aim she took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women’s organization and got a certificate. She hopes her business will go well. Sharofat needs financial support to buy livestock for opening a business.

loans.use: to buy livestock for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es: Alma Iris es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad, madre de familia quien es muy activa y con muchos deseos de tener éxito en la vida. En la comunidad donde ella reside la fuente principal de ingresos es la siembra y cultivo de café. Esta actividad la aprendió de su padre. Con su madre aprendió otras actividades como: tamalitos de frijoles, nacatamales, pan, quesadillas, empanadas y el rico chilate. Alma Iris desde muy temprano se levanta a realizar las actividades del hogar, preparar el desayuno para sus hijos los cuales son 5 y posteriormente despacharlos para la escuela, luego de terminar sus labores domésticas Alma Iris se dirige a su trabajo en el campo, limpieza de las parcelas de tierra ya que se aproxima la temporada del invierno y necesita tener acondicionado el terreno donde va a sembrar el café y de esta manera tener un cafetal más limpio, grande y productivo. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se gana la vida también como agricultor dando mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Alma Iris como meta la elaboración de una enramada  para vivero con 4000 plantitas y limpiar 10 tareas de terreno para sembrar de esta manera aumentar la plantación y producción para la próxima. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos bien preparados económica, espiritual, académica y profesionalmente para que tengan mejores oportunidades y una mejor calidad de vida ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando y no quiere para sus hijos le mismo que para ella por la falta de apoyo económico por lo cual espera ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva.
texts.en:
Alma Iris is a young woman. She is a 27-year-old mother and a very energetic woman with a strong will to get ahead. Coffee growing is the main activity where she lives. She learned this activity from her father. Her mother taught her to cook bean tamales, nacatamales [another type of tamales], bread, quesadillas, empanadas and a delicious chilate [a beverage made with chili, corn, cocoa and spices].

Alma Iris wakes up very early to take care of the household chores, make breakfast for her five children, and send them to school. Then she goes to work, she cleans the plantations in order to be prepared for the upcoming rainy season. She needs to prepare the soil where she will sow coffee in order to have a cleaner, larger and productive plantation. Her partner helps her. He also works in agriculture, taking care of their coffee plantations.

Alma Iris has is planning to build a greenhouse for 4,000 seedlings and clean 0.6 hectares in order to increase her production. Her biggest dream is to see her children grow economically, spiritually, academically and professionally, so that they can have better opportunities and better living conditions. She could not continue studying because she could not afford it and does not want her children to have the same fate. This is why she hopes to receive support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy 4,000 coffee seedlings and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose is 41 years old and has one child.

She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushrooms, soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run the business. 

Sose hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushrooms, soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Nilson Manuel

texts.es: Nilson, es un emprendedor hombre de 58 años de edad, en su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, el cual funciona desde el año 2010, ofrece los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras por horas en el domicilio del cliente, este negocio maneja un buen flujo de caja puesto que los servicios se cancelan una vez han sido prestados.  Sus clientes se encuentran ubicados en el barrio donde él reside en el municipio de Barranquilla y la idea de negocio surgió por la necesidad que había en el sector, el inició tan solo con dos lavadoras y actualmente tiene nueve lavadoras al servicio de la comunidad.  Nilson trabaja junto con su cónyuge en el horario de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. de lunes a domingo. Él  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una lavadora y le hará mantenimiento a una lavadora que se encuentra averiada.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en Maicao – Guajira, donde manejan precios más convenientes,  esta inversión mejorará los tiempos de respuesta y con ello la productividad. Nilson es padre de tres hijos y dos hijas, el desea a largo plazo mejorar su vivienda y continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Nilson is an entrepreneur. He is 58 years old and has had a washing-machine rental since 2010. These machines can be used by his clients in their own homes. The business has a good cash flow, since clients pay for the service right after they have used it. His clients are people from his neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla. He had this business idea when he realized that there was demand for it. He started off with two machines; today he has nine machines available for his community. Nilson works with his wife, from 6am until 7pm, Monday to Sunday.

He is requesting a CrediKiva for the first time with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy a washing machine and will give maintenance to one that is out of service. He will buy the machine in Maicao, Guajira department, where prices are lower. With this investment, his response times will improve, as well as his productivity.

Nilson has three sons and two daughters. He would like to improve his house and continue expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and repair one that is out of service.

loans.name: Deris Javier

texts.es:
El señor Deris  es un joven responsable y trabajador vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad al sur de Honduras.
Deris se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos esto lo hace desde su casa de habitación y muchas veces se traslada a la ciudad  a venderlos con la ayuda de su esposa engorda los cerdos para revenderlos a un mejor precio.
Deris con el préstamo espera comprar más cerdos ya que por la época navideña es una buena ocasión para obtener mejores ganancias, también espera  poder mejorar su  negocio y brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes que le visitan.
Deris uno de sus sueños es comprase  un terreno.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Deris is a responsible and hardworking young man who lives with his wife in a community in southern Honduras. Deris works buying and selling pigs. He does this from his house and often he goes to the city to sell them with the help of his wife. He fattens the pigs to re-sell them at a better price. 

With the loan, Deris hopes to buy more pigs because the Christmas season is a good occasion to obtain better profits. He also hopes to improve his business and offer the customers who visit him better service. 

One of Deris' dreams is to buy a plot of land. 


Choluteca, Honduras – November, 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Doan's Group

texts.en:
Doan’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Doan makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Doan safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Toem's Group

texts.en:
Toem’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Toem makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and sells groceries at home to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each Toem to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer de 54 años de edad que se gana la vida con su pequeña tienda de productos básicos desde hace 22 años en la cual vende productos como: bebidas frías, lácteos, detergente, cereales, jabón, huevos, etc., con lo que trata de darle lo mejor a su familia. Ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de 15 años de edad, que es su mayor alegría y la razón de todos sus esfuerzos. Sonia desea que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias y tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, bebidas frías, cereales, detergente, jabón, etc. Para poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia, 54 years old, makes a living selling basic groceries, such as cold drinks, dairy products, detergent, cereals, soap, eggs, etc. She's had this small business for 22 years which she keeps trying to give the best to her family. 

She lives in her own home with her husband and her 15-year-old daughter who is her greatest joy and the reason for all her efforts.

Sonia would like her business to generate more profits, so she wants to stock a bigger selection and quantity of items to offer to her customers. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in dairy products, cold drinks, cereals, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products, cold drinks, cereals, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Suliana

texts.en:
Suliana is a 21-year-old mother with two children. 

She runs a small business of selling pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years and hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future.

Suliana has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a box of chicken, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a box of chicken, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon.

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is 45 years old and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Tapuni has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and wooden spoons to assist her with the business. She will use her profits to expand her business and to provide her family’s daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de pollos y tambien la socia vende artesania, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el  crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
texts.en:
The member Margarita continues raising chickens, and she also sells artisan works. She fattens and grows the chickens, and then sells them in different markets.

She has been working in this business for many years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell her chickens. She asks for this loan to buy chickens, as well as food for them.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and food for the chickens.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Nazaria earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Nazaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables, spices, meat, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Merlita has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

In the future, Merlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, actualmente cuenta con una tienda mejor surtida, sus clientes están satisfechos y las demandas están creciendo, esto se debe a la buena inversión del préstamo anterior.
Está solicitando más capital para comprar tres estantes y mercadería para tienda, de esta forma continuara su buen desarrollo en el mercado e incluirá nuevos productos de temporada navideña para tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
José has a better-stocked store, his customers are satisfied, and demand is growing because of his good investment with the previous loan.

He's requesting more capital to buy three bookcases and store merchandise.  That way he'll continue to make good progress in the market and include new seasonal Christmas products to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy three bookcases and store merchandise to continue making good progress in the market

loans.name: Piseth's Group

texts.en: Piseth’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Piseth works as a hairdresser and he also does extra work as a seller by selling Khmer medicine to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en: Feliciano is a fisherman from Leyte, Philippines.  He is sixty years old, married and has three dependents. Feliciano has worked in his business for more than five years now. He also sells fruits and vegetables in the market. These are the sources of his income.  Feliciano is asking to take a loan to buy more fish, fruits and vegetables to sell. With this money, he will be able to improve his business and therefore augment his income and profit.  In the future, Feliciano hopes to make his business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fish, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a woman of 41 years. She has five children. 

She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Mareta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Mareta joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for the next round for the chicken coop.

loans.name: Taufanua

texts.en:
Taufanua is 57 years old and has four children. 

She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Taufanua has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Stacy

texts.en: Stacy is a thirty-one-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children. Stacy is engaged in retail sales of dried fish. She has been in the business for more than ten years now. Stacy is asking to take a loan to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. This loan will help Stacy improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more. In the future, Stacy hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, propane gas, etc., to continue making and selling her delicious tortillas and pupusas.

loans.name: Bernalyn

texts.en:
Bernalyn works hard to support her family. Bernalyn is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Bernalyn requested a PHP 2,2000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Bernalyn has been in this business for one year now.

Bernalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is forty-seven years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bernardina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bernardina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and rice for her food production business.

Bernardina has been in this business for six years. Bernardina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and rice for her food production business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from working in a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dúo Dannys Group

texts.es:
DUO DONNYS
Este dúo sigue siendo integrado por las señora Lucia que sigue luchando y perseverando en los negocios que a Dios gracias  han logrado mantener, como líder sigue la señora Lucia en su negocio de venta de tortillas en 3 tiempos a toda su clientela que visita su negocio el cual es ubicado en su domicilio, también doña Lucia los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en un mercado fuera de la localidad de San Juan Sacatepéquez, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz, y ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
DUO DONNYS 

This duo continues to include Lucia, who is still fighting and persevering in her businesses, that thank God she has been able to maintain. As a leader, Lucia continues in her business selling tortillas for all three meals. Her customers visit her at her business, which is located in her house. Also, on weekends, Lucia works selling traditional clothing in a market outside of the community of San Juan Sacatepéquez. At this time, she is asking for a loan to buy corn and clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas, and to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven luchador y responsable  vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad muy productiva al sur de Honduras.
Elmer su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos esto lo hace desde su casa de habitación y muchas veces se traslada a distintas comunidades cercanas a la suya venderlos con la ayuda de su esposa. 
Elmer con el préstamo espera comprar más cerdos  para engordarlos y así venderlos a mejor precio en esta época navideña y obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida, también espera  poder darles mejor atención a sus clientes.
Elmer uno de sus sueños construir su propia casa.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Elmer is a responsible and tenacious young man who lives together with his wife in a productive community in the south of Honduras. 

His business is the buying and selling of pigs. He does this from his home, and many times has traveled to different communities close to his own to sell his pigs, with the help of his wife. 

With this loan, he would buy more pigs, to fatten them and sell them at a better price, especially during the Christmas season. This would allow him to earn more, improving his quality of life. He also hopes to be able to better serve his customers. 

One of Elmer's dreams is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar is 48 years old and she lives in Kadjaran, a city of Syunik region. Tsovinar is a widow and she lives now alone; her daughter is already married and her son now temporally lives and works in the Russian Federation. Tsovinar has a vocational education since she graduated from financial-economical college with the specialty of economist. 

For several years she was engaged in a clothes trading business, which for some time was a profitable business for her, but 2 years ago she gave it up and now she has another one. She has a small food market of her own, where she sells a great assortment of candies, cookies, cakes and pastries.  She says she has a lot of loyal customers and the place of her market is central and it attracts many people during a day. Tsovinar will be thankful to have this loan. She wants to buy a large assortment of candies for the coming New Year’s holidays, since it is one of the main products that can nicely decorate the holiday table.

loans.use: to buy a large assortment of candies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! 

Meet Eunice, who has something that many farm workers in Kenya don't - a small plot of land on which to grow her own maize, fruits, vegetables and keep dairy cows. Eunice lives with her family of five in a two-room mud-thatched house in Kiminini, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Eunice completed her secondary school education, thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but she never advanced beyond this. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. She started farming, and has been farming for the past ten years, and through mixed farming she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Mweusi' (meaning Black). 

Although Eunice passionately loves farming, she faces a challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Eunice comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will help her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will help Eunice irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. This loan will turn around the life of Eunice, as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of this “precious commodity”, thus saving her time. Help this enterprising mum who wants to move forward with a loan!

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is forty-five years old and married with three children. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is forty-nine years old and married with one child. Carina works very hard to provide for them.

Carina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, eggs, cereals, canned goods, coffee and soft drinks.

Carina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, eggs, cereals, canned goods, coffee and soft drinks. 

In the future, Carina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, eggs, cereals, canned goods, coffee and soft drinks

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de dos novillas, con la intención de poder obtener leche y queso y con ello aumentar el numero de animales y espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Miguel is 42, married, and lives with his wife and two children. With his loan he will buy two heifers in order to obtain milk and cheese and increase his number of livestock. He hopes to obtain some income and improve his family's living conditions. He wants to invest more in his cultivation and reach some goals. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma is 19 years old and runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Jemma has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profits. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lumière  sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Minkoungo. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums) de qualités différentes, céréales (riz), pommes de terre et thés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme arrêtée sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums) de qualités différentes ; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 cartons de  pommades et 4 cartons de parfums en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Minkoungo et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en: The women of the Lumièr egroup are for the most part married in monogamous households. They are average 39 years old and have five children. They all live in  Minkoungo, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako; they met each other through neighborhood connections and their businesses in Minkoungo. The group members run small businesses in cosmetic products (pommades and perfumes) of different quality, grains (rice), potatoes, and tea. In the goal of augmenting their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. Mrs. Rokia (the one standing in the photo) has a grand reputation in selling cosmetic products (pommades and perfumes) of different quality; she plans to use her loan to buy 4 boxes of pommades and 4 boxes of perfume at wholesale in Bamako. She sells these for cash or credit in Minkoungo and door to door to a clientele made up of mostly women. Mrs. Rokia hopes to earn with this loan a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest into her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 26 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.  

Jenny requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cleofe is forty-seven years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Cleofe has a general store business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cleofe has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cleofe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 31 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Erna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delilah works hard to support her family. She has an Internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from house rental.

Delilah is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and pay electric and Internet bills for her Internet café business.

Delilah has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and pay electric and Internet bills.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells food supplement products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of food supplements to sell in her business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food supplements to sell for her business.

loans.name: Nanmun

texts.en:
Nanmun is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For twenty years, her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi so bad that it requires maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nanmun has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nanmun's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. This will allow him to provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nanmun also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nanmun is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, está progresando con su negocio, hoy tiene más clientes en su tienda por lo que las demandas son muchas, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar agua, sodas, jugos, etc. al por mayor para tener un depósito de bebidas, de esta manera tendrá ingresos extras y surtirá la tienda.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener mercadería disponible para mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes, su negocio tiene mejor imagen, cancelo su deuda y su familia tiene mejores circunstancias de vida y un techo más seguro.
texts.en:
Candelaria is progressing with her business. Today she has more clients in her store so the demand is great. She is requesting a new loan to buy water, sodas, juice, etc wholesale in order to have a stock of drinks. This way, she will have extra income and stock her store.
Her previous loan helped her to have merchandise available to maintain her clients' loyalty. Her business has a better image. She repaid her debt and her family has better living circumstances and a safer home.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, juice, etc wholesale in order to have a stock of drinks.

loans.name: Daysi Carolina

texts.es: Daysi agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. Nuevamente, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para su negocio dado que desea aprovechar esta temporada navideña que es la época donde más demandan sus productos. Con el monto solicitado comprará variedad de frutas y verduras(papas, plátanos, tomates, cebollas, chiles, etc.) para la venta.
texts.en: Daysi is grateful for the support that she received in the past for her fruit and vegetables business. She is requesting a new loan from FUSAI for her business since she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season when her products are in greatest demand. With this loan, she will buy a variety of fruits and vegetables (potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, onions, chills, etc) for sale.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, onions, chilis, etc for sale.

loans.name: Tavau

texts.en:
Tavau is a 50-year-old woman with three children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei (fabric design) printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Tavau has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than three years. Tavau hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 25 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mirna Cristabe

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado seco desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pescado seco por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, age 37, lives in her own home with her family. She has sold dried fish for several years. She sells her products in the various markets and has many clients. She is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of more dried fish in order to be able to continue with her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish wholesale.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El 12 de diciembre, una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca se viste de colores debido al festejo en honor a la virgen de Guadalupe. Algunas de las actividades económicas más importantes de la región son la pesca y la siembra de caña por lo que en este día hay dos desfiles muy importantes: la de los productores de caña y la de los pescadores que es la más llamativa ya que tiene lugar en la laguna. Los pescadores salen en sus lanchas para ir a los puntos donde normalmente trabajan, la fe los motiva y en ese día piden a la virgen que les ayude en su actividad. 

En esta comunidad llena de tradiciones se formó el grupo llamado Las Gaviotas cuyo nombre se debe al gusto que tienen los integrantes por estas aves ya que verlas en la laguna es señal de que hay más peces. Los miembros de la asociación son:

Lidia - Venta De Cosméticos 
Angela y Blandina – Venta De Abarrotes
Juana- Venta De Comida
Clara, Guadalupe, Antolina - Venta De Peces
Mauricia- Venta De Pollo

Doña Guadalupe se caracteriza por su sonrisa, está casada con el señor José y hace 28 inició a vender mojarra apoyando a José en la actividad que practica desde joven. Guadalupe sale todos los días a vender las mojarras que su esposo pesca durante 24 horas seguidas para obtener 60 o 70 kilos de mojarra. 

Con las ganancias obtenidas y los prestamos anteriores la pareja ha ido modificando su herramienta de trabajo: han comprado nuevos telares, cubetas, madera para reparar las dos lanchas que tienen y dos motores y para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Con el nuevo préstamo que están solicitando nuevamente comprará telares para utilizar como red y para reparar una lancha. “Continuaré vendiendo hasta que ya no pueda hacerlo, me agrada lo que hago, he conocido a muchas personas, distintos lugares, y me sirve para inculcar a mis nietos el hábito de trabajar”.

*La fotografía se capturó en la tienda de Doña Ángela, lugar donde el grupo se reúne cada catorcena para pagar su cuota del préstamo. Doña Guadalupe viste de color azul.
texts.en:
On December 12, a community in the Mexican state of Oaxaca is decorated in vibrant colors to celebrate the holiday honoring the Virgin of Guadalupe. Some of the most important economic activities in this region are fishing and sugar cane production and for this reason there are two important displays of festivity, one for the sugar cane producers and one for the fishermen. This second one is particularly unique as it takes place at the lake, where the fishermen go out in their boats to the places they usually fish. Motivated by their faith, they ask the Virgin to help them in their work. 

In this community full of tradition there is a communal loan group called Las Gaviotas [The Seagulls] whose name comes from the happiness that the members feel when they see these birds on the lake, because it means there are lots of fish. The members of this loan group are Lidia, who sells cosmetics; Angela and Blandina, who sell groceries; Juana, who sells food; Clara, Guadalupe, and Antolina, who sell fish; and Mauricia, who sells chicken.

Guadalupe is known for her smile. She is married to Jose and has been selling mojarra [a fish similar to tilapia] for 28 years, helping to support her husband who has been a fisherman since he was a young man. Every day Guadalupe goes out to sell the fish that her husband catches. He works 24-hour shifts to catch 60 or 70 kilos [130-155 lbs.] of mojarra.

With their earnings and with previous loans, Guadalupe and Jose have been able to improve the tools of their trade. They have bought new nets and buckets, wood to repair their two boats, and two motors, and also cover their household expenses. With this new loan they are asking for, they will buy more nets and will repair one of their boats. Guadalupe says "I will continue to work selling fish until I can't any longer. I like what I do. I have met many people and been to many new places, and it helps me instill in my grandchildren a good work ethic."

The photograph was taken in Angela's store, where every two weeks the members of this loan group meet to pay their loan installments. Guadalupe is the woman dressed in blue.

loans.use: buy new nets and repair a boat.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 47 años de edad vive ene casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, comercializa una variedad de productos, tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carmen is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for a number of years. She sells a variety of products and has many clients. She is requesting a loan to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. so she can have greater income and a better quality of living,

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

Remedios has been in this business for 11 years. Remedios earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story:

“I am sure both of my parents love me and wish to give me everything that they hadn’t themselves. One of the important things in our life is getting a good education, especially a higher education. Because of the lack of higher education, both my parents never had a stable job or stable income. After the collapse of USSR, our country faced economic crisis and all people just sold different stuff at the market. So did my parents. After getting married and having a baby, they also were ready to do any business that required no special skills: cooked somewhere, was a taxi driver, security guard, etc. Most of the time my mother spent at home looking after her children, as the family is the most important thing in this life. 

"I know that there are a lot of families in Kyrgyzstan that have the same situation as ours. The people, who live day-to-day, and don’t lose a hope of bright future. Nowadays, we have an opportunity to be better, to change our family and country for the better. The solution will be a good education. One can achieve success, if he/she tries and is not afraid of changes. I went to kindergarten, finished school and now I am a freshman at AUCA. 

"Since I was 14 years old I dreamed to enter AUCA. AUCA is unique in Kyrgyzstan and Central Asia. A liberal arts model of education truly provides students of the knowledge and skills to compete in a rapidly changing world. At AUCA, we are able to learn in an atmosphere where critical thinking is valued and encouraged. It is exciting to be part of a community where you are challenged to think logically, engage in serious inquiry, and develop effective written and oral communication skills. These skills give us a competitive advantage throughout our professional careers.

" This Kiva loan will allow me to pay for my university tuition fee and to continue striving for a better future.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables for making sauces

loans.name: Tausuai

texts.en:
Tausuai is 26 years old. She runs a small business of selling sandwiches, fried chicken and sausage in her community to earn a living. 

Tausuai has requested a loan to buy bread, a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, containers, aluminum foil and tomato sauce to assist her in running the business. 

She hopes to use her profit in the near future to build a small restaurant and provide for her family's daily needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, containers, aluminum foil and tomato sauce

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
María Gladys tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo. Tiene 01 hijo a cargo. Vive en anexo la Characarilla. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Gladys se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y aves de corral(patos, pavos, entre otros). Desde hace más de 02 años. Y su esposo percibe ingresos por brindar servicios agrícolas. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de carneros para poder cumplir con la demanda insatisfecha de su zona, así ella podrá aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Gladys is 55, married, and lives in her own home with her husband. She has one child under her care. She lives in the La Characarilla annex. Her family is united. She lives in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock. The community is located in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.
María Gladys raises and sells rams and barnyard birds (ducks, turkeys, and others). She has done this for over two years and her husband gets an income from providing agricultural services. This loan is for the purchase of rams in order to be able to cover unsatisfied demand in the area. This way, Maria Gladys will be able to increase and diversify her stock, which will allow her to increase and improve her income and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rams.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Natividad works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Natividad is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 49 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarita has been farming vegetables for 26 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yofesi

texts.en:
Yofesi is a 45-year-old married male with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Yofesi operates a retail shop of general merchandise, alongside a butcher shop for extra income. He has been in that business for four years. 

Yofesi has a dream of  expanding his business. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Yofesi wants money to buy goats for slaughtering during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Arceli Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arceli Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling fruits. Arceli Josephine is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arceli Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. 

Van makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina es un Mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos, dos varones de las edades de 4 años gemelos y una hija de 10  años, y su negocio es la confección de polleras.
Ella es emprendedora buena Madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días ya que trabaja por pedido, ella tiene su taller en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; una comunidad campesina que agrupa a restaurantes que se especializan en comida típica y donde se elabora la ‘chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz).
Corina es de tez morena, cabello negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español. y su hija que estudia en la escuela, toda la familia vive en una casa propia en obra gruesa que cuenta con luz y agua de pozo. Durante casi toda su vida viene construyendo su casa, poco a poco y ladrillo a ladrillo; logró construir dos habitaciones una cocina, un baño y lavandería, el siguiente paso es la instalación de agua potable, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde atado a una cuerda.
