Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa, y desea realizar una inversión en la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida segura. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución.
Es por esos motivos que Corina solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su casa y brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Corina is a 39-year-old woman who is married with three children (twin four-year-old boys and a ten-year-old daughter). She makes pollera skirts as a business.
She is an enterprising woman and a good mother, very responsible and hard-working. She works every day since she works on orders. She has a workshop in the Sacaba area, a farming community with restaurants that specialize in traditional food and where chicha (a fermented corn drink) is made.
Corina is dark-skinned with black hair. She is of medium height. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she speaks Spanish. Her daughter studies at school. The whole family lives in their own roughly-built home which has electricity and well-water. She has been building her home almost all her life, bit by bit and brick by brick. She was able to build two rooms and a kitchen, a bathroom, and a laundry room. The next step is to install drinking water. She currently gets water manually from a well with a bucket attached to a cord. Her dream is to finish building her home. She wants to invest in the installation of drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room in order to give her family a secure life. This is her first loan sequence with the institution.
For these reasons, Corina is requesting a loan for the installation of drinking water in her home in order to provide a secure home to her family.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her home.

loans.name: Ulufale

texts.en:
Ulufale is an 18-year-old mother with one child. She operates a small business of selling vegetables in stores to earn a living. 

Ulufale has requested a loan to buy vegetables seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Ulufale will use her income to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 36-year-old married man from Gaza city. He was living with his wife and kids in a small house in the city. During the last violence on Gaza, his home was directly damaged. It must be repaired urgently because of the winter.

Hamza took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him repair his house by adding windows and doors and fixing part of the construction. By taking this loan, Hamza will be able to cover part of the urgent expenses he has.

Hamza appears in the photo next to his damaged home.

loans.use: to repair his house by adding windows and doors, as well as fixing part of the construction.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 22 years old with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cakes in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Sina has requested a loan to buy ice bags, sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers to assist in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for family needs.

Sina joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy ice bags, sacks of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers for her  ice cake business.

loans.name: Manuel Javier

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Manuel se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cuyes, etc. con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio. Su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Manuel solicita el préstamo para la compra de más animales (patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cuyes, etc.) dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en la crianza de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Manuel piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old and lives with his wife in Oyotún. Thie population of this area works in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo, part of Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Manuel works raising and selling animals like ducks, chickens, guinea pigs etc. He has more than 10 years experience in the field. His business is located at his house. Manuel is requesting a loan to buy more animals (ducks, chickens, roosters, chicks guinea pigs etc.) This investment will help him have more variety and productivity in raising animals which will have a large influence on his business.Manuel is thinking of increasing his stock of animals to be able to fulfill the varied tastes and needs of his clients in the area, to be able to increase his income and improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to raise and sell animals like ducks, chickens chicks, roosters, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy raw ingredients and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her food stall business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lanie wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a young farmer from Sambirir, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is a mother of three children who has been doing farming for the last five years so that she can supplement her income from the salary she gets. Agnes does crop farming and cattle keeping, and she enjoys farming a lot. 

Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and diseases. This has made her seek a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a sheep. With this sheep, her projections are that by the end of the year, the sheep will have given birth to at least four other sheep. Through sheep-keeping, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will be increasing her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 42-year-old single woman with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods, the business she has been running since 2002. She faces a challenge of low capital; however, she has hopes of building her own house to stop renting. 

Alice has asked for a loan to buy cement and pozzolana and to pay labor for the people building her residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and pozzolana and pay for labor

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Margarita also earns additional profit as a rice dealer. She dreams that her business will continue to flourish and all her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulayim

texts.ru: Гулайим, 48 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Гулайим в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулайим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 15 овец. На участке мерою 0,50 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулайим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Гулайим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulayim is 48 and married and the mother of four children. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 1999. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 0.5 hectares of land where she grows corn for her own use and for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulayim has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her head count. She plans to put increased profits into further building up the number of animals she has.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Linet. She is a 47-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in Kenya. Linet and her husband are blessed to have six children.

Linet has been a mixed farmer for more than twenty years. She keeps poultry for eggs, dairy cows, and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Linet is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya.

Linet is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Linet seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.” With your help, Linet will be able to pay for university fees for her children and fulfill one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rema works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rema is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Rema has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 60 years old and widowed with six children. Felicidad works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Felicidad has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as candies, sanitary pads, diapers, shampoo, bath soap, milk, etc. 

Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tamales su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora los alimentos, Angela vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, tomates, pollos, verduras, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Angela has worked for the past 8 years making and selling tamales. Her business is located in her home. She has many clients because of the high quality of her foods. Angela lives in her own home with her four daughters.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn, tomatoes, chicken, vegetables, etc. in order to continue her work and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, tomatoes, chicken, vegetables, etc. for making tamales to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Él posee una pequeña tienda, la cual ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia desde hace tres años. Jorge es un hombre visionario quien siempre esta pendiente de su familia y busca las formas de llevar el sustento a su hogar. Jorge ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de tienda en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como: cereales, café, aceite, golosinas, detergente, etc. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que quiere aprovechar el incremento de demanda de esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his mother. He has a small store, which he has managed to establish in his home three years ago. Jorge is a visionary man who always is available for his family and seeks ways to bring sustenance to his home.

Jorge has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in his business, a store, in purchasing products in bulk such as cereal, coffee, oil, sweets, detergent, etc. He hopes to be able to have this support give that he wants to take advantage of the increased demand of this Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase cereal, coffee, oil, sweets, detergent, etc., for the store.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Teresa, 61 years old, lives in her own house with her grandson. She has worked selling clothing for a number of years.  She sells it as a street vendor through the different neighborhoods. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothing in bulk to continue with her sales and in this way have more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
This is Ursula. She is 57 years old and she resides in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for 10 years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Ursula would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ursula hopes to extend and expand her store. She dreams to give her children a good life by providing all their needs in education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

Divina has been in this business for 30 years. Divina earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 28-year-old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a tea room and at the same time has a retail shop. She faces challenges of low capital; however, she dreams of having a well-stocked shop and expanding her business to new areas. Alice has asked for a loan to help her buy beers, sodas, sugar and juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, sugar and juice to sell

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, está utilizando de buena manera los préstamos que se le otorgan, su negocio se mantiene surtido y tiene ingresos estables con los que está manteniendo un buen record crediticio. Su familia está viviendo con un mejor estilo de vida, también hay un miembro nuevo.
Nuevamente está necesitando un crédito con el que comprara tomates, cebollas, manzanas, granadillas, zanahorias, etc., tendrá mercadería fresca para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en: Carolina is using her loans that she is getting in a good way. Her business is well stocked and she has stable income with which she has been maintaining a good credit record. Her family is living a better living style and also has a new family member. Once again she needs a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, apples, passion fruit, carrots, etc. to have fresh merchandise to cover demand from her clients.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onion, apples, passion fruit, carrots etc. to have fresh merchandise to cover demand from her clients.

loans.name: Armida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Armida, se dedica a las actividades domésticas y a vender pupusas, tacos, refrescos, etc., vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya cuentan con su propio hogar, pero en ocasiones le ayudan económicamente; su negocio nace por motivación propia y necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, anteriormente tenía un comedor bien establecido el cual cerro por falta de recursos económicos que le permitieran competir en el mercado, por lo que actualmente solo cuenta con la venta de refrescos, bebidas y meriendas.
Ella invertirá el préstamo en chicharrón, quesillo, loroco, harina, azúcar, bebidas y otros materiales para la elaboración de la venta, con la  compra mejorarán la productividad, la atención, las ventas y ganancias.
Armida aspira tener un negocio más amplio, incluir nuevos productos, contratar a una persona para que le ayude en el negocio, cancelar sus deudas y continuar aportando para tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Armida takes care of the household chores and sells pupusas, tacos, soft drinks, etc. She lives with her husband and their children, who now have their own houses but sometimes help them out economically. Her business was born from her own motivation and need to support her husband with the household expenses. Previously, she had a well-established restaurant which closed due to lack of economic resources that would have permitted her to compete in the market, so she currently only sells soft drinks, drinks, and snacks. 

She will invest the loan in pork rinds, quesillo [farmer's cheese],  loroco [an edible flower], flour, sugar, drinks, and other materials to make her products for sale, with the purchase, her productivity, service, sales, and earnings will increase.

Armida aspires to have a larger business, include new products, hire someone to help her with the business, pay off her debts and continue to support her family to have a better life style.

loans.use: to invest in pork rind, quesillo [farmer's cheese],  loroco [an edible flower], flour, sugar, drinks, and other materials to make her products for sale.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de repuesto para bicicletas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para bicicletas por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan, 54 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked selling bicycle parts for a number of years. His business is located in his home and he has many customers for the quality of his products. He is asking for a loan to purchase bicycle parts in bulk and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle parts in bulk.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el caserío de Pampa Grande en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca,en la sierra norte de Perú, donde cultiva café.

Amado se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 8 años. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para obtener mejores rendimientos en su cultivo de café, pago de peones para realizar las buenas prácticas agrícolas en su cultivo de café, mejorando su productividad y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amado is 37 years old and lives with his spouse and their three children in the village of Pampa Grande, in Callayuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, in the northern mountains of Perú, where he grows coffee.

Amando has worked growing coffee for 8 years. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers to get better results from his coffee crop and pay the laborers to do the good agricultural practices in his coffee crop, improving its productivity and, in the end, his quality of life.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa is 57 years old and married with three children.

Genesa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genesa has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from her internet cafe.

Genesa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nahuakhua Group

texts.en:
Neevan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Neevan, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  

Neevan is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Neevan due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, the decreased time spent foraging for wood, and the decreased amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters for access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coconuts, walnuts, strawberries, guava, bananas, milk, sugar, wafers, and napkins.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 2 años de edad. María  es pequeña comerciante y se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa. María desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar variedad de prendas de vestir como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa interior, etc. Con el fin de aumentar las ventas en esta temporada navideña y poder así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is 23 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, ages 5 and 2. María is a small businesswoman and works selling a variety of clothing. María wants to invest in her business so she is asking FUSAI for this loan to purchase a variety of clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, lingerie, etc. with the end of increasing her sales in this Christmas season and in this way be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, dresses, pants, lingerie, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Marleni Vitalia

texts.es:
Marleny, de 20 años de edad, está soltera, estudió hasta bachillerato, debido a que no tenía suficientes recursos económicos, no pudo continuar en la universidad con sus estudios.- Actualmente, vive con su madre y tres hermanos más.	 

Marleni, se dedica a los oficios domésticos  desde que era pequeña, su madre le enseño este oficio y ahora ella trabaja en otras casas  ayudando con los oficios domésticos y gracias a este trabajo ella pude suplir los gastos en su casa y ayudar a su madre en lo necesario. Ella trabaja todos los días de 6 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde y el lugar de trabajo queda cerca de su casa. 

Marleni, utilizará el crédito para comprar 15 bolsas de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, pagará mano de obra y otras cosas necesarias para la construcción de un cuarto más en su casa.- Hará esta construcción para  poder tener más espacio en su casa y poder vivir mejor con su madre y sus hermanos, de esta manera darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Los planes a futuro de Marleni son: seguir estudiando en la universidad y obtener su título universitario, conseguir un buen trabajo y también, ayudar a sus hermanos a que estudien y que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Marleni, 20 years old, is single and went to school to the secondary level. Due to not having sufficient economic resources, she couldn't continue on with an university education. Currently she lives with her mother and three other siblings. 

Marleni has taken care of the household tasks since was young. Her mother taught her this work and now she works in other houses helping with the household chores and thanks to this work she can help with the household expenses and help her mother with what she needs. She works every day from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening and the place where she works is close to her house. 

Marleni will use the loan to purchase 15 sacks of cement, bricks, sand, iron, and will pay labor costs and other things necessary to build an additional room in her house. She will do this building to be able to have more room in her house and to be able to live better with her mother and siblings, and in this way give them a better quality of life.

Marleni's future plans are to continue her education in the university, get a university degree, get a good job, and also to help her siblings so they can go to school and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of cement, bricks, sand, iron and to pay labor costs and other things necessary to build another room on her house.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 21 años de edad, tiene una hija de dos meses y estudió hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación económica de sus padres, él tuvo que trabajar para terminar sus estudios,  pero no pudo continuar en la universidad ya que tuvo que trabajar a tiempo completo para sostener a sus padres y su hija. 

Miguel, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y otros granos que incluyen la canasta básica, también es jornalero, aprendió este trabajo gracias a su padre, quien desde que era pequeño le enseño esta labor y gracias a él, ahora puede llevar el sustento a su familia, para  llegar a los lugares donde trabaja camina aproximadamente una hora y cuando trabaja cerca de su casa media hora o veinte minutos.- Como jornalero Miguel gana poco dinero al día, pero eso le ayuda a poder sostenerse a su familia.

El préstamo lo necesita para reparar el techo de su casa y poder comprar teja, madera y pagar la mano de obra, debido a que el techo está en mal estado y cuando llueve se moja todo en su casa.- Con el crédito, el podrá hacer su trabajo y podrá darle a su familia un lugar más seguro donde vivir, sin miedo a se caiga el techo o que se mojen en el invierno.

Miguel, planea entrar al ejército, para poder ayudar a nuestro país con más seguridad y al mismo tiempo poder apoyar a su familia económicamente y así puedan tener lo necesario para vivir con mayores comodidades.- También, desea poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 21, has a two-month-old daughter and studied up to the bachelor's level. Because of his parents' economic situation, he had to work to finish his studies, but he was not able to continue in university because he had to work full-time to support his parents and his daughter.
Miguel plants corn, beans, and other basic grains. He is also a day labourer. He learned this work from his father, who taught him this work when he was young. Thanks to this, Miguel is able to support his family. To get to the places where he works, he walks about an hour. When he works close to his home, it takes him half an hour or twenty minutes. As a day labourer Miguel makes little money every day, but it helps him to support his family.
He needs this loan to repair the roof of his home: to buy tile and wood and to pay the labourers. The roof is in bad condition and when it rains the entire house gets wet.
With this loan, he will be able to do his work and provide his family with a more secure place to live, without fear that the roof will fall in on them or that they will get wet in the winter.
Miguel plans to join the army in order to help our country to be more secure, and to help his family economically so that they can have what is necessary to live with greater comfort.
He also wants to be able to build his own home.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home: to buy tiles and wood and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera, vive con sus hijos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones del terreno, clima y agua potable para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad y poder cumplir con algunas metas personales y de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isabel, 26, is single and lives with her children, who are her highest priority.

With her loan she plans to buy some calves for fattening that have good characteristics for rapid development and weight gain.  The idea is to take advantage of the space she has for pasture and the good soil, climate, and potable water conditions for keeping and raising calves to sell for meat in the future.

With this purchase Isabel will be able to do another job and simultaneously have some savings.  That way she can continue to get more animals and invest more in her property so she can achieve some personal and family goals.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She hadn't had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start poultry farming

loans.name: Ahongyai Group

texts.en: Ngern is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Ngern's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Ngern, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Ngern and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Ngern's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Saira Maricela

texts.es:
Saira tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 1 año y vive con sus padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales, solicita el credito para incrementar el negocio con la compra de cerdos y gallinas para aumentar la produccion y poder vender y asi obtener un incremento de dinero y mejorar su economia. Las compras realiza en San Miguel cada 8 dias, en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a su hijo.
texts.en:
Saira is 21 years old, single and has a one year old son. She lives with her parents in San Miguel, Bolivar province in the community of Salado Chico, which belongs to the rural district of San Francisco.

She works in agriculture and raising animals. She is requesting a loan to expand her business buying pigs and chickens to increase her production to be able to sell and thus have an increase in income and improve her finances. She makes her purchases in San Miguel every 8 days. In her spare time she likes to be with her son.

loans.use: to expand her business of raising animals.

loans.name: Sostenible Group

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 44 años, es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, desde hace cuatro años  se dedica a la venta de mazamorra (dulce). Sus ingresos le permiten mantener a su familia ya que ella solventa todos los gastos de su hogar. El mayor sueño de Sonia es darles estudios superiores a sus hijos. Ella requiere el préstamo para  comprar más insumos para la preparación de este dulce. Sonia viste polo de color amarillo. 
Sonia está muy contenta por el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas kiva.
texts.en: Sonia is a 44 year old mother of 4 minor children. For the past 4 years she has been selling mazamorra (a traditional dessert). Her income allows her to support her family as she can pay all the household expenses. Sonia's big dream is to provide higher education for her children. She needs a loan to buy more supplies to make this dessert. Sonia is wearing the yellow colored shirt. Sonia is very happy for the support offered by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making mazamorra (a traditional dessert).

loans.name: Ivona

texts.en:
Ivona is a 27 year old mother with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling chips in her community to earn a living. 

Ivona has requested a loan to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, containers, wooden spoons, and sacks of salt to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. 

Ivona became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, containers, wooden spoons, and  sacks of salt.

loans.name: Phondeua Group

texts.en: Phet's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Phet's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Phet is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Phet, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Phet and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Phet's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella posee una venta de maletines, carteras y bolsones tiene de diferentes estilos, los productos que comercializa son de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ella quiere acrecentar su negocio es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas productos por mayor para tener menores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 35 years old, lives with her life partner and their two children in her own house. She has a business selling shoulder bags, purses and backpacks of different styles. The products that she sells are of very good quality and she sells them at accessible prices, and for this reason she has gotten many customers. She wants to expand her business and for this she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will permit her to purchase more products in bulk to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase shoulder bags, purses, and backpacks in bulk.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDIA  est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la transformation de grains de néré à l’image de BINTOU qui est la deuxième  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités transformation de grains de néré.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la transformation de grains de néré en soumbala. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU  auprès des grossistes. Elle vend ses produits à BAMAKO par sac de 100kg en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en: SIGUIDIA is a group in the DANAYA association in OUELESSEBOUGOU. It groups together women who met each other through relatives and neighbors. They are on average 28 years old and are married with on average three children. They run different businesses, such as transforming African locust tree seeds, like BINTOU, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo. They live in big traditional families in OUELESSEBOUGOU in the prefecture of KATI (in the Koulikoro region, in the republic of Mali). They have been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought after in their business of transforming African locust tree seeds. With the concern of satisfying the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to integrate the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan. BINTOU, who is the president of the group, is well known in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and excels in transforming African locust tree beans into soumbala (pounded or ground, cooked, and fermented seeds used in cooking). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacks of African locust tree seeds. She stocks up in OUELESSEBOUGOU from wholesalers. She sells her products in BAMAKO by 100-kg bags at retail, for cash or credit, to a mixed clientele. She hopes for a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy African locust tree seeds to make sounbala

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myrna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Myrna has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana, de 31 años de edad, está acompañada y estudió hasta séptimo grado, comenta por la situación económica de su familia no logro seguir estudiando, su compañero de vida se dedica a los trabajos de siembras de hortaliza, ellos solo tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 8 y 10 años de edad.

Ana, se dedica a vender en una tienda que tiene en su casa, tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, pues ella ha visto que le genera buenos ingresos para su familia, al principio ella inició con pocas cosas para vender, pero al pasar de los años las ventas han aumentado.- Su esposo también la apoya en la tienda, en atender a sus cliente para ofrecerles un mejor servicio. 


Anteriormente Ana, obtuvo un crédito que le ayudo a comprar lo que necesita para su negocio, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, pretende seguir mejorando su tienda y comprar más productos que no ofrece actualmente a sus clientes.- 


Con  la ayuda del préstamo ella comprara más productos y surtirán más su tienda, de esta manera Ana espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus cliente, esto le generará mayores ganancias que posteriormente invertirá, pues el sueño de ellos en tener un supermercado en donde se pueda comprar de todo y en un mismo lugar.- También esperan ser distribuidores de productos por mayoreo a otras tiendas.

Ana, desea en un futuro tener una casa más grande en donde puedan vivir más cómodamente con su esposo y su hijos, también su deseo es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que sean personas de bien en la sociedad y que en el futuro también logren emprender un negocio, como el que tiene ella en su casa.
texts.en: Ana is 31 years old is in a relationship and studied up to grade 7. She comments that because of her family's situation she couldn't study more. Her life companion works growing vegetables. She only has two children aged 8 and 10. Ana works selling in a store that she has in her house. she has been doing this for about two years. She sees that she has generated good income for her family. At the beginning she had very few things to sell but with the passing of the years her sales have increased. Her husband also helps her in the store taking care of clients to provide them with better service. Previously Ana got a loan which helped her to buy what she needed for her business. Today with this new loan she wants to continue improving her store and buy products that she currently does not offer to her clients. With the help of the loan she will buy more products and stock her store more. In this way she hopes to provide her clients with better service which will generate more income which she will reinvest. Her dream is to have a supermarket where you can buy everything in one place. She also wants to be a distributor of goods to other stores. Ana in the future would like to own a bigger house where she can live more comfortably with her husband and her children. She also wants her children to continue to study and that they become useful members of society and in the future they too can have a business like the one she has in her house.

loans.use: to buy more products to better stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Sabrositas Group

texts.es:
Jhovana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 4, 5, 9 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es sincera, emprendedora, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; mineros relocalizados del occidente del país y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron. Su siguiente generación, en su mayoría se ocupa del comercio y manufactura. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Jhovana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la tercera de la izquierda, usa blusa celeste y abraza a 2 niños). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus 4 hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, Viven en una casa alquilada, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación y ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura y venta de productos cosméticos, para ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, comercio que realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y mercados de la zona. “La ropa reciclada empieza a convertirse en una alternativa más de consumo, carente de estigmas, y es un negocio en auge para algunos emprendedores…” comenta. Su sueño s tener su tienda propia en un lugar fijo para dejar de ambular. Ella desea aumentar su stock de prendas de vestir de segunda mano, realizando la compra por mayor, para abaratar costos y generar mejores ganancias. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jhovana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jhovana is a 30-year-old woman, who lives with her partner and has 4 children, ages 4, 5, 9, and 10 years old. Her business is selling second-hand clothing.

She is sincere, enterprising, generous, understanding, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" zone, an area characterized by its massive population growth; miners relocated from the western part of the country and ethnic groups such as "Los Ayoreos", native of the region, have established themselves. The next generation mostly works in trade and manufacturing. The climate is warm, tropical and humid, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade. 

Jhovana is olive skinned, short, has long black hair she keeps tied up, dark eyes, her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work she does (she is the third from the left, is wearing a light blue shirt and is hugging 2 children).  She shares her live with her partner, who works in construction, and their four children. The older two go to school and the younger two aren't yet at school age. They live in a rented house that has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her desires to better herself and to improve her children's quality of life caused her to organize a communal bank of people with various businesses such as silverware sales, cell phone sales, chicken sales, flower sales, tea service, tailoring shop, and cosmetics sales to expand their businesses. Her business is selling second-hand clothing, which she does as a street vendor in the different fairs and markets in the zone. "Recycled clothing has begun to be a more popular alternative, without stigma, and is a business that is on the rise for some entrepreneurs..." she says. 

Her dream is to have her own store in a permanent location to be able to stop being a street vendor. She wants to increase her stock of second-hand clothing, purchasing them in bulk to reduce costs and generate more earnings. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Jhovana asks for a loan to purchase second-hand clothing in bulk to supply her customers.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing in bulk to supply her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tree seedlings and hire labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and seasonings

loans.name: Suny Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Suny Carolina de 23  años de edad, vive con sus  padres y su hijo en casa de sus padres,  se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada,  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras. 
Suny es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos  fardos de ropa como vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, braseares, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela y al mismo tiempo mejorar su futuro junto con su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Suny Carolina, 23, lives with her parents and her son in her parents' house in a town in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  She has earned a living  with her used clothing business for three years.

Suny's an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  She strives every day to improve her quality of life.

She's requesting the loan to buy two bundles of clothing because she sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, brassieres, etc.  She plans to improve her income and her quality of life with the support of this loan.

She's a new client who wants to work with Prisma.  Her dream is to have a good business and expand her clientele at the same time she improves her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, December 2014

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, brassieres, etc. for her business

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa La señora Sonia Elizabeth tiene una tienda desde hace 8 años, la cual está ubicada en la calle principal de su colonia, vendiendo productos de consumo diario como maíz, arroz, frijol, golosinas, gaseosas, todo tipo de pastas como los fideos, sopas instantáneas, todo tipo de galletas, un poco de verdura como tomate, papa, güisquil, zanahoria, cebolla, gaseosas como lata, litros, jumbos, normales y grandes. También se dedica a la venta de productos de temporada y las fechas navideñas se aproximan,  siempre invierte en la compra de juegos pirotécnicos como volcancitos, estrellitas, ametralladoras en diferentes tamaños y precios, debe comprar por docena y por caja para que le salga a buen precio, le hace falta dinero para poder recoger los pedidos que ya hizo y por tal motivo necesita hacer otro préstamo para terminar de pagar y recibir su mercadería.
texts.en:
Manos Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa Duo

Sonia Elizabeth has had a store on the main street of her town for eight years.  She sells basic consumer products such as corn, rice, beans, snacks, spaghetti and all types of pasta, instant soup, a variety of cookies, some vegetables (tomatoes, potatoes, güisquil, carrots, onions), and soda (canned, liters, jumbo, normal, and large).

She also sells seasonal products, and the Christmas season is approaching.  She always invests in fireworks of different sizes and various prices, such as volcanos, stars, and firecrackers.  She has to buy by the dozen and the box to get a good price.

Sonia Elizabeth doesn't have the money to be able to collect the requests she made already, so she needs another loan to finish paying and collect her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products to sell (fireworks stars, volcanos, etc.)

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her tailoring business and food sales business, hoping to increase her income for her family.

loans.name: La Tormenta Group

texts.es:
Alina es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos 10 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta a crédito de ropa y zapatos.
Ella es activa, generosa, amable, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona ‘sur’ de la ciudad, un área popular caracterizada por el creciente comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura entre 27 – 32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Alina es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio y por cultura general (sentada, usa malla verde, cartera y pantalón obscuro). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y hacen deporte, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Las ganas de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con actividades como; tapizado de autos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos y ropa a crédito; ella se encarga de buscar a clientes en oficinas y comercios o lugares fijos de trabajo para ofertar sus productos a crédito. “mi comienzo fue con tropiezos porque algunos clientes dejaban sus trabajos y era difícil encontrarlos, con el tiempo aprendí a evaluar mejor y actualmente no cuento con clientes perdidos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda fija. Ella desea aumentar su stock de productos para contar con mayor variedad y ofertar a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alina solicita un préstamo para aumentar su stock de ropa y zapatos para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes .
texts.en:
Alina is a single 37-year-old woman with two children ages 10 and 13. She sells clothing and shoes on credit.
She is active, generous, kind, independent, responsible, and hard-working. She sells on the street in the southern zone of the city, a popular area characterized by growing commerce and manufacturing in all areas. The region has a tropical climate with a temperature between 27 and 32 degrees centigrade year round.
Alina is dark-skinned with chestnut hair. She is short and her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish for business and because of the general culture. (She is shown seated in the green shirt with dark pants and purse). She shares her life with her children, who are in school and do sports. They live in a rented brick home that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.
Her desire to get ahead brought her to form a communal bank with people whose businesses include car upholstery, smoothie sales, cell phone case sales, coca leaf sales, quinoa juice sales, perfume sales, pop sales, and pollera skirt sales. They formed the group to request a loan and improve their businesses.
Alina sells shoes and clothing on credit. She looks for clients in offices and businesses or fixed work locations and offers her products on credit. "I started off with setbacks because some clients would leave their jobs and be difficult to find. In time I learned to be a better evaluator and I now have no lost clients" she says.
Her dream is to have a store. She wants to increase her stock in order to have a greater variety to offer her clients. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the ten years she has had this business.
For these reasons, Alina is requesting a loan to increase her stock of clothing and shoes in order to offer greater variety to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
Líder es una persona de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 bebe de 3 meses de edad, él se dedica a la venta y elaboración  de empanadas tradicionales.
El es buen Padre, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona plan 3000 de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Lider es de tez morena, cabello negro, alto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas que el vende; Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas tradicionales. La empanada es una fina masa de pan, rellena con una preparación salada o dulce y cocida al horno o frita. Las más comunes con; de yuca (a base de yuca, rellena de queso o carne), de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), cuñapes (harina de yuca, con queso), masaco (plátano con queso) y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en un horno en su casa para luego salir a vender en su puesto de venta. “la comida tradicional es insuperable, muchas personas  no paran de comer durante todo el día y eso es bueno para mi …” comenta. Su sueño es tener un salón de té donde pueda  hornear y vender sus empanadas y atender a muchos clientes. El desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de mesas, sillas y diferentes tipos de harina por mayor, para brindar mayor comodidad a sus  clientes Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lider solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y harina por mayor.
texts.en:
Líder is a 28 year old person, lives with his partner, has a 3-month-old baby, and works making and selling traditional empanadas. 

He is a good father, enterprising, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in the "Plan 3000" zone in the city, and area characterized by informal trade in all areas. It has a warm climate, tropical and humid, with an ambient temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Lider is olive-skinned, has black hair, is tall, his native language is Guaraní, and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture. He has his life with his partner who works making the empanadas that he sells. His business is making and selling traditional empanadas. The empanana is a fine bread dough, filled with a savory or sweet preparation and baked or fried. The most common are yucca (a yucca base, filled with cheese or meat), rice (a base of rice flour), cuñapes (yucca flour with cheese), masaco (plantains with cheese), and others. He does this work every day of the week in an oven in his house to later go out to sell at his food stall. "Traditional food is unbeatable, many people can't stop eating it all day and this is good for me..." he says. His dream is to have a tea salon where he can bake and sell his empanadas and serve many customers. He wants to expand his business through the purchase of tables, chairs, and different types of flour in bulk, to offer more comfort for his customers. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Lider asks for a loan to purchase tables, chairs and flour in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Jezabel

texts.en:
Jezabel works hard to support her family. Jezabel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Jezabel requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Jezabel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gloria is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gloria has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for six years. Helen earns more income from firewood vending.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Aida is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Rigael Oliverio

texts.es:
Rigael tiene 25 años de edad es soltero vive solo en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla San Francisco .

El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado hace alguños años, solicita el credito para la compra de ganado e invertir para luego vender y obtener ganancias y asi poder mejorar economicamente, su sueño es comprarse una casa y terrenos para sembrar, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es arriesgarse en su trabajo, en su tiempo libre le gusta estudiar y la natación.
texts.en:
Rigael, 25, is single and lives alone in the community of Salado Chico in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.  He belongs to San Francisco Communal Bank.

He has earned a living for several years buying and selling livestock.  He's requesting the loan to buy and invest in livestock.  He'll sell it later to earn a profit so he can improve financially.

Rigael's dream is to buy himself a house and some land to farm.  The challenges he faces are taking chances in his job.  In his free time he likes to study and swim.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Blanca Elvia

texts.es:
Blanca vive en San MIguel de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico vive sola y pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y papas, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y semillas para sembrar y asi mejorar la produccion gracias al credito podra realizar las compras necesarias para los sembrios, su sueño es mejorar su situación económica y su desafio es las plagas en los sembrios, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Blanca lives by herself in San MIguel, Bolivar province in the community of Salado Chico which belongs to the rural district of San Francisco.

She works in agriculture growing corn and potatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to plant to increase her production. Thanks to the loan she will be able to make the needed purchases for her crops. Her dream is to improve her financial situation. Her challenge is the infestations of her crops. In her spare time she likes to p[lay sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Buenos Aire Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres que son muy alegres (Alicia, Maggy y Lumeriana), las tres son miskitas que viven en Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de frito, chiverías y comercialización de pescado; se organizaron hace seis meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Maggy: Es integrante del grupo solidario Buenos Aires; es una señora amable y emprendedora, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 20 años, es vendedora ambulante de frescos naturales, maní, chicle; se moviliza en un triciclo donde lleva los productos que vende. De esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con  establecer su pulpería donde pueda ofertar otros productos básicos, mejorar sus ingresos económicos y tener una mejor  calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three very joyful women (Alicia, Maggy and Lumeriana). They belong to an ethnic group called Miskito and live in Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are all entrepreneurial women who fight every day to expand their small business. They sell fried food, snacks and fish. Six months ago, they came together in order to have access to the group loans offered by Pana Pana.

Maggy is one of the members of the Buenos Aires group. She is a kind and entrepreneurial woman. She is 49, married and has five children who are adults now. She has been working as a street vendor for twenty years, selling natural juices, peanuts, and chewing gum. She uses a rickshaw to transport her products. In this way, she generates her own income and contributes to the home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products and increase her income. She dreams of opening a grocery store so she can sell other types of products, improve her income and enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, chewing gum, fruits and sugar.

loans.name: Tynymkan

texts.ru: Тынымкан 25 лет, замужем, есть восьмимесячный сын. Образование высшее, Тынымкан уже 4 года работает адвокатом, получая ежемесячную заработную плату в размере чуть более 12,200 сом (KGS). Все полученные средства она старается вкладывать в воспитание сына, так как он главная ценность в жизни Тынымкан. В квартире с наступлением зимы стало очень холодно, а в доме теперь появился маленький ребенок. Поэтому Тынымкан с мужем решили утеплить свое жилье. Тынымкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пластиковых окон, и замену балконной и входной дверей. Утеплив таким образом свое жилье, Тынымкан позаботится о здоровье ребенка.
texts.en: Tynymkan is 25 years old, married and has an eight-year-old son. She has a college education. Tynymkan has been working as an attorney for 4 years, receiving a monthly salary just over 12,200 som (KGS). She tries to invest all of the earnings into raising her son because he is the priority in Tynymkan's life. Their apartment has gotten cold with the onset of winter, but now the home has a small child in it. This is why Tynymkan and her husband decided to warm up their home. Tynymkan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy plastic windows and replace their balcony and front doors. Tynymkan will take care of her child's health by insulating her home.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and replace the balcony and front doors in order for her home to retain heat during the winter

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 51 years old and married with twelve children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Fatima is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fatima has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Neirene

texts.en:
Neirene is 38 years old. She is a hardworking woman who runs a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage,cucumber, and eggplant) at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Neirene has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her with the business. Neirene hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en:
Seira is a 23-year-old woman with one child. She owns and operates a small business in her community to earn a living. 

Seira has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, a rake, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves and safety boots to assist in the business. She has been farming for more than three years. 

Seira will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, a rake, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Abed El Motaleb

texts.en:
Abed El Motaleb is a 22-year-old single man who has worked in repairing motorcycles for two years to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family. 

Abed El Motaleb is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. He has a good reputation among his customers for his honesty and proficiency. He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary repairing tools which will facilitate his business and help him in providing his customers with quick and better service.

Abed El Motaleb hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary repairing tools to provide his customers with better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Hugo Nelson

texts.es: Hugo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposa en casa propia. El posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Hugo solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hugo is a very hard-working and responsible person who dedicates himself completely to his work. He lives with his two children and his wife in his own house. He has sold fruits and vegetables for a number of years, located in the municipal market that is near his home. Hugo asks for a loan to be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk and to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru:
Сохибназар молодой начинающий предприниматель из района Руми. Этому джентльмену всего 24 года. Она женат, и уже имеет 8 месячного ребенка. После появления ребенка Сохибназар начал смотреть на жизнь по другому. Он нашел свой смысл жизни, стимул и мотивацию. 
   Сохибназар с братом занимался ремонтом домом. Их работа является сезонной и Сохибназар остается без источника дохода в зимний период. Он должен обеспечить свою семью всем. Соибназар хочет быть хорошим мужем и отличным отцом. Чтобы принести в дом новый источник дохода Сохибназар хотел устроиться дополнительную работу, но к сожалению, ему это не удалось. Он не отчаялся и решил создать свой бизнес. Сохибназар будет заниматься продажей детской одежды на местном рынке. Он уже нашел торговую точку, но ему не хватает денег для приобретения первоначального товара. И он решился обратиться за кредитом. С надеждой на то что Вы ему поможете.
texts.en: Sohibnazar is a young, new entrepreneur from the Rumy district. This gentleman is only 24 years old. He is married and already has an eight-month-old child. Sohibnazar started to look at life differently after having a child. He found the meaning of life, calling and motivation. Sohibnazar and his brother are involved in repairing houses. Their work is seasonal, and Sohibnazar is left without an income source during the winter periods. He has to provide everything for his family. Sohibnazar wants to be a good husband and an excellent father. To bring in a new source of income home, Sohibnazar wanted to find supplementary work, but, unfortunately, he could not do so. He did not despair and decided to start his own business. Sohibnazar will be involved in selling children's clothing at a local market. He already found a retail outlet, but does not have enough money to buy his initial merchandise inventory, so he decided to request a loan with the hope that You will help him.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing in order to start his own business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo, es acompañado, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su compañera de vida y dos hijos, su actividad económica es ofrecer sus servicios de motorista a otras personas, que tienen un vehículo pero por la experiencia que tiene don Eduardo hacen uso de sus servicios para realizar largos viajes, ya tiene  22 años de desempeñar esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., según sea la demanda.
Invertirá el crédito en hacer algunas reparaciones a los vehículos que él ha utilizado y han tenido algún daño por imprudencia de otros conductores, pues cuando pasa un evento desafortunado los costos son descontados de su sueldo, espera mejor el servicio que ofrece y tener clientes satisfechos.
Sus sueños son comprar su propio vehículo para mejorar su situación económica y resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is partnered and his nuclear family is made up of his life partner and two children. He works offering his services as a driver to other people who have a vehicle but, for Eduardo's experience, make use of his services to take long trips. He has 22 years of experience in this work. His schedule is 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, according to demand.

He will invest the loan to make some repairs to the vehicles that he has used and that have some damage due to the carelessness of other drivers, since when an unfortunate event happens, the costs are taken from his wages. He hopes to improve the service he offers and have satisfied clients.

His dream is to purchase his own vehicle to improve his economic situation and pay off his debts.

loans.use: to make some some repairs on the vehicles that he has used and which have some damage from the carelessness of other drivers.

loans.name: Tuliva

texts.en:
Tuliva is a 27-year-old mother with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living.
